classes.name: Tank
classes.description: A resilient frontliner who protects allies by absorbing damage.

features.name: Champion
features.description: Gain +10 Wounds, suffer no penalties from wearing armor, and may carry 3 hefty items before becoming Pinned. You have 4 Champion Points. Regain 1 when you Press On, all on a long rest, when you kill an enemy, or force one to submit. You can use a champion point to either: When you attack gain [[1d6]] to the check and damage, or remove one condition and heal for +5

choices.name: Hefty Weapon
choices.description: (Str; 2 hand, Hefty Strength as Physical damage)

choices.name: Siege Crossbow
choices.description: (Str; 2 hand, Hefty, Medium Range, mechanical, reload; [[2d6]] Piercing)

paths.name: Champion
paths.description: The Champion stands as a paragon of battle, a warrior whose very presence on the frontline inspires courage and strikes fear into enemies.

features.name: Champion Maneuver
features.description: When you use Champion Strike, you can make your attack as a Half-Action instead of an action.

progressionSteps.name: Valiant Defender
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, reduce damage an ally takes by half if they are within reach.

progressionSteps.name: Shield Wall
progressionSteps.description: As an action, grant you and nearby allies +10 armor until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Iron Will
progressionSteps.description: Using Champion Strike grants +10 armor until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Last Stand
progressionSteps.description: Upon reaching 0 wounds, gain +1 wound and take an immediate action (once per long rest).

progressionSteps.name: Valiant Defender II
progressionSteps.description: Valiant Defender now prevents all damage instead of half.

progressionSteps.name: Champion’s Strength
progressionSteps.description: Champion’s Endurance heals +10 wounds and removes a condition.

progressionSteps.name: Battle Roar
progressionSteps.description: Spending a Champion Point lets all allies within short range make a melee attack as a free action.

progressionSteps.name: Rallying Cry
progressionSteps.description: Grant yourself and allies 3d10 temporary armor if they can hear you and are within short range.

progressionSteps.name: Street Brawler
progressionSteps.description: Champion Strike allows a free grapple attempt; while grappling, gain an extra unarmed attack per turn.

progressionSteps.name: Unstoppable Champion
progressionSteps.description: Spend 4 Champion Points to become immune to damage and conditions until the end of your next turn.

paths.name: Child of Fenrir
paths.description: The Child of Fenrir is a path shrouded in the ancient and formidable legacy of the legendary wolf Fenrir. Those who walk this path channel the untamed might and the deep-rooted spirituality of the wolf, embodying a force that is both awe-inspiring and fearsome. As a Child of Fenrir, you are not just a warrior; you are a symbol of primal power and freedom, a living testament to the wild spirit that Fenrir represents. Your presence on the battlefield is more than physical - it is a manifestation of the raw essence of nature’s most revered and mystical predator. This path is a calling for those who resonate with the strength, agility, and spiritual depth of the wolf, transcending species and form to tap into something ancient and powerful at the very core of existence.

features.name: Fenrir's Bite
features.description: You have a bite that deals damage equal to your Strength check. On a success plus, recover wounds equal to half the damage dealt.

progressionSteps.name: Lupine Agility
progressionSteps.description: Gain +2 Agility. You have advantage on checks for agility that involve movement, traversal, or speed.

progressionSteps.name: Fenris' Whisper
progressionSteps.description: You can communicate telepathically with canines and wolf-like creatures within medium range. Additionally, you can sense the intentions of any predatory creature, giving advantage on Survey checks against predatory creatures.

progressionSteps.name: Howl of Chains
progressionSteps.description: As an action, unleash a howl affecting creatures within short range. These creatures you choose must make a Spirit check or become enveloped in shadow chains causing the pinned condition until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Predator's Instinct
progressionSteps.description: You can track creatures by scent and have advantage on Survival checks to track living creatures. Additionally, while in shadow, gain advantage on Stealth checks, ideal for ambushes or evading detection.

progressionSteps.name: Spiritual Resonance
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, tap into the spiritual energy of Fenris to sense magical auras within medium range. This can be used to identify spellcasters, magical traps, or enchanted objects.

progressionSteps.name: Alpha Dominance
progressionSteps.description: You have power over beasts. As an action targeting 1 or more creatures within reach range, make a Spirit check contested with the beast. If you succeed, the beast will follow commands for 1 minute, after which it will flee in fear.

progressionSteps.name: Fenrir's Wrath
progressionSteps.description: As an action, unleash powerful shadows with an area attack within short range targeting up to 6 creatures. Deals [[3d6]] eclipse damage. Enemies must make an Agility check or take full damage, half as much per success.

progressionSteps.name: Territorial Awareness
progressionSteps.description: Mark an area as your territory—this can be a homestead, town, or a city district. Within this territory, when combat begins, you gain an additional action for the first round. You can identify the types of creatures in your territory and know their intentions.

progressionSteps.name: Apex of the Wild
progressionSteps.description: You can call upon nature spirits for aid. As an action, summon 3 wolf spirits (PL 3) that remain for 1 minute. You can command them, and they will follow your commands to the best of their ability.

progressionSteps.name: Cataclysmic Howl
progressionSteps.description: Unleash a devastating howl that can be heard across planes. Enemies within medium range must make a Spirit check. On a failure, they become stunned until the end of their next turn and take [[4d8]] thunder damage. This howl can also break barriers and dispel illusions.

paths.name: Elevant
paths.description: The Elevant wields the raw power of the elements like a virtuoso commanding a symphony, blending artistry with destruction. Each movement is a calculated gesture, orchestrating fire, water, earth, and air in harmony to shield allies, inspire courage, and overwhelm enemies. As a conductor of elemental forces, the Elevant turns the battlefield into a dynamic stage where their every action resonates with power and precision.

features.name: Elemental Melody
features.description: Your presence radiates elemental energy. As a half-action, cause enemies within reach range to take [[1d4]] elemental damage.

progressionSteps.name: Symphony
progressionSteps.description: Your melee attacks deal an additional 3 elemental damage.

progressionSteps.name: Melody II
progressionSteps.description: Your Elemental Melody now deals [[2d6]] elemental damage.

progressionSteps.name: Echo
progressionSteps.description: When you deal elemental damage, spend a Champion Point to deal the elemental damage to a secondary target within short range (only the elemental damage, not the total damage).

progressionSteps.name: Overture
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, perform an elemental overture that inspires allies, granting them advantage on their next attack roll and +3 damage until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Harmonic Shift
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, hum with elemental energy and teleport up to a short range, leaving behind a line of elemental energy that deals 1 elemental damage to creatures that pass through it.

progressionSteps.name: Cacophony
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, when an ally within short range is about to be hit by an attack, you can impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

progressionSteps.name: Echo II
progressionSteps.description: When you use Echo, deal damage to a third target and add an additional [[1d6]] to all targets.

progressionSteps.name: Overture II
progressionSteps.description: When you use Overture, give allies an additional [[1d6]] damage on their attacks until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Rebirth
progressionSteps.description: When you are reduced to 0 wounds, instead of taking the injured condition, you can spend 2 Champion Points to regain 10 wounds and release a burst of elemental energy, dealing [[3d6]] elemental damage to enemies within reach range.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Storm
progressionSteps.description: As an action, the Elevant unleashes a 'crescendo' by conducting an explosive symphony of elemental energy that pulses outward in rhythmic waves. Each wave deals [[8d8]] elemental damage and disrupts nearby enemies' abilities to act (inflicts the Deafened condition or imposes Disadvantage on spells or ranged attacks for a turn). The Elevant experiences Exhaustion and Disoriented conditions as they channel such intense elemental music.

paths.name: Faith Bound
paths.description: The Faith Bound walks a precarious path between devotion and self-discovery, embodying the struggle to reconcile divine purpose with personal conviction. They are champions of their deity, wielding holy power to protect and heal, yet their internal conflict fuels their greatest strength. Every action they take reflects the tension between their loyalty to a higher power and their own sense of identity, granting them the ability to adapt to the needs of the moment.

features.name: Shifting Resolve
features.description: At the start of your day, make a choice between these two abilities:

options.name: Strength of God
options.effect: You gain a +2 to checks in combat.

options.name: Strength of Self
options.effect: You gain a +2 to checks outside of combat.

progressionSteps.name: Divine Emissary
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending a Champion Point, you can channel divine energy to heal a creature within short range, restoring [[2d6]] wounds. Additionally, you can enter a meditative state for 1 minute, gaining advantage on your next Observation check.

progressionSteps.name: Divine Beacon
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Champion Point, illuminate yourself with divine light, healing your allies and damaging enemies for [[2d6]]. The light can also dispel darkness spells and fear effects, symbolizing your role as a beacon of hope.

progressionSteps.name: Enhanced Shifting Resolve
progressionSteps.description: Your Shifting Resolve ability now grants a +4 bonus to checks.

progressionSteps.name: True Unity
progressionSteps.description: As a Free Action spending a Champion Point, you can activate both Strength of God and Strength of Self simultaneously for 1 minute. While this is active, allies within medium range have +1 to their checks.

progressionSteps.name: Celestial Insight
progressionSteps.description: As an Off-Action, gain the ability to perceive celestial and Vozian influences in the world around you until the end of your next turn. This can reveal hidden auras, detect lies influenced by dark powers, or sense divine providence at work, enriching exploration and interactions.

progressionSteps.name: Ascendant Armor
progressionSteps.description: As a Half-Action, gain +10 armor until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Consecrated Ground
progressionSteps.description: As an action, transform a short-range area into holy ground until the end of your next turn. Allies in the range gain +10 armor, and enemies have disadvantage on their attacks until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Avatar Ascendant (Partial)
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 2 Champion Points, you become an avatar of your god until the end of your next turn. You gain immunity to Corpus conditions, and your attacks deal additional damage equal to your Spirit check.

progressionSteps.name: Divine Arbitration
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending a Champion Point, call upon your deity to intervene directly in a moment of great need. This could manifest as a powerful smite against foes for [[20]] Solar damage, a mass healing wave of [[10]] healing to all allies within medium range, or an irrefutable command issued with divine authority to an enemy of your choice.

progressionSteps.name: Avatar Ascendant (Full)
progressionSteps.description: You can now channel the full power of your deity, transforming into an avatar of faith for 1 minute. In this form, you gain immunity to conditions and damage. Your melee attacks deal an extra [[6d6]] Solar damage and have an additional +10 to the check, showcasing the true power of your faith. After using this ability, you must make a Spirit check at disadvantage. On a failure, your body and mind are given to your god, and you cease to exist as your body and soul are taken into the Celestial realm.

paths.name: Forsaken
paths.description: The Forsaken was once a devout believer in the gods, but their faith was shattered when they were betrayed and abandoned by the very deities they worshiped. This deep betrayal has fueled their desire for revenge and a vow to end the tyranny of the gods. They have vowed to become more powerful than any god and bring justice to the world.

features.name: Vow of Death
features.description: If you take the death condition, make a Spirit check. On a success, you will yourself back to life, removing the death condition. You cannot do this again for 1 month.

progressionSteps.name: Vengeful Defiance
progressionSteps.description: While making an attack action, spend a Champion Point to deal an additional [[1d6]] damage and gain the total damage as armor until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Rite of the Godslayer
progressionSteps.description: As an Off-Action, mark a foe as a target of your divine retribution. The marked target takes an additional [[1d6]] damage from you.

progressionSteps.name: Unwavering Stance
progressionSteps.description: After taking this stance, you can negate any damage until the start of your next turn, but you take the Pinned condition until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Sanctuary Aura
progressionSteps.description: Immune to tracking through divine or magical means. While resting, you automatically create a protective aura that renders you and your party undetectable to creatures' spying, tracking, or scrying efforts.

progressionSteps.name: Relentless Pursuit
progressionSteps.description: You can use Vow of Death once per long rest. When you use Vow of Death, you regain wounds equal to your Spirit. Additionally, you can immediately take an action, choosing a creature within short range. Gain advantage on attack rolls against that creature and increase your movement speed by short range until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Aura of Defiance
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending a Champion Point, activate an Aura of Defiance, granting all allies within short range +10 armor. Their attacks deal an additional [[1d6]] Vozian damage until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Rite of the Godslayer II
progressionSteps.description: Increase the damage of Rite of the Godslayer to [[3d6]]. When you mark a target, they cannot hide from you while on the same plane, and you also learn any weaknesses they might have.

progressionSteps.name: Vengeful Godslayer
progressionSteps.description: Vengeful Defiance damage is increased to [[3d6]], gaining twice the damage as armor that lasts for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Vengeful Fury
progressionSteps.description: When you use Vengeful Defiance, your critical damage is tripled.

progressionSteps.name: Avatar of Vengeance
progressionSteps.description: As an action, transform into an avatar of vengeance for 1 hour. In this form, you gain immunity to all damage and conditions, and your melee attacks deal an extra [[3d6]] necrotic damage. After the hour, your body decays, and you permanently lose [[1d6]] wounds.

paths.name: Knight of Perdition
paths.description: The Knight of Perdition is a fearsome warrior bound by a pact with demonic forces, wielding unparalleled power at a devastating personal cost. Cloaked in a sinister aura of shadows and dread, these knights dominate the battlefield with devastating strikes, unyielding defenses, and supernatural agility. Their Veil of Perdition is both their greatest weapon and their most haunting burden, granting them dark gifts that inspire fear and awe in all who stand against them.

features.name: Veil of Perdition
features.description: When you use Champion’s Endurance, gain +10 armor until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Shroud
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, also gain an additional Off-Action.

progressionSteps.name: Eclipse Shield
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, your armor lasts until you Press On or Long Rest.

progressionSteps.name: Reach of the Abyss
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, your melee attacks deal an additional [[1d4]] eclipse damage.

progressionSteps.name: Shadow Veil
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

progressionSteps.name: Shadow Step
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, teleport up to short range to an unoccupied space that you can see.

progressionSteps.name: Aura of Dread
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, enemies within a short range must succeed on a spirit check or gain the fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Umbral Regeneration
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, heal for [[1d10]].

progressionSteps.name: Dreadful Dominance
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, force one enemy within sight to make a spirit check; on a failure, they follow a simple command you give them that does not result in self-harm.

progressionSteps.name: Shroud of Night
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, blend into shadows, gaining advantage on stealth checks and causing the first attack made from stealth to automatically crit.

progressionSteps.name: Lord of Perdition
progressionSteps.description: When you activate Veil of Perdition, your physical form intensifies in dread, intimidating all enemies within sight to make a spirit check or be stunned until the end of their next turn.

paths.name: Spell Breaker
paths.description: Having been shunned by traditional spell schools, the Spell Breaker has delved into the dark and forbidden arts of anti-magic. They have sworn to rid the world of the dangers of magic and those who wield it without restraint. With a somber and gloomy demeanor, the Spell Breaker walks a lonely path, haunted by the atrocities unleashed by reckless spellcasters.

features.name: Arcane Devour
features.description: As a reaction to a spell being cast within short range gain 1 spell point and move 5ft. You can store a number of spell points equal to your Survival, you cannot cast spells with your spell points.

features.name: Spell Eater
features.description: As an off-action, spend any number of spell points and deal that much damage on your next successful hit with a weapon you empower or gain twice as much as armor for 1 minute.

progression.description: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:
bonuses: Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

progressionSteps.name: Magic Disruption
progressionSteps.description: You have advantage on checks against spells and magical effects. When subjected to a condition from a spell or magical effect, make an Intellect check to prevent it.

progressionSteps.name: Anti-Magic Knight
progressionSteps.description: When making a weapon attack, you can spend a spell point to increase either the check or the damage by +3. Alternatively, as an action using a spell point, gain [[6]] armor per spell point used.

progressionSteps.name: Magical Insight
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to detect the presence and intensity of magical effects within your vicinity. This does not require spell points but provides valuable information about magical traps, enchantments, or artifacts, enhancing investigation and lore discovery.

progressionSteps.name: Stance Hold
progressionSteps.description: When you take the Saving Grace Stance as a half-action, you can take an additional stance at the same time, receiving the benefits of both until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Anti-Mage
progressionSteps.description: Gain spell points equal to your Intellect.

progressionSteps.name: Counter-Cast Parry
progressionSteps.description: After using Anti-Magic Knight and a creature attacks you after your turn, you can spend a spell point to reduce the damage by half as an off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Mirror Spell
progressionSteps.description: You can cast any spells you have seen within the last minute as an action with an Intellect check, using half the number of spell points used but must be cast within short range.

progressionSteps.name: Anti-Mage Recovery
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 2 spell points, you can heal for +4 or remove a Corpus condition.

progressionSteps.name: Disenchanter
progressionSteps.description: As a 10-minute action spending 6 spell points, you can remove negative effects from items like curses or tainted magic.

progressionSteps.name: The Spell Breaker
progressionSteps.description: Spending a champion point as an action, you become immune to any words of power or magical abilities unless cast by a god for 1 minute.

paths.name: Tide Sentinel
paths.description: The Tide Sentinel embodies the unyielding power and grace of the ocean, wielding water as both a shield and a weapon. They channel the boundless energy of the tides to heal allies, manipulate the battlefield, and summon aquatic allies to aid in combat. Whether calming the chaos or unleashing a torrent of destruction, the Tide Sentinel is a master of adaptability, making them an invaluable force both in battle and beyond.

features.name: Ocean Spray
features.description: As an off-action, when you attack an enemy with a melee weapon, deal half the total damage in water damage to all creatures in melee range.

features.name: Arcane Devour
features.description: As a reaction to a spell being cast within short range gain 1 spell point and move 5ft. You can store a number of spell points equal to your Survival, you cannot cast spells with your spell points.

progression.description: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:
bonuses: Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

progressionSteps.name: Ocean's Lorekeeper
progressionSteps.description: You have extensive knowledge of sea creatures, maritime lore, and oceanography. Gain advantage on checks related to marine life, sea navigation, and identifying sea-related artifacts.

progressionSteps.name: Healing Waters
progressionSteps.description: When you hit an ally with Ocean Spray, they take healing instead of damage.

progressionSteps.name: Seafarer's Tongue
progressionSteps.description: You can communicate in the language of sea creatures, allowing for interaction with dolphins, whales, and other intelligent aquatic life. This can be used to gather information, seek guidance, or ask for assistance from sea creatures.

progressionSteps.name: Riptide
progressionSteps.description: Summon a tide water, and as a half-action, your weapon becomes imbued with the tide waters and deals water damage for 1 minute, dealing an additional +1 damage.

progressionSteps.name: Call of the Deep
progressionSteps.description: As an action, use a champion point to call upon sea creatures for assistance. Summon a swarm of PL4 small crabs or a giant octopus for a turn, which will attack your enemies or create obstacles.

progressionSteps.name: Hydro-Illusion
progressionSteps.description: While laying still in water that covers your whole form, you are treated as invisible.

progressionSteps.name: Ocean Spray II
progressionSteps.description: Your Ocean Spray deals the full damage to creatures nearby.

progressionSteps.name: Shipshape
progressionSteps.description: You excel at ship maintenance and repairs. Gain advantage on Crafting checks to repair or maintain boats and ships, and you can temporarily boost ship speed with your knowledge of optimal rigging and sail adjustments.

progressionSteps.name: Coral Fortress
progressionSteps.description: When you take a defensive stance, gain spikes of coral that deal [[1d4]] damage to creatures that hit you with a melee attack.

progressionSteps.name: Oceanic Dominion
progressionSteps.description: For your ultimate ability, gain control over all water within a large radius for 1 minute. You can manipulate water to form barriers, propel allies forward, or crash against enemies as waves, each wave dealing [[6d6]] water damage.

paths.name: Titanblood
paths.description: Titanblood warriors are the living embodiment of their colossal ancestry, channeling the raw might of ancient giants to dominate the battlefield. Their bodies adapt to their surroundings, becoming unyielding as stone or expanding to titanic proportions. Through sheer physical power, they unleash seismic destruction, shatter the ground beneath their foes, and reshape the battlefield to their will. Driven by a primal rage and boundless strength, Titanbloods leap into combat with apocalyptic force, creating devastating fissures and leaving entire landscapes scarred by their might. They are immovable forces, unstoppable powers, and avatars of their titanic lineage.

features.name: Titanic Slam
features.description: As an action, create a shockwave by slamming the ground, dealing [[1d4]] Impact damage to creatures within reach range. Affected creatures must make a Strength check or take the Prone condition.

progression.description: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9:
bonuses: Gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks (no check can exceed 15).
Gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels.

progressionSteps.name: Tremor Shield
progressionSteps.description: Whenever you are hit by a melee attack, you can spend 1 Champion Point as an off-action to release a tremor, forcing all enemies within reach range to succeed on a Physical check or fall prone. This reaction can be used while in Titanic Growth without spending Champion Points.

progressionSteps.name: Colossus
progressionSteps.description: You become an indomitable force, unaffected by enemy interference. Gain immunity to the Pinned condition and reduce the effects of Knockback by half.

progressionSteps.name: Bloodrage
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, go into a Bloodrage that lasts until the end of your next turn unless you deal damage to a living creature before the end of your next turn. While in Bloodrage your melee attacks deal additional damage equal to your Strength.

progressionSteps.name: Seismic Slam
progressionSteps.description: When you use Titanic Slam, you can use it in a line up to short range instead of an area of effect.

progressionSteps.name: Physical Adaptation
progressionSteps.description: Your body instinctively adjusts to match your environment. As an action, you can compress or expand your size to fit your needs. While compressed, gain +2 to Stealth bonus. While expanded, gain +2 to Strength bonus.

progressionSteps.name: Apocalyptic Descent
progressionSteps.description: As an action, leap into the air and land with titanic force in a location within short range. All creatures within reach range of the impact point take [[1d10]] Impact damage and must succeed on a Strength check or take the Prone condition. The terrain in the impact radius becomes difficult terrain.

progressionSteps.name: Bloodrage II
progressionSteps.description: While in Bloodrage, gain advantage to Strength, Agility, and Survival checks. You can also choose to maintain the Bloodrage by taking -4 Stress damage.

progressionSteps.name: Tremor Shield II
progressionSteps.description: When you use Tremor Shield, deal [[1d10]] Impact damage.

progressionSteps.name: Apocalyptic Descent II
progressionSteps.description: Increase the damage of Apocalyptic Descent to [[2d10]] + your Strength.

progressionSteps.name: Worldbreaker
progressionSteps.description: As an action, slam into the ground with your full titan force, creating fissures in a long-range line in any 2 directions you choose. These fissures have a width of 20ft, and creatures in the line of the fissure must make a Strength or Agility check to not fall in. Creatures that fall in are wedged between your fissures. These fissures remain until the end of your next turn, but you are unable to move or act until the end of your next turn while you force the fissures to close, trapping the creatures that fell in for eternity in the ground.

paths.name: Plaguebringer
paths.description: The Plaguebringer is a master of disease, decay, and the darker aspects of nature. They understand the delicate balance between life and death and can manipulate it to their advantage. This talent is perfect for players who enjoy using cunning and strategy over brute force, affecting entire battlefields with debilitating diseases, controlling vermin and insects, and wielding the fear of contagion as a weapon.

features.name: Plagued One
features.description: You are immune to disease. Your attacks cause a simple disease on failed Survival checks that allows you to track your foe while they are on the same plane as you. You have advantage on attack checks against creatures that have your disease. Your disease lasts for 1 week if left untreated.

progressionSteps.name: Infectious Cough
progressionSteps.description: When a creature is initially infected with your disease, they take the coughing condition until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Brain Fog
progressionSteps.description: When a creature is infected with your disease, they take the Confused condition.

progressionSteps.name: Fear of Death
progressionSteps.description: The first time a creature is infected with your disease, they hallucinate their worst fears and must make an Intellect check or take the fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Toxic Retribution
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, when struck in melee combat, release a burst of toxic spores dealing [[1d6]] toxic damage.

progressionSteps.name: Decay Aura
progressionSteps.description: Your presence accelerates decay and disease. Armor and weapons of enemies begin to rust and degrade. As an action, touch an armored creature or vehicle to cause [[1d6]] acid damage.

progressionSteps.name: Pathogen Mastery
progressionSteps.description: As an action, release a cloud of virulent pathogens that infect enemies within reach range. Creatures must make a Survival check or become infected with your disease. While infected, you can deal [[1d6]] damage to them as an off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Epidemic Spread
progressionSteps.description: If an enemy is slain while they have your disease, they burst with a cloud of virulent pathogens within short range. All creatures you choose within that range must make Survival checks or contract your disease.

progressionSteps.name: Carrion Call
progressionSteps.description: As an action, summon a swarm of PL2 carrion birds or insects as allies. These can harass enemies, obscure vision, or heal [[1d4]] to you by feasting on creatures you infected.

progressionSteps.name: Dreaded Ground
progressionSteps.description: As an action, transform the terrain within short range into diseased land, causing it to become difficult terrain. Allies moving through this area regain [[1d4]] wounds at the start of their turn.

progressionSteps.name: Disease of Unity
progressionSteps.description: As an action, unleash the ultimate form of your disease. All allies and enemies within medium range can choose to make a Survival check or take your disease. Allies gain 6 healing at the start of their turn, reducing by 1 per round. Enemies take 6 toxic damage at the start of their turn, reducing by 1 per round.

talents.name: Bannerlord
talents.description: The Bannerlord is a flamboyant and charismatic warrior who wields different banners to grant various auras to themselves and their allies. They are known for their showmanship and flair in battle, using their performance, voice, and colorful banners to captivate their audience and sway the tides of combat.

features.name: Banner Action
features.description: As an action place a banner, this banner has an aura of reach range and lasts for 1 minute. You have 2 banners per day. You can have more than one banner active at a time.

features.name: Banner of Protection
features.description: As an action place down a banner. Any allied creatures that are within reach range of the banner gains 3 additional armor to a maximum of 3 from this feature at the start of their turn

progressionSteps.name: Quick Deployment
progressionSteps.description: You can place a banner as a off-action instead of a full action.

progressionSteps.name: Bolstering Banner
progressionSteps.description: Increase the range of your banners to short range.

progressionSteps.name: Banner of Illusion
progressionSteps.description: This banner can create illusions, such as Doppelgangers, Illusory Terrain, Phantasmal Foes, or Concealing Fog, adding a layer of deception to your strategies.

progressionSteps.name: Banner of Invisibility
progressionSteps.description: Creatures within the banner's range become invisible, although the banner remains visible.

progressionSteps.name: Banner of Swiftness
progressionSteps.description: Upon placement, your banner boosts you and your allies' agility and speed within its range, allowing two attacks when taking the Attack action.

progressionSteps.name: Banner of Valor
progressionSteps.description: Upon deployment, allies within the range gain advantage on their attack rolls.

progressionSteps.name: Held Banner
progressionSteps.description: You can activate one banner while holding it in your off-hand, providing its effects within its range. Simultaneously, you have the option to deploy another banner.

progressionSteps.name: Banner of the Undying
progressionSteps.description: This banner inspires allies and protects them from death. When reduced to 0 wounds, they automatically regain 1 wound. This feature can only be used once per creature.

progressionSteps.name: Bannerbound
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can teleport to any active banner within medium range. Additionally, your banners' duration is increased to 1 hour.

progressionSteps.name: Banner of Safety
progressionSteps.description: This banner, when placed, becomes a doorway to a cozy home of your design that can comfortably fit 6 medium-sized creatures. It remains for 8 hours or until the banner is removed or destroyed. The banner from the outside looks like any of your banners, but when a creature enters the range, they see the home.

talents.name: Cavalier
talents.description: The Cavalier combines the ruggedness of a cowboy with the chivalry of a knight. This talent is for those who excel in mounted combat, blending wilderness survival skills with honorable combat techniques. They are adept at navigating rough terrains and using their environment to their advantage, whether in a jousting tournament or a wild west showdown.

features.name: Movement Synergy
features.description: While mounted, you may combine your movement with your mount's.

progressionSteps.name: Whispers of the Wild
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, communicate telepathically with any willing creature. However, the first time you speak to a creature, it must make an Observation check or take the fear condition. Once a creature succeeds on this check, it's immune to this fear effect from you in the future. The telepathic voice sounds like their greatest fear, and creatures are initially unaware of who is speaking.

progressionSteps.name: Ravenous Bite
progressionSteps.description: You have a bite attack, dealing [[1d4]] damage. When you hit with a success+, the bitten creature must make a Survival check or take the Ravenous Curse. If a creature has the Ravenous Curse within short range of you, gain an additional [[1d4]] attack bonus per cursed creature.

progressionSteps.name: Chilling Touch
progressionSteps.description: Your hands are unnaturally cold. When you hit with unarmed strikes, deal an additional [[1d4]] ice damage.

progressionSteps.name: Unnatural Speed
progressionSteps.description: Your movement becomes eerily swift and silent. Gain +3 Agility and +3 Stealth, and you also have advantage on Stealth checks in forested or cold environments.

progressionSteps.name: Frost Walker
progressionSteps.description: Traverse without leaving tracks or suffering movement penalties. Additionally, gain 2 resistance to ice damage.

progressionSteps.name: Nightmarish Grasp
progressionSteps.description: Your arms transform into elongated, monstrous limbs. Increase your melee range by +5 feet, and your grip can cause hallucinations, forcing any target grappled by you to make a Survey check or experience terrifying visions, taking the fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Skinwalker Camouflage
progressionSteps.description: Blend into natural surroundings perfectly. When remaining still in natural terrain, become invisible.

progressionSteps.name: Insatiable Hunger
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to consume flesh as a 1-minute action to heal [[2d6]] wounds or remove 1 condition. Eating flesh of defeated enemies restores you but may have other psychological effects. Creatures that see you in this act must make a Survey check or take the fear condition. When you eat a corpse, you can disguise yourself as the creature you ate for 24 hours.

progressionSteps.name: Winter's Veil
progressionSteps.description: You can create a localized blizzard around yourself as a defensive mechanism. This blizzard obscures vision and imposes disadvantage on attacks against you. Melee attackers take 1 ice damage when they hit you with an attack.

progressionSteps.name: Hunter
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, mark a target with touch as your prey. You always know where they are if they are on this plane and slowly learn more about them, gaining more knowledge each day. They know something is wrong but don't know why.

talents.name: Detective
talents.description: The Gritty Detective talent harnesses the hard-boiled, relentless determination of a detective, weaving an intricate balance between brawn and brains. As a Gritty Detective, you combine your muscular might with a sharp intellect to penetrate the murkiest mysteries and hold the frontline in any battle.

features.name: Hard-Boiled
features.description: When you wear armor, that armor has +5 armor

features.name: Sherlock's Gaze
features.description: Your keen eye for detail and deductive reasoning is a powerful asset. As a Half-Action, spend a Champion Point to reveal vital clues or hidden information in your surroundings if there is any.

progressionSteps.name: Interrogator
progressionSteps.description: You know how to get information out of people. Spend a Champion Point to make an Influence check with advantage when trying to persuade someone to reveal information. This could help you get a confession from a suspect, persuade a witness to talk, or intimidate a thug into revealing his boss's plans.

progressionSteps.name: Quick Reflexes
progressionSteps.description: Your detective instincts allow you to react quickly to danger. Spend a Champion Point to take an additional off-action (reaction) during a round. This could allow you to dodge an unexpected attack, catch a falling object, or react to a sudden change in the situation.

progressionSteps.name: Master of Disguise
progressionSteps.description: You can blend into any crowd. Spend a Champion Point to make a Stealth or Influence Check with advantage when trying to disguise yourself or blend into a crowd.

progressionSteps.name: Tactical Analysis
progressionSteps.description: You can quickly assess a situation and devise a plan. Spend a Champion Point to give all allies a +2 bonus on their next check or attack.

progressionSteps.name: Unseen Strike
progressionSteps.description: You know how to hit where it hurts. Spend a Champion Point to make an additional attack with advantage and deal an additional [[1d4]] damage on a hit.

progressionSteps.name: Healthy Heart
progressionSteps.description: When you heal from any source, heal for +3 more.

progressionSteps.name: Dirty Fighter
progressionSteps.description: You know how to fight dirty to gain the upper hand. Spend a Champion Point on an attack to cause one of these Conditions: Bleeding, Coughing, Pinned, Prone, or Blind.

progressionSteps.name: Knockout Punch
progressionSteps.description: You can deliver a powerful punch that can knock an enemy unconscious. Spend a Champion Point and make a melee attack action that, on a hit, forces the target to succeed on a Strength or Survival check or take the Stunned condition until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Desperation Strike
progressionSteps.description: When the odds are against you, you can make a desperate attack that hits no matter what. Spend a Champion Point to make an additional melee or ranged attack that automatically hits, but only deals 1 damage.

progressionSteps.name: Quantum Pocket Watch
progressionSteps.description: You possess a strange pocket watch that seems to exist in multiple places at once. As an action, pull out an item that you need from the watch, as long as it's something you could reasonably carry in your pocket (like a key, a coin, a small tool, etc.). The item disappears back into the watch and cannot be used for 1 hour.

talents.name: Ironclad
talents.description: The Ironclad is a bastion of defense, a tank whose very presence on the battlefield is akin to a movable fortress. They are the embodiment of resilience, standing firm in the face of overwhelming odds and ensuring that their allies remain protected. Drawing upon the concept of divine protection seen in the Drifting Vicar, the Ironclad instead channels their conviction into an unwavering resolve to defend and protect.

features.name: Heavily Armored
features.description: Your armor has +10 additional armor.

progressionSteps.name: Impenetrable Defense
progressionSteps.description: You can bolster your defenses to withstand powerful attacks. As an action, use a champion point to double your Armor Points until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Iron Sanctuary
progressionSteps.description: As an action, use a champion point to create a sanctuary of reach range that lasts for 1 minute. Allies while in the sanctuary gain +2 armor at the start of their turn to a maximum of 10 while in the sanctuary. The bonus armor remains while the sanctuary is active.

progressionSteps.name: Inspiring Command
progressionSteps.description: Radiating an aura of confidence and bravery, inspire allies to fight with greater ferocity. As an action, spend a champion point; for 1 minute, all allies within short range receive a +2 bonus to attack checks and damage.

progressionSteps.name: Champion Rest
progressionSteps.description: You can meditate to regain your prowess. During a Press On, make a Spirit check to regain [[1d6]] champion points per success.

progressionSteps.name: Iron Resolve
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending a champion point, fortify your mental and physical resolve, gaining immunity to Cognitive Conditions for the next minute.

progressionSteps.name: Dual Stance
progressionSteps.description: You can take 2 stances at a time, each requiring a half-action.

progressionSteps.name: Ironclad Stance
progressionSteps.description: Enter an ironclad stance as a half-action, reducing all incoming damage by a flat amount equal to your Strength.

progressionSteps.name: Ironclad Rally
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending a champion point, let out a battlecry. Allies within short range gain [[1d6]] armor, and enemies must make a Spirit check at advantage or take the fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Defender's Rebuke
progressionSteps.description: When a creature makes an attack against you, spend a champion point and deal [[1d6]] physical damage without a check against the attacking creature.

talents.name: Pugilist
talents.description: The Pugilist is a seasoned fighter who has honed their body into the perfect weapon. These individuals combine physical prowess with a deep understanding of their inner energy, hailing from mysterious dojos or self-taught from scraps of ancient knowledge. Combining traditional pugilism with an understanding of energy flow within the body, these fighters are a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield and in the ring.

features.name: Pugilist's Pride
features.description: Your Unarmed Attacks deal an additional [[1d6]] physical damage of your choice.

talents.progression: You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

progressionSteps.name: Master of the Ring
progressionSteps.description: Once per day, As an action, you challenge a single creature that can understand you to a duel, if a creature does not wish to duel they can make a contested Spirit check to break the duel. While dueling, either creature has disadvantage on checks on creatures other than the dueling creatures.

progressionSteps.name: Champion Attack
progressionSteps.description: Spend a Champion Point to gain one additional unarmed attack.

progressionSteps.name: Endurance Fighter
progressionSteps.description: Combat empowers you, healing your wounds. When you attack, heal for +1 wounds.

progressionSteps.name: Iron Chin
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, reduce incoming melee damage by your Strength once per Press On.

progressionSteps.name: Power Punch
progressionSteps.description: Add your Strength to your unarmed strike damage.

progressionSteps.name: Toughen Up
progressionSteps.description: Gain +10 armor at the start of each combat.

progressionSteps.name: Showstopper
progressionSteps.description: Perform a flashy and devastating unarmed strike or maneuver. Roll an Influence check against your opponent's Observation check. On a success, the target is Charmed until the end of their next turn. If the check exceeds the opponent’s by 10 or more, the target also takes the Fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Fast Striker
progressionSteps.description: When making an unarmed strike, attack twice as part of the action.

progressionSteps.name: Battle Instincts
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, gain advantage on your next attack and disengage as a free action.

progressionSteps.name: Crowd Work
progressionSteps.description: When fighting in front of an audience or crowd (allies count), gain +2 to all Influence checks, and creatures who witness your performance are more inclined to favor you afterward.

talents.name: Resonant
talents.description: Resonant Shadows are warriors attuned to the vibrations of reality, wielding sound and time as their weapons. They create spectral echoes of themselves that confuse enemies, amplify their strikes, and warp the battlefield. By splitting their presence, they become a relentless force, striking from multiple angles and manipulating their surroundings with sound and temporal power. Whether retracing the steps of the past, leaving lingering impressions, or shattering foes with thunderous energy, Resonant Shadows are masters of disorientation and control. Their abilities grow as they harness the power of echoes and vibrations, making them unpredictable and unstoppable.

features.name: Echo Strike
features.description: When you make a weapon attack, make another at disadvantage.

talents.progression: You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

progressionSteps.name: Resonant Stride
progressionSteps.description: When you take the Dash action, you deal [[1d4]] Thunder damage to all creatures within reach range where you start your dash.

progressionSteps.name: Phantom Assault
progressionSteps.description: As an action, summon a PL3 echo that strikes alongside you and has all of your abilities. It lasts for 1 minute. You can have a number of echoes equal to half your Agility.

progressionSteps.name: Sonic Shroud
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, emit a constant hum that cloaks you in disorienting soundwaves. Until the end of your next turn, attacks against you are made with disadvantage.

progressionSteps.name: Echo Collapse
progressionSteps.description: Collapse all active echoes to unleash devastating soundwaves. Each echo deals [[1d6]] Thunder damage to all creatures within reach range, and creatures must succeed on a Strength check of 15 or be knocked Prone.

progressionSteps.name: Echo Strike II
progressionSteps.description: When you make an Echo Strike, it's no longer at disadvantage.

progressionSteps.name: Temporal Overdrive
progressionSteps.description: As a free action, gain an additional turn taken on your turn, but after, you take the Exhausted, Stunned, and Coughing conditions, ending 1 at the end of each turn for 3 turns.

progressionSteps.name: Whispered Memories
progressionSteps.description: Tune into the vibrations of past events. By standing still and focusing for 1 minute, you can listen to echoes of the past in your current location. This allows you to learn a summary of significant events that occurred in the last 24 hours. The narrator determines what details are revealed based on the location's history.

progressionSteps.name: Resonant Scream
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you and your echoes scream at a target of your choice. Each scream deals [[1d4!]].

progressionSteps.name: Reverberating Step
progressionSteps.description: As an action, your movements leave subtle vibrations in your wake for 1 hour. As you travel, you leave a trail of resonant energy. This trail can be 'played back' to retrace your steps or teleport to a point within the hour, ending this effect immediately. If hostile creatures cross the trail, they trigger a faint hum that alerts you. After the hour, you take the Frozen, Blind, and Confused conditions, ending 1 at the end of each turn for 3 turns.

progressionSteps.name: Echoed Presence
progressionSteps.description: Your presence lingers long after you’ve left. As an action, after leaving an area, you can choose to leave a faint echo of yourself there for up to 24 hours. The echo cannot interact with the environment but can be seen and heard delivering a pre-recorded message or performing simple movements.

talents.name: Savage
talents.description: The Savage is a primal force of nature, unshackled by civilization and driven by raw instinct. Whether forged in the untamed wilds or drawn to its feral ways, you embody the essence of the beast. Your combat style is relentless and chaotic, channeling the fury of the wilderness to overwhelm foes and protect what is yours. With every strike, roar, and pounce, the Savage unleashes unbridled power, leaving devastation in their wake.

features.name: Frenzy
features.description: On your turn in combat, you can choose to go into a frenzy. When you choose to do so, spend a Champion Point and roll [[1d4]]. You gain that many additional attacks. After your attacks, you take the Exhaustion condition until the end of your next turn.

talents.progression: You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

progressionSteps.name: Predator's Pounce
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, pounce on an enemy within reach range that is large size or smaller, knocking them prone on a contested Strength check.

progressionSteps.name: Savage Strike
progressionSteps.description: Deal additional damage equal to your Strength check on melee attacks.

progressionSteps.name: Bloodlust
progressionSteps.description: Killing an enemy increases your damage by [[1d6]] until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Hardened Body
progressionSteps.description: Gain +10 armor and +10 wounds.

progressionSteps.name: Unrelenting Spirit
progressionSteps.description: Corpus conditions caused by a Success+ or greater only last until the end of your next turn, and you are immune to the Pinned condition.

progressionSteps.name: Wild Protection
progressionSteps.description: You have advantage on Survival checks while in nature. While in nature, you can hunt for 1 hour and, with a successful Survival check, gather enough raw food for 2d4 people.

progressionSteps.name: Stubborn Frenzy
progressionSteps.description: When you use Frenzy, you can choose to take the Pinned condition instead of Exhaustion.

progressionSteps.name: Wild Instincts
progressionSteps.description: (Gain 1 Champion Point). As a reaction to taking damage, use a Champion Point to tap into your primal instincts and reduce its damage by half.

progressionSteps.name: Primal Roar
progressionSteps.description: (Gain 1 Champion Point). As an action, spend a Champion Point and unleash a roar affecting all creatures within short range. They must make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition with you as the source. You have advantage on attack checks against creatures with the Fear condition with you as the source.

progressionSteps.name: Rampage
progressionSteps.description: (Gain 1 Champion Point). As an action, use a Champion Point to go on a rampage. Your movement speed is doubled, and you can make an unarmed attack against each enemy you pass during your movement.

talents.name: Skinwalker
talents.description: The Horror Shifter taps into the dark and mysterious lore of the skinwalker, possessing the ability to take on aspects of various animals, as well as more terrifying, half-beast forms. This talent is for those who embrace the primal and often unsettling power of shape-shifting, using it to instill fear and leverage the strengths of different creatures. Horror Shifters are not only versatile in combat but also adept at psychological warfare, using their eerie transformations to unnerve and overwhelm opponents.

features.name: Mimic Howl
features.description: As an action, emit a bone-chilling howl that can demoralize enemies, sounding like familiar voices. Creatures must make an Intellect check or take the Fear condition. If they succeed on the check, they become immune to your Mimic Howl.

talents.progression: You may freely select talent progression steps in any order. With each step, gain a +1 bonus to any one of your checks, though no check can exceed a maximum of 15.

progressionSteps.name: Creeping Form
progressionSteps.description: Partially shift as a half-action to gain double movement speed and the ability to climb nearly anything until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Beastly Insight
progressionSteps.description: Gain the instincts of a predator, giving you advantage on Observation checks to notice hidden creatures, detect lies, or sense hostile intent. Additionally, you can speak Naech (Beast).

progressionSteps.name: Pack Instincts
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, you can coordinate with allies by growling or making signals that communicate tactics or warnings, giving one ally advantage on their next attack against a target you’ve marked.

progressionSteps.name: Night Terror
progressionSteps.description: When hit in melee, as a reaction, briefly transform into the target's worst fear, causing them to make an Intellect check or be Stunned for a turn.

progressionSteps.name: Veil of Shadows
progressionSteps.description: As an action, gain the Invisible condition until the end of your next turn or until you take an aggressive action or cast a spell.

progressionSteps.name: Vermin Swarm
progressionSteps.description: Dissolve into a swarm of vermin as a half-action. This allows you to bypass small openings, avoid opportunity attacks, and grants immunity to the Pinned condition.

progressionSteps.name: Terrifying Transformation
progressionSteps.description: Transform part of your body into a monstrous form, adding [[1d6]] additional damage to unarmed strikes.

progressionSteps.name: Shadowed Strike
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, make a shadow attack against a creature with a Spirit check that deals [[1d6]] Eclipse damage. On a Success+, recover wounds equal to the damage dealt.

progressionSteps.name: Eerie Mimicry
progressionSteps.description: Once per day, you can mimic a creature’s mannerisms and voice perfectly for up to 10 minutes, imitating sounds or speech patterns you've heard.

progressionSteps.name: Mark of the Beast
progressionSteps.description: Once per short rest, as an off-action, touch a creature and leave your mark, which remains until removed or until you decide to remove it. You always know the direction of this marked target while they are on the same plane as you.

classes.name: Professional
classes.description: The Professional is a seasoned individual, having faced the tumultuous tides of time and emerging as a beacon of resilience and expertise. Whether they've survived the brutal trenches of war or navigated the intricate politics of the big city, their experiences have crafted them into unparalleled specialists in their fields

features.name: Professional Knowledge
features.description: At character creation, gain an additional 5 points towards your checks to a maximum of 15 for any check, reflecting your wealth of experience. Additionally, you suffer no penalties from wearing Medium armor.

features.name: Tactical Assessment
features.description: As an off-action targeting a creature within short range, gain advantage on checks against them until the end of your next turn, using your experience discerning a target's vulnerabilities and strengths.

features.name: Professional Specialization
features.description: Choose a specialization from the list below.

specializations.name: Warrior
specializations.description: Battle-scarred and wise, the Warrior has seen the horrors and glories of war, excelling in strategic combat and resilience.
specializations.featureDescription: You have +5 Armor. When you are subjected to the Fear condition, you have advantage on saves against it. If there isn't an established save, you can make a Survival check against it.

specializations.name: Mercenary
specializations.description: A seasoned fighter for hire, the Mercenary specializes in versatility and adaptability, thriving in unpredictable situations and diverse contracts.
specializations.featureDescription: You can take a Stance as an action and a half-action, holding 2 stances at once. The stance you take as an action remains until the end of your next turn.

specializations.name: Scout
specializations.description: Masters of reconnaissance and stealth, Scouts excel in gathering intelligence and leading surprise attacks, using their knowledge of terrain to their advantage.
specializations.featureDescription: You can use your Tactical Assessment from Medium Range. When you do so, you cannot lose track of that creature while they are on the same plane as you for 24 hours.

specializations.name: Guardian
specializations.description: Protectors at heart, Guardians are skilled in defensive tactics, prioritizing the safety of their allies and excelling in shielding and interceptive maneuvers.
specializations.featureDescription: When you take this stance as a half-action and allies within reach take damage from an area of effect or something that targets more than one creature, you reduce the damage to everyone by half.

specializations.name: Gladiator
specializations.description: Born in the arena, Gladiators are entertainers as much as fighters, adept at crowd-pleasing combat and theatrical, yet deadly, showmanship.
specializations.featureDescription: You have advantage on Influence checks in combat and a unique combat maneuver that can intimidate or impress opponents and onlookers. This can cause morale drops in the enemy or reduce the enemy PL.

specializations.name: Operative
specializations.description: Trained for covert operations, the Operative specializes in precision strikes, espionage, and working from the shadows to take down targets efficiently.
specializations.featureDescription: Gain the ability to strike vital points. When you make a called shot on a creature, roll a 1d100. If it's above 90, reduce the monster PL by -1.

specializations.name: Pirate
specializations.description: Navigators of the high seas, Pirates are adept in aquatic combat and maritime skills, often employing unconventional tactics and a flair for the dramatic.
specializations.featureDescription: You can operate any aquatic vehicle and have the ability to navigate by strange means that others don't understand. Additionally, you can either hold your breath or breathe underwater for 1 hour. You also have a Breath attack: Action, Survival Check, reach range, deals 3 Water damage.

specializations.name: Negotiator
specializations.description: With a talent for diplomacy and de-escalation, Negotiators can resolve conflicts without bloodshed, using their words as weapons to achieve their goals.
specializations.featureDescription: If combat initiative is rolled, you get a Diplomatic turn before any other creature. This can only be used for social checks and movement, and no creature can make attacks against you until the end of the Diplomatic turn.

specializations.name: Scholar
specializations.description: Combining combat prowess with intellectual mastery, Scholars are well-versed in history and strategy, using knowledge to outmaneuver their foes.
specializations.featureDescription: Can devise battle plans or strategies. As an action on your turn, you can grant a creature an additional half-action on their next turn.

specializations.name: Mystic
specializations.description: Attuned to the esoteric and supernatural, Mystics blend martial skills with mystical insights, often surprising enemies with unorthodox strategies.

specializations.name: Warden
specializations.description: Guardians of nature and the wilderness, Wardens are adept in outdoor survival and environmental combat, using natural elements to their advantage.
specializations.featureDescription: As an action, you can summon a PL [[1d4]] creature of nature or gain +10 Armor. Each lasts for 1 minute.

specializations.name: Explorer
specializations.description: You've always been one to adventure and see the world. You know all of its dangers and how best to avoid them.
specializations.featureDescription: Your movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

specializations.name: Chosen
specializations.description: Marked by destiny or divine favor, the Chosen wield powers or blessings beyond the ordinary, often driven by a higher calling or prophetic mission.
specializations.featureDescription: As a 1-minute action, receive cryptic visions, a strange message, or dreams from a divine entity, offering hints or guidance for current quests or goals. Additionally, as a 1-minute action, you can sanctify an area, providing protection or other benefits to allies within it for 8 hours. This repels creatures that would work against your Motivation or seek to harm you.

paths.name: Demonologist
paths.description: The Demonologist has delved deep into the ancient lore of demonic entities, becoming a Professional on their history, methods, and magic. However, this knowledge comes with a cost; they have learned to infuse themselves with the very essence of the demonic entities they study. When they do so, they can tap into incredible power, but it may leave them physically and emotionally drained. This transformation has made them a formidable presence on the battlefield, capable of standing against even the toughest adversaries. Yet, they always walk a thin line between control and madness.

features.name: Demon Scholar
features.description: Your study of demonic lore and history gives you advantage on Intellect and Observation checks related to demons and other infernal entities.

features.name: Demonic Essence
features.description: Gain a Class Resource of 5 Demonic Essence that recharges after a long rest or by drinking the blood of the innocent.

features.name: Infernal Infusion
features.description: As an action, you can invoke a demonic essence within you, spending 5 Demonic Essence and transforming yourself into a demonic form for a limited time. In this state, you gain +2 to all attack rolls, armor equal to double your Intellect, and deal an extra [[1d4]] Vozian damage with your attacks. This transformation lasts for 1 minute. When the transformation ends, you take the Blind, Confused, and Exhausted conditions for 1 minute due to the immense strain on your body and soul.

paths.progression: Path progression is linear, you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9, gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks, but no check can exceed 15. Additionally, gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels as well.

progressionSteps.name: Demonic Resilience
progressionSteps.description: The demonic essence within you makes you tough and hard to kill. As an action, spend 1 Demonic Essence to heal for [[1d8]] or remove 1 condition on yourself.

progressionSteps.name: Ritual Leader
progressionSteps.description: You are proficient in conducting and creating infernal rituals. A ritual takes 10 minutes. You can perform rituals for various purposes, such as summoning lesser demons for information, creating wards against demonic forces, finding lost information, talking to otherworldly beings, empowering another’s spells or magic, unlocking a door, or binding demonic entities.

progressionSteps.name: Infernal Pact
progressionSteps.description: You have made a pact with a lesser demon, who serves you in exchange for occasional services. Spend 1 Demonic Essence to summon this demon at PL2. They can perform simple tasks or fight for you for a short time.

progressionSteps.name: Infernal Insight
progressionSteps.description: You can tap into the surface thoughts of creatures. As an action, spend 1 Demonic Essence and make an Intellect check targeting a creature within reach range. On a success, you understand the basic thoughts and emotions of the creature for up to 1 minute, but they can sense you with an Observation check. On a Success+, you can either prevent them from sensing you or reach deeper into their mind to learn its deeper reasoning, emotional state, and significant concerns or desires.

progressionSteps.name: Hellfire Blast
progressionSteps.description: You can channel the power of Hellfire to blast your enemies. As an action, spend 1 Demonic Essence to make an Intellect check, ranged attack that deals [[2d6]] Fire damage on a creature within short range. On a Success+, regain the spent Demonic Essence.

progressionSteps.name: Demonic Speed
progressionSteps.description: The demonic essence within you can make you move with supernatural speed. Spend 1 Demonic Essence to double your movement speed until the start of your next turn and gain an additional off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Helborn Rebuke
progressionSteps.description: You can call upon the power of Hell to punish those who harm you. As a reaction to taking damage, spend 1 Demonic Essence to deal [[3d6]] Fire damage to the thing that hurt you.

progressionSteps.name: Soulbound Pact
progressionSteps.description: You can empower your demon or find a stronger one. If you summon a demon with Infernal Pact, you can increase its power level by +2 per Demonic Essence used.

progressionSteps.name: Infernal Emissary
progressionSteps.description: You have the ability to spend 1 Demonic Essence and create a portal to any of the 9 layers of the Ordealis or back to the Prime Material if you are in another plane. The portal remains until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Greater Demonic Ascension
progressionSteps.description: Channel the full might of your demonic heritage, transforming into a greater demon for 1 minute. Gain immunity to conditions and damage. Your attacks deal an extra [[2d6]] Vozian damage, manifesting your true infernal power. After using this ability, make an Intellect check at disadvantage; on failure, your body and soul are consumed by infernal forces.

paths.name: Chimeric Monk
paths.description: The Chimeric Monk walks the path of ultimate understanding, blending traits from myriad sources such as demons, angels, elementals, dragons, and more. Through deep enlightenment, they transcend the limits of a singular form, drawing on the strengths of all life and energies. Each battle or meditation brings new insights, fusing the physical, spiritual, and arcane. They are masters of transformation and adaptation, seeing the world as an interconnected whole. Their journey leads toward the ultimate realization of becoming an avatar of true balance and harmony, embodying the essence of all things.

features.name: Unarmed Striker
features.description: When you make an unarmed strike (fist, claw, tentacle, etc.) as an action, you may make one additional unarmed strike on your turn.

paths.progression: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9, gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks, but no check can exceed 15. Additionally, gain +1 Class Resource at each of these levels as well.

progressionSteps.name: Demon’s Frenzy
progressionSteps.description: Tap into demonic rage, increasing your attack speed; gain an extra attack when you make an attack action but take [[1d4]] stress damage.

progressionSteps.name: Angelic Grace
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, take an Angelic Stance. While in this stance, any creature targeting you with an attack must succeed on a Spirit check before they attack or they choose not to attack.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Shift
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, choose an elemental damage type to become immune to until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Dreamsea Step
progressionSteps.description: As a free action once per day, slip between the dream world and reality and phase out of existence until the end of your next turn, avoiding all attacks and preventing conditions.

progressionSteps.name: Nature’s Grace
progressionSteps.description: As a free action, gain advantage on your next check once per short rest.

progressionSteps.name: Dragon’s Roar
progressionSteps.description: As an action, unleash a terrifying roar. Creatures within short range must succeed on a Spirit check or be inflicted with the Fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Construct Endurance
progressionSteps.description: Reinforce your body with the resilience of a construct; gain +10 Armor that lasts for 1 hour or until a Press On or long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Titan’s Stomp
progressionSteps.description: As an action, slam the ground with the force of a giant, creating shockwaves; knock prone all creatures within short range and deal [[3d6]] impact damage.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Mirror
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, when you take damage, reflect the damage back at your attacker for the exact amount.

progressionSteps.name: Avatar of True Understanding
progressionSteps.description: You have reached a level of enlightenment where you understand and harmonize with all forces of the universe, transforming into an avatar that embodies the essence of all life forms and energies. For 1 minute, become an Avatar of True Understanding. While in this state, you gain the following benefits:

options.name: Elemental Shielding
options.effect: Gain 100 Armor.

options.name: Omniscient Clarity
options.effect: Gain advantage on all checks as you briefly understand all life and the flow of energy around you.

options.name: Overwhelming Power
options.effect: Your unarmed attacks deal an additional [[6d6]] damage of a chosen energy type (fire, lightning, radiant, etc.) for the duration.

options.name: Aftermath
options.effect: After the transformation ends, you take the Exhausted, Stunned, and Blind conditions for 1 hour as you recover from your avatar state.

paths.name: Luminary
paths.description: The Luminary is a living beacon of bioluminescent power and reactive evolution, embodying the raw potential of life itself. Whether inspiring allies with radiant energy, shielding them with adaptive defenses, or disorienting foes with dazzling transformations, the Luminary thrives as a dynamic force on the battlefield. Their ever-changing abilities reflect their connection to the primal forces of nature, adapting to challenges in real-time. Beyond combat, their glowing presence captivates and influences, making them both a formidable protector and an awe-inspiring figure. The Luminary doesn’t just survive—they evolve, illuminating the path for others while reshaping the world around them.

features.name: Catalyst Aid
features.description: As a half-action, target an ally and give them +3 on their next attack check until the end of their next turn.

features.name: Armored Carapace
features.description: As a half-action, gain armor equal to your Strength until the end of your next turn.

paths.progression: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9, gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks, but no check can exceed 15. Additionally, gain +1 Spell Point at each of these levels as well.

progressionSteps.name: Hyper-Reactive
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, when an ally is attacked, you can use your ranged weapon to make an attack at disadvantage against the attacker.

progressionSteps.name: Catalyst Aid II
progressionSteps.description: When you use Catalyst Aid, you heal the target for [[1d4]].

progressionSteps.name: Spiked Carapace
progressionSteps.description: Creatures that strike you with melee attacks while Armored Carapace is active take [[1d10]] Piercing damage.

progressionSteps.name: Prismatic Halo
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, during a social interaction, you can shift your skin tone or create a soft color glow to gain advantage on Influence checks until the end of your next turn. Usable once per day.

progressionSteps.name: Catalyst Aid III
progressionSteps.description: Allies also deal an additional +3 damage when using Catalyst Aid.

progressionSteps.name: Elastic Limbs
progressionSteps.description: Extend melee attacks to reach range.

progressionSteps.name: Radiant Layering
progressionSteps.description: While Armored Carapace is active, you emit soft light, giving enemies advantage to hit you but granting disadvantage to enemies attacking allies within reach range.

progressionSteps.name: Winged Growths
progressionSteps.description: Gain a flying speed equal to your movement speed for one minute, or glide a significant distance to jump chasms or gaps without falling damage.

progressionSteps.name: Dual Hearts
progressionSteps.description: You move and recover with greater efficiency, gaining an additional half-action.

progressionSteps.name: Armored Catalyst
progressionSteps.description: You can use Catalyst Aid and Armored Carapace at the same time.

paths.name: Mentalist
paths.description: Your cognitive prowess transcends the boundaries of mundane thought, touching the ethereal edges of arcane realms. While some argue that the origin of your abilities is rooted in traditional magic, others see it as a testament to the uncharted territories of the human psyche. With an unwavering will that almost seems to shimmer with its own enchantment, you wield this cerebral power both on the battlefield and off. Your heightened perceptual abilities not only give you an edge in understanding the world but also let you tap into latent energies, often overlooked by others.

features.name: Intellect Spellcaster
features.description: Your heightened senses allow you to weave magic from the world around you, drawing upon unnoticed energies. You cast spells with your Intellect Check, and you have spell points equal to your Intellect check.

features.name: Illusionist
features.description: Create an illusion within short range, fooling senses (sight, sound, etc.) up to 1 minute (extended by 1 min per additional spell point). If you spend 3 spell points, you can alter perceptions and make real objects that last for 1 hour (extended by 1 hour per additional spell point).

paths.progression: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9, gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks, but no check can exceed 15. Additionally, gain +1 Spell Point at each of these levels as well.

progressionSteps.name: Telekinetic Hands
progressionSteps.description: You always have an invisible hand that can carry objects with 1 or less bulk, use simple objects, open doors, administer potions, or perform other similar tasks within short range.

progressionSteps.name: Telepathic Relay
progressionSteps.description: Communicate with creatures you can see within medium range telepathically, if they understand language.

progressionSteps.name: Mental Push
progressionSteps.description: As an action, unleash a wave of psychic energy. Creatures within a short range that you choose must make an Intellect check and be pushed back 10 ft, reducing the amount by 5ft per success.

progressionSteps.name: Mind Reading
progressionSteps.description: Spend 1 spell point as an action to probe a target's mind within short range and gain insight into its thoughts and emotions. The target must make an Observation check or you learn one piece of information of your choice, such as its current emotional state, a recent memory, or a hidden motive. You can spend an additional spell point to try to learn something new, the creature gets to make another Observation check against your probing.

progressionSteps.name: Predictive Defense
progressionSteps.description: Gain +15 armor while awake.

progressionSteps.name: Psychic Wall
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 spell point and gain 10 armor that lasts until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Thought Theft
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 spell point and recreate an ability you have seen in the last minute. If the ability is a spell, you must spend an equivalent number of spell points.

progressionSteps.name: Cerebral Overload
