progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 3 spell points, cause an enemy to become incapacitated by overwhelming their mind. They must make an Intellect check or become stunned until the end of their next turn. Each time you subject a creature to this ability, they gain +3 to the check.

progressionSteps.name: Psychic Pain
progressionSteps.description: As an action, touch a creature and cause [[1d4]] psychic damage.

progressionSteps.name: Psychic Ward
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 3 spell points, touch a creature and give them immunity to damage until they take damage or for 1 minute.

paths.name: Reaper
paths.description: A Reaper's strength lies in precision and stealth. If they find themselves in prolonged combat, it's a sign of a mission gone awry. Their expertise is the silent takedown; if a target survives the initial encounter, chaos often ensues. Their mere presence is an omen of impending doom, a whisper of darkness soon to befall.

features.name: Stealth
features.description: When you get a Success+ on a Stealth check, gain the Invisible condition until the start of your next turn.

features.name: Reaper's Breath
features.description: If a creature has not seen you, acted in combat, or is unaware of your position, gain [[2d6]] to the attack roll and deal that much additional damage.

paths.progression: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9, gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks, but no check can exceed 15.

progressionSteps.name: Death’s Armor
progressionSteps.description: Summon a shroud of Eclipse armor as a reaction to an attack hitting you, reducing the damage by half.

progressionSteps.name: Precision Strike
progressionSteps.description: You can choose to do a called shot at disadvantage instead of -10.

progressionSteps.name: Reaper’s Awareness
progressionSteps.description: You have a total of 2 off-actions.

progressionSteps.name: Master Manipulator
progressionSteps.description: You have a talent for manipulation and control. As a half-action, you can make an Observation check against a target's Influence. If you succeed, you can manipulate them into revealing a useful piece of information or performing a minor action in your favor.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Siphon
progressionSteps.description: Drain vitality from enemies to heal yourself or weaken them. As an off-action, when you make a successful attack on a creature, heal yourself for half the damage dealt.

progressionSteps.name: Wings of the Owl
progressionSteps.description: Manifest ethereal wings that allow for silent, swift movement and evasion. As a half-action, summon spectral wings, silent flight equal to movement speed.

progressionSteps.name: Harbinger of Zuinmuir
progressionSteps.description: Gain the guidance from an angel of death. As an off-action, gain advantage on a check.

progressionSteps.name: Promise of Death
progressionSteps.description: As an action, touch a creature that has died within the last hour and remove the Death condition and any permanent loss of wounds.

progressionSteps.name: Touch of Death
progressionSteps.description: You are immune to Eclipse damage and you can choose to deal Eclipse damage instead of your weapon’s normal damage.

progressionSteps.name: Zuinmuir’s Scythe
progressionSteps.description: Summon a spectral scythe, a symbol of your grim authority. This scythe deals [[6d6]] Eclipse damage and lasts for 1 minute. After you use the scythe, you cannot do so again for [[1d6]] days.

paths.name: Runebinder
paths.description: Runebinders are mystical artisans who harnessed the ancient and arcane art of rune crafting. They are scholars and warriors, blending intellect with martial prowess. Through their deep understanding of magical runes, they imbue objects with powerful effects, altering the very essence of their gear for both offensive and defensive purposes.

features.name: Runic Inscription
features.description: You can apply a rune as an action, and if it requires activation, it takes an off-action and lasts for 1 minute. You can have a number of active runes equal to your Intellect. You start with the ability to make simple +1 runes that give a +1 to what you choose. You can only put 1 rune on a single piece of gear.

paths.progression: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9, gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks, but no check can exceed 15.

progressionSteps.name: Wind Rune
progressionSteps.description: When activated, this rune grants you or an ally a burst of speed, increasing movement by 20 feet.

progressionSteps.name: Preventing Rune
progressionSteps.description: This inactive rune can be activated as a reaction to prevent a condition.

progressionSteps.name: Shielding Rune
progressionSteps.description: When activated, grants +10 armor.

progressionSteps.name: Exploding Rune
progressionSteps.description: When activated, the rune explodes dealing [[1d10]] fire damage to creatures within reach range.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Rune
progressionSteps.description: Change a weapon’s type to an elemental type, or grants +3 armor.

progressionSteps.name: Rune of Clarity
progressionSteps.description: Can be activated to grant advantage on the next check.

progressionSteps.name: Enhanced Inscriptions
progressionSteps.description: Your simple runes now add +3.

progressionSteps.name: Healing Rune
progressionSteps.description: Craft a rune that heals [[1d6]] wounds when activated, but can only be activated once per day.

progressionSteps.name: Rune of the Phoenix
progressionSteps.description: (Intellect +3, Influence +3, Spirit +3, Observation +3) When the wearer is reduced to 0 wounds, the rune activates, giving [[1d8]] healing before the injured condition is applied.

progressionSteps.name: Master Runebinder
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to inscribe a 'Unity Rune' onto your equipment, which combines the effects of two runes into one slot.

paths.name: Strider
paths.description: Striders are enigmatic agents of balance, embodying the profound dichotomy of night and day, life and death. They are not mere spies or skirmishers; they are custodians of the equilibrium between light and darkness. In their hands, the powers of solar radiance and eclipse shadows are more than just tools for espionage or combat; they are symbols of the eternal cycle of creation and destruction. Shadow Striders move through the world as avatars of this duality, their actions guided by a deeper understanding of the interconnectedness of all things.

features.name: Eclipse Dash
features.description: As a half-action in dim light or darkness, teleport a short range.

features.name: Solar Flare
features.description: As a half-action, target a creature within short range with a burst of light. They must make an Observation check or take the Blind condition until the start of their next turn.

paths.progression: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9, gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks, but no check can exceed 15.

progressionSteps.name: New Dawn
progressionSteps.description: (Agility +1, Stealth +1, Spirit +1, Observation +1) As a half-action, touch a creature to transfer a condition from a target to yourself.

progressionSteps.name: Duality Strike
progressionSteps.description: Your melee attacks deal either Eclipse or Solar damage. As a half-action, swap a weapon’s damage type to its normal damage, Eclipse, or Solar.

progressionSteps.name: Luminous Glow
progressionSteps.description: Emit a soothing glow that heals allies. As a half-action, heal an ally within short range for [[1d4]] + your Spirit check. This glow can also dispel shadows, countering mild magical darkness.

progressionSteps.name: Twilight Perception
progressionSteps.description: You have advantage on Observation checks at night, and on Success+, you can spot invisible enemies. Additionally, amplify your Solar Flare. Now, in addition to blinding, it deals [[1d6]] Solar damage to the target.

progressionSteps.name: Umbra Step
progressionSteps.description: (Agility +2, Stealth +2, Spirit +2, Observation +2) Enhance your Eclipse Dash. Now, when teleporting, leave behind a shadow clone that distracts attacking creatures within reach, granting disadvantage on their next attack.

progressionSteps.name: Dark Dash
progressionSteps.description: When you use Eclipse Dash and end your turn within melee range of an enemy, you can make an attack action.

progressionSteps.name: Telepathic Understanding
progressionSteps.description: If a creature speaks to another telepathically, you can also hear it and you know where the creature is, no matter how far or how they have tried to hide themselves.

progressionSteps.name: Solar Radiance
progressionSteps.description: Channel the full strength of sunlight to bolster allies. As an action, grant yourself and up to 6 creatures 10 Solar Armor that lasts for 1 minute. You cannot use this ability again for 1 hour.

progressionSteps.name: Lunar Guidance
progressionSteps.description: (Agility +3, Stealth +3, Spirit +3, Observation +3) When you use your Tactical Awareness on a creature at night, you give them a glow, granting all allies advantage on strikes against them for 1 minute. If you maintain Tactical Awareness on a creature and they flee, you can easily track them until you take a short or long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Eclipse Resurgence
progressionSteps.description: As your ultimate ability, once per long rest, you can activate Eclipse Resurgence. For 1 minute, you embody the perfect balance of light and darkness. In this state, your Eclipse Dash leaves a trail of twilight that allies can use to gain a speed boost, doubling their movement speed. Your Solar Flare and Midnight Cloak abilities affect all enemies or allies in a medium range.

paths.name: Witch Hunter
paths.description: The Witch Hunter, or Arcane Inquisitor, is a guardian against the misuse of magic. They are the shadow that haunts rogue spellcasters, the unseen fear that grips the hearts of those who dare to corrupt the arcane. Their path is one of relentless pursuit, armed with the knowledge and tools to dismantle any magical threat. A successful mission for a Witch Hunter is a whisper in the night, a sign that magic's dark tide has been stemmed once more, without fanfare or recognition.

features.name: Witch Hunter's Arsenal
features.description: Equipped with enchanted weapons and alchemical concoctions, you gain [[6]] additional damage against spellcasters or magically enhanced creatures. Additionally, you can use a half-action to apply a poison that deals [[3]] additional toxic damage on your next attack.

paths.progression: Path progression is linear; you will select these progression steps in order. At levels 1, 3, 6, and 9, gain an increase of +3 points to put into your checks, but no check can exceed 15.

progressionSteps.name: Arcane Disruptor
progressionSteps.description: Create a field that interrupts spellcasting. As a reaction to a spell being cast within short range, make a Spirit check to reduce the check of the spell by -3.

progressionSteps.name: Sigil of Silence
progressionSteps.description: Plant a sigil as an action that silences magic within a short range. Spellcasting and magical effects require double the spell points or are halved in damage and effect.

progressionSteps.name: Ethereal Chains
progressionSteps.description: As an action, make a Spirit check. On a success, the target takes the Pinned condition, binding a creature within short range with ethereal chains until the end of their next turn or if they succeed on a Strength check.

progressionSteps.name: Null Cloak
progressionSteps.description: Spells are reduced by -3 when they target you. Additionally, you cannot be tracked or seen by magical means.

progressionSteps.name: Intangible Hunter
progressionSteps.description: You can attack intangible creatures, dealing full damage. Additionally, as an action, you can pull an intangible creature into the physical plane, removing the intangible condition.

progressionSteps.name: Arcane Hunter's Guile
progressionSteps.description: Your understanding of magic allows you to anticipate and counter magical threats. Gain advantage on checks to detect illusions, enchantments, and hidden magical traps. Additionally, gain heightened senses that allow you to detect the presence of creatures within a certain radius, even if they are hidden or obscured.

progressionSteps.name: Banishing Strike
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, when you hit with an attack, you can make a Spirit check. If it is a success and the creature is not native to your current plane, they are sent to their home plane of existence.

progressionSteps.name: Tactical Retreat
progressionSteps.description: Use your reaction to halve the damage of an attack from a creature and move up to half your speed away without provoking opportunity attacks.

progressionSteps.name: Ritual of the Hunter
progressionSteps.description: By performing a sacred rite as an action, you imbue up to 3 weapons you can touch with a Solar light that is anathema to creatures of darkness, switching the weapon’s damage type to Solar and increasing damage by +3. For 1 minute, your attacks bypass any resistances, dealing double damage to supernatural entities.

progressionSteps.name: Monstrous Reckoning
progressionSteps.description: Summon the essence of every beast or monstrosity you've slain, manifesting as spectral allies in battle. For 1 minute, these spectral beasts fight alongside you, each offering a unique advantage based on their nature (e.g., a dragon's breath, a basilisk's gaze). This not only turns the tide of battle but also instills fear in the hearts of your enemies, knowing they face the wrath of the monsters they once commanded or allied with.

talents.name: Dragonkeeper
talents.description: The Dragonkeeper is a rare and revered master of elemental pseudo-dragons, forming bonds with these scaled companions to unleash their latent power. As a Dragonkeeper, you nurture and train your draconic ally, transforming it into a loyal and versatile companion. Whether commanding their elemental breath in the heat of battle or relying on their keen senses and unique abilities to overcome challenges, the Dragonkeeper wields the raw force of nature embodied in their dragon. Together, you become an unstoppable duo, blending strategy, power, and the unbreakable bond of dragon and keeper.

features.name: Chroma Dragon
features.description: Your Chroma Dragon is a loyal companion, a PL2 pseudo-dragon capable of shifting between elemental affinities. It has a reach range line attack dealing [[1d6]] elemental damage. It can act independently on your turn.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Harmony
progressionSteps.description: Your Chroma Dragon's elemental attacks deal an additional +2 damage. As an action, you can switch its elemental affinity to adapt to the battlefield.

progressionSteps.name: Winged Ally
progressionSteps.description: Your Chroma Dragon gains a fly speed equal to its movement speed and can carry small objects or provide aerial reconnaissance.

progressionSteps.name: Empowered Breath
progressionSteps.description: Enhance your Chroma Dragon's breath attack. Its reach increases to short range and damage increases to [[2d6]] elemental damage.

progressionSteps.name: Shared Senses
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, you can see and hear through your dragon’s senses until the end of your next turn, gaining advantage on Observation checks during this time.

progressionSteps.name: Draconic Resilience
progressionSteps.description: Your Chroma Dragon gains +10 armor and +10 wounds, making it more resilient in battle.

progressionSteps.name: Chroma Tail Whip
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, your Chroma Dragon can make a [[1d4]] tail attack.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Synergy
progressionSteps.description: While within short range of your Chroma Dragon, your melee or ranged attacks deal an additional +2 damage of your dragon’s current elemental type.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Surge
progressionSteps.description: Once per day, your Chroma Dragon can unleash a powerful elemental surge in a wide cone, dealing [[4d6]] elemental damage and inflicting a Corpus condition. Enemies must make a Survival check, halving the damage per success.

progressionSteps.name: Bonded Fury
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action when your Dragon takes damage, give your dragon advantage on attack checks until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Elder Dragon Form
progressionSteps.description: Your Chroma Dragon transforms into a PL4 elder pseudo-dragon for 1 minute. It gains increased size, double damage, medium range attacks, and immunity to its current elemental type. Once this ability is used, it cannot be activated again until after a long rest.

talents.name: Ghostborn
talents.description: As a Ghostborn, you exist between the mortal and ethereal planes. You have the ability to phase through objects, move unseen and unheard, and are practically a ghost to those around you. However, you are haunted by phantom pains of a body that is no longer yours, making it difficult to fully embrace your ethereal nature.

features.name: Ethereal Travel
features.description: As an action, gain the Intangible condition. If you pass through a creature while in this condition, the creature takes [[1d4]] Thunder damage. As an action on a following turn, you can remove the Intangible condition.

progressionSteps.name: Spectral Agility
progressionSteps.description: When you take the Dash action, you become Invisible until the end of your next turn unless you make another action of any type.

progressionSteps.name: Ghost Touch
progressionSteps.description: Your weapons deal an additional +2 Psychic damage. Additionally, you can use Ethereal Travel as a half-action.

progressionSteps.name: Shadowborn
progressionSteps.description: You no longer suffer half movement from the Intangible condition, and you can deal half damage to creatures that aren't Intangible.

progressionSteps.name: Spectral Grasp
progressionSteps.description: You can interact with objects and cast spells while Intangible. In addition, your spells have full effect on incorporeal or ethereal creatures.

progressionSteps.name: Ethereal Evasion
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, become partially Intangible, taking half damage from a single attack.

progressionSteps.name: Revenant Recovery
progressionSteps.description: When you gain the Intangible condition, you take [[1d4]] healing.

progressionSteps.name: Haunting Translocation
progressionSteps.description: You are permanently between planes. You gain +5 Armor and are semi-translucent, but you cast more shadows than normal. The souls of the Umbral Eclipse whisper and distract you.

progressionSteps.name: Ghostly Veil
progressionSteps.description: As an action, bring up to 6 allies into the Umbral Eclipse or out. Alternatively, as an action, shroud up to 6 creatures in shadows, giving them +2 to Stealth checks.

progressionSteps.name: Revenant Ascension
progressionSteps.description: Embrace your ghostly heritage fully. Gain a fly speed equal to your movement while in the Umbral Eclipse.

progressionSteps.name: Veil of the Whispers
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, you become empowered by the Eclipse, preventing the next condition applied to you until the end of your next turn.

talents.name: Gunslinger
talents.description: As a Gunslinger, you are a master of firearms and have honed your skills in the art of shooting to perfection. You possess an extensive knowledge of guns and are always equipped with the necessary ammunition to carry out your job effectively. With your steady aim and quick reflexes, you are a force to be reckoned with on the battlefield.

features.name: Sharpshooter
features.description: When you make a called shot to cause a condition, it is a -6 instead of -10.

progressionSteps.name: Burst Fire
progressionSteps.description: You have trained extensively to improve your rate of fire. As part of an attack action, when you make an attack with a firearm, make another attack but at disadvantage.

progressionSteps.name: Marked for Death
progressionSteps.description: When you do Tactical Assessment on a creature, gain +3 to attack checks and damage against that creature.

progressionSteps.name: Quickdraw Showdown
progressionSteps.description: You've mastered the art of the quickdraw, a staple in any gunslinger's toolkit. As an action, you can challenge an enemy to a quickdraw duel as an immediate action. Each of you makes an attack; whoever makes the lower check takes the Charmed or Fear condition with the other as the source.

progressionSteps.name: Deft Reload
progressionSteps.description: You've become exceptionally quick at reloading your firearms. You can now reload as a free action. You can also impress creatures with your reloading; make an Influence check to impress or intimidate a creature in or out of combat.

progressionSteps.name: Tough as Nails
progressionSteps.description: This rough life has toughened you up. You gain a +1 to all checks.

progressionSteps.name: Armored Shooter
progressionSteps.description: Your extensive training has taught you how to fire your weapons while wearing armor effectively. You can now wear any armor and not take any penalties.

progressionSteps.name: Shot on the Run
progressionSteps.description: After years of being a Gunslinger, you've mastered the ability to fire accurately while fleeing from danger. When you take the Dash action, you can make an attack at disadvantage with a firearm.

progressionSteps.name: Lead Storm
progressionSteps.description: You've learned to unleash a torrent of bullets upon your enemies. You make 2 attack actions with firearms. After that, you take the Deaf condition for 1 hour.

progressionSteps.name: Powerful Gunslinger
progressionSteps.description: You've reached the pinnacle of gunslinging. Your critical hit range with firearms is 18.

progressionSteps.name: High Noon
progressionSteps.description: You know when to make your move for the most impact. As an action, you can declare it's 'High Noon.' On your next turn, your first ranged attack is an automatic critical hit and Success+++.

talents.name: Investigator
talents.description: The Noir Detective is a sharp-eyed investigator and master of urban intrigue, skilled in navigating shadowy alleys, uncovering hidden truths, and outwitting opponents. Using a mix of deductive prowess, quirky gadgets, and street smarts, they uncover mysteries and manipulate the odds in their favor.

features.name: Mystic Deduction
features.description: You harness the power of deduction and perception to cast spells that reveal truths, manipulate the environment, or influence others. Your Observation Check determines your spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Observation Check.

features.name: Instinctive Insight
features.description: As an off-action spending 1 spell point, gain advantage on checks to detect lies, uncover clues, or sense hidden motives.

progressionSteps.name: Lucky Break
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action spending 1 spell point, reroll a failed Investigation, Observation, or Spirit check.

progressionSteps.name: Mechanical Assistant
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 spell point, deploy a small gadget (e.g., a clockwork insect or bird) to perform surveillance, deliver a message, or retrieve a light object. The gadget lasts 1 hour.

progressionSteps.name: Hidden Contact
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 spell point to speak with a hidden ally in the area who can provide information or minor assistance, such as relaying information, distracting enemies, or retrieving small items.

progressionSteps.name: Interrogation
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 spell point targeting a creature within short range, make a contested Observation check. If you succeed, they must reveal 1 piece of information and suffer disadvantage on Influence checks until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Flash Disruptor
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, use a gadget to blind a target. They must make an Observation check or take the Blind condition until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Identify
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 spell point to analyze an object and learn a key fact about its history, such as its last user, origin, any curses it may contain, or a hidden property about the object.

progressionSteps.name: Smoke Bomb
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 spell point to create dense fog in a short-range area at a point within short range, granting disadvantage to attacks for all creatures in the fog until the end of your next turn. Increase the duration by 1 round with additional spell points.

progressionSteps.name: Hidden Whisper
progressionSteps.description: Whisper a message to a creature within medium range that only they can hear. If the creature is hostile, they must make a Spirit check or become distracted, granting you or an ally advantage on your next attack action targeting them.

progressionSteps.name: Deciphering Lens
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 spell point, automatically succeed on a check to decode messages, read faded text, briefly understand a dead language, or identify obscure symbols.

progressionSteps.name: Wiretap
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 spell point, place a discreet listening device on a surface or object. You can hear any conversations or noises near the object as long as you remain within medium range.

talents.name: Soulblade
talents.description: As a Soulblade, you possess the rare ability to summon weapons from within yourself. You are a master of harnessing the power of your soul to create weapons of incredible strength and durability. Your weapons are a reflection of your innermost self and are imbued with your unique energy.

features.name: Soul Weapon
features.description: As an off-action, summon a powerful melee weapon made entirely of your soul energy that requires an Agility, Strength, or Spirit check to wield. The weapon deals [[1d8]] physical damage and lasts for 1 minute. If you stop touching the weapon, it dissipates immediately.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Reflection
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, when you make an attack with your soul weapon, you can make another attack on the same creature or one within range.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Guard
progressionSteps.description: At the start of combat, gain [[2d6]] armor.

progressionSteps.name: Harmonic Resonance
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-minute action, you can change your soul weapon’s damage type to any Elemental type. Once you do this, you cannot do it again for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Reach
progressionSteps.description: Your soul weapon can become a ranged weapon instead of melee.

progressionSteps.name: Dual Soul Formation
progressionSteps.description: When you make an attack on a creature with your soul weapon, you deal 1 damage of your chosen type to all creatures of your choice within your melee range.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Aegis
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, your soul energy can now coalesce into a protective shield around an ally, granting them [[1d6]] armor for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Tactical Soul
progressionSteps.description: When you have used Tactical Assessment on a creature, you can read their surface-level thoughts and have advantage on social checks against them.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Echo
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you create a spectral duplicate of yourself that can take a turn on your next turn in combat. It exists until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Empowerment
progressionSteps.description: The bond between you and your soul weapon grows stronger. Your soul weapon deals [[2d8]] damage.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Bond
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-minute action, you can create a telepathic link with an ally, allowing silent communication over any distance for 1 hour.

talents.name: Steadfast
talents.description: Walk the path where honor is your shield and resolve your sword. Embody the unyielding spirit of the warrior, standing resolute against all odds. In the tumult of war, you are the calm within the storm. Your talent as a soldier is not just a skill; it is an intrinsic part of who you are. You read the battlefield as a maestro reads a symphony, each movement a note, each strategy a chord. Your instincts, honed by countless skirmishes, allow you to anticipate enemy tactics, turning their maneuvers to your advantage with uncanny precision.

features.name: Awareness Stance
features.description: When you take this stance as a half-action, you can use your off-action to make an opportunity attack at advantage against any creature that enters your melee weapon range.

progressionSteps.name: Steadfast Resolve
progressionSteps.description: While in the Awareness Stance, you are immune to the Fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Battlefield Tactician
progressionSteps.description: Your tactical acumen allows you to exploit enemy weaknesses. When you use Tactical Assessment on an enemy, you and your allies gain a +2 to their attack checks against that enemy while Tactical Assessment is active.

progressionSteps.name: Silent Storm Approach
progressionSteps.description: Learn to blend stealth and speed, striking unexpectedly and with deadly efficiency. You can take the Hide action while you Disengage.

progressionSteps.name: Defensive Harmony
progressionSteps.description: When you take the Awareness Stance, gain [[12]] armor. Additionally, you can hold 2 stances at once.

progressionSteps.name: Zenith Focus
progressionSteps.description: Achieve a heightened state of focus. When you take the Awareness Stance, you can hear invisible creatures and treat them as not being invisible.

progressionSteps.name: Awareness II
progressionSteps.description: When you take the Awareness Stance, give enemies Disadvantage to hit you.

progressionSteps.name: Indomitable Spirit
progressionSteps.description: When you take the Awareness Stance, you are immune to Corpus Conditions until the start of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Wind Cutter Technique
progressionSteps.description: You can take the Awareness Stance as an off-action. After taking the Awareness Stance, you can attack twice on your next turn when you take the Attack action.

progressionSteps.name: Step of the Wind
progressionSteps.description: You are wind incarnate. You can Dash as a half-action.

progressionSteps.name: Steadfast Gambit
progressionSteps.description: Unleash the full extent of your training and inner power in a single, decisive action. As an action, you become a blur to all creatures, making [[1d10+1]] attacks on any creature within medium range or on a single creature. Upon using this ability, you take the Exhausted, Stunned, and Confused conditions for [[1d4]] rounds.

talents.name: Thornweaver
talents.description: As a Thornweaver, you have an unparalleled connection to the world of plants, particularly those with defensive and offensive capabilities. Your ability to manipulate thorns, vines, and other flora allows you to protect your allies, control the battlefield, and strike fear into the hearts of your enemies.

features.name: Vine Trap
features.description: As an action, place a Vine Trap within reach range that triggers when an enemy steps on it, causing [[2d6]] piercing damage and the Pinned condition until the end of your next turn. The trap lasts until removed or triggered.

features.name: Thorn Lash
features.description: As an action, make a Strength or Agility check targeting up to three enemies within short range, dealing [[1d6]] piercing damage to each on a success.

progressionSteps.name: Thorn Stance
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, take the Thorn Stance. When a creature hits you with a melee attack, deal half the damage back to them as piercing damage.

progressionSteps.name: Thornshot
progressionSteps.description: As an action, make a ranged attack within medium range, dealing [[2d6]] physical damage and causing the Bleeding condition.

progressionSteps.name: Living Thorn Armor
progressionSteps.description: As an action, give yourself and an ally within reach range living armor that provides +5 armor.

progressionSteps.name: Poison Thorns
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, enhance your attacks to deal an additional [[3]] toxic damage and inflict the Coughing condition on enemies until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Thorn Lash II
progressionSteps.description: Your Thorn Lash can target up to 6 enemies and deals an additional 3 damage.

progressionSteps.name: Thorned Ground
progressionSteps.description: Transform a short range around you into difficult terrain that remains for 1 minute. Enemies moving through it take [[1d6]] piercing damage each time they enter your Thorned Ground.

progressionSteps.name: Speak with Plants
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to speak Naech (Plants), allowing you to gather information about the surrounding area or ask plants to perform simple tasks.

progressionSteps.name: Floral Ward
progressionSteps.description: Bloom with flowers as an action. Allies within reach range are immune to the Charmed and Confused conditions. This aura lasts for 1 minute or until you dismiss it.

progressionSteps.name: Camouflage
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, gain advantage on Stealth checks until the end of your next turn. If in a natural environment, become Invisible.

progressionSteps.name: Herbal Remedy
progressionSteps.description: As an action, heal an ally within reach range for [[2d6]] healing or remove one non-major condition. If in a natural environment, heal an additional [[1d6]] wounds.

talents.name: Trapper
talents.description: As a Tricky Trapper, you specialize in setting traps and creating diversions to give your team the upper hand in combat. You are a master of deception and misdirection, always looking for ways to outsmart your opponents. With your expertise in disarming and stealing traps, you can turn the tables on your enemies in the blink of an eye.

features.name: Trapper Points
features.description: As an action, set a trap within reach range. The trap remains until triggered or disarmed. Traps have a range of (5 ft) trigger radius and can be spotted with an Observation check.

features.name: Trap Types
features.description: Choose from different types of traps when setting them up.

options.name: Snare Trap
options.effect: Immobilizes the target, causing the Pinned condition.

options.name: Explosive Trap
options.effect: Deals [[2d4]] fire damage to the target and creatures within 5 ft.

options.name: Poison Trap
options.effect: Deals [[1d6]] toxic damage and inflicts the Coughing condition.

options.name: Alarm Trap
options.effect: Emits a loud noise when triggered, alerting allies and startling enemies.

options.name: Healing Trap
options.effect: Heals the first ally to trigger it for [[2d6]] healing.

progressionSteps.name: Quick Setup
progressionSteps.description: Reduce the time it takes to set up a trap to a half-action and increase the trigger range of your traps by +5 ft.

progressionSteps.name: Snare Trap II
progressionSteps.description: Your Snare Trap also causes the Bleeding condition.

progressionSteps.name: Trap Engineer
progressionSteps.description: Your traps gain +5 ft trigger range and deal an additional +2 damage.

progressionSteps.name: Silent Setup
progressionSteps.description: You've become adept at setting up traps stealthily. Enemies no longer get an opportunity to spot you setting up traps or to see the traps themselves.

progressionSteps.name: Explosive Trap II
progressionSteps.description: Explosive Trap deals damage to creatures within 20 ft.

progressionSteps.name: Trap Persistence
progressionSteps.description: Even when triggered, your traps stay operational, able to be triggered a second time—the first time a creature enters their range and at the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Autonomous Traps
progressionSteps.description: Your traps can move to a new location and set themselves. You can command your traps on your turn. Your traps have a chance to be spotted when they move.

progressionSteps.name: Unparalleled Trapper
progressionSteps.description: Your skill in trapping is unsurpassed. You can now set up traps as an off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Healing Trap II
progressionSteps.description: Healing Trap can also remove a Corpus condition.

progressionSteps.name: Calamity Trap
progressionSteps.description: You create a single trap that takes 1 hour. It has the ability to wreak havoc on the battlefield, triggering a terrain-altering effect when sprung (e.g., obscuring mist, difficult terrain, stonequake, avalanche, tornado, etc.). The effect is handled by the narrator and lasts for 1 minute.

classes.name: Support
classes.description: A healer and tactician who bolsters allies during battle.

features.name: Healing Touch
features.description: Spend 1 Support Point to heal an ally.

features.name: Moral Boost
features.description: Grant allies advantage on morale checks for 1 minute.

equipment.name: Medic Bag
equipment.description: Contains healing supplies for emergency use.

paths.name: Boneclad
paths.description: As a Boneclad, you walk a delicate line between life and death, channeling the powers of the afterlife to heal and protect your allies while siphoning strength from the souls of the departed. Your role is to empower your comrades through both restorative necromancy and the tactical manipulation of life force. You bolster your party by weaving between the boundaries of the living and the dead, granting aid in unexpected ways and ensuring that even in death, there is utility. Unlike traditional necromancers, you serve as both a healer and a protector, turning the energies of decay into a force for good.

features.name: Wraithform
features.description: As an action, shroud yourself and an ally in a ghostly aura, granting advantage on stealth checks. Your Spirit Check is your spellcasting modifier, and you have Spell Points equal to your Spirit Check.

progressionSteps.name: Pale Resurrection
progressionSteps.description: Temporarily raise a creature that has taken the Death condition as a wraith to fight for [[1d4]] rounds, spending 3 spell points. They can’t speak but retain their combat abilities.

progressionSteps.name: Bone Spear
progressionSteps.description: As an action, target a creature within medium range with a spellcasting check.

progressionSteps.name: Life Drain
progressionSteps.description: As an action, make a ranged spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, deal [[3d6]] Eclipse damage and heal for half the damage dealt. Add 1 spell point to deal an additional +2 damage per spell point used.

progressionSteps.name: Bone Legion
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 3 spell points, summon a swarm of [[1d10]] PL0 skeletal warriors for [[1d4]] rounds to attack enemies within short range.

progressionSteps.name: Spectral Link
progressionSteps.description: Connect the life force of two allies. Whenever either of them takes damage, it is halved and split between both.

progressionSteps.name: Soul-Sworn Bond
progressionSteps.description: Link your soul with an ally, granting them advantage on all checks, but when they make a check, you take [[1d6]] psychic damage.

progressionSteps.name: Haunting Gaze
progressionSteps.description: Spend 2 spell points to lock eyes with an enemy, stunning them with visions of death. They must make a Spirit check or be stunned for 1 round.

progressionSteps.name: Bonebound Aegis
progressionSteps.description: Summon a wall of spectral bones that grants cover to allies and absorbs [[2d6]] damage per ally behind it, spending 4 spell points.

progressionSteps.name: Grave Swarm
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 2 spell points, raise a horde of decomposed hands from the ground, pinning all enemies in a medium range area for [[1d6]] rounds.

progressionSteps.name: Requiem of the Fallen
progressionSteps.description: You offer yourself as a conduit for the dead, allowing Zuinmuir to momentarily return all fallen allies to life through your sacrifice. You sacrifice yourself to resurrect all allies who have died within the last 24 hours. They return to life with full health, free of conditions, and are empowered by the god of death, granting them advantage on all checks for the next minute. Once the spell concludes, you die, your soul delivered to Zuinmuir as a faithful servant.

paths.name: Careward
paths.description: The Careward embodies the heart of compassion and ingenuity, serving as a lifeline for their allies and a bridge between realms. They wield a rare gift: the ability to conjure sanctuaries that transcend the physical plane. These sanctuaries are not merely safe havens but also spaces of creativity, collaboration, and possibility, where the party can regroup, heal, and prepare for the challenges ahead. The Careward’s sanctuaries are as versatile as they are personal. These demi-planes reflect the Careward’s imagination, ranging from serene gardens to arcane workshops or even bustling miniature cities. Within these sanctuaries, allies can rest in safety, collaborate on projects, and recover from the tolls of battle, while the Careward remains at the center of this dynamic haven, guiding and inspiring those who enter.

features.name: Sanctuary
features.description: As an action, spend 1 Inspiration to create a door to a small sanctuary that lasts for 10 minutes. Spend 2 Inspiration for a Press On or 3 for a Long Rest. Your sanctuary is a shared space with living creatures, but you choose the theme of the sanctuary you create. The space is a small singular room that fits your party comfortably. Creatures cannot remain in your sanctuary while you are not there.

progressionSteps.name: Planar Strike
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, make a Spirit check on a creature within short range and deal [[1d6+3]] Thunder damage on a success as you tear the realm around them.

progressionSteps.name: Planar Guide
progressionSteps.description: You can recognize when creatures are from another plane of existence. As an action spending 1 Inspiration, you can open a portal to a creature's native plane, which stays open until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Sanctuary Guardian
progressionSteps.description: You have a guardian in your sanctuary that is PL3. They can leave your sanctuary for 1 minute, but if they do, they must hibernate or deactivate for 1 hour.

progressionSteps.name: Sanctuary Recall
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action while in your Sanctuary spending 1 Inspiration, you can instantly recall a willing ally to your Sanctuary, regardless of distance. Allies in your sanctuary receive +1 healing per minute while in your sanctuary.

progressionSteps.name: Sanctuary II
progressionSteps.description: Your Sanctuary becomes a larger place with a host of creatures of your choice that live there and aid you. They can work on simple tasks and projects, or you can spend 3 Inspiration per task to have them begin more complex tasks like repairing armor, crafting weapons, or making potions. They do it successfully but not to an impressive level; the armor would be repaired but not to its original state, or the crafted weapons would be quite plain.

progressionSteps.name: Impressive Inspiration
progressionSteps.description: You can target 2 creatures with your Inspirations simultaneously, but they must be within touch range.

progressionSteps.name: Planar Strike II
progressionSteps.description: Increase the damage of your Planar Strike to [[3d6+3]] elemental damage of your choice. On a successful hit, you can spend 1 Inspiration to send the creature to your Sanctuary. While there, they must make an Influence check. On a failure, they remain for 1 minute and have the Charmed condition with you as the source. This still allows them to be hostile to everything else.

progressionSteps.name: Planar Guide II
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, target a creature not from your current plane. You can touch them and make a Spirit check, on a success sending them back to their home plane.

progressionSteps.name: Sanctuary Guardian II
progressionSteps.description: Your Sanctuary Guardian becomes a massive creature with a PL of 8 and can be summoned from your Sanctuary as an action. It can remain outside of your sanctuary for 1 hour before needing to hibernate.

progressionSteps.name: Ultimate Sanctuary
progressionSteps.description: You can create a network of Sanctuaries across different planes. You can travel between these sanctuaries at will, assuming there would be doors or portals in your Sanctuary to access them. Reduce the cost of tasks for your minions to 1 Inspiration per task. The sanctuary can be vast, and creatures can remain in your sanctuary while you are not there.

paths.name: Dreamweaver
paths.description: As a Dreamweaver, you have unlocked the mysteries of dreams and nightmares. You are able to influence the dreamscapes of your allies and enemies, providing relief or inducing fear as needed. This unique power allows you to heal allies and harm foes in ways others cannot comprehend, but sometimes the price of delving into the dreamscape can be unpredictably high.

features.name: Dreamweaver's Mark
features.description: As an off-action, you can mark a creature within short range. The creature remains marked until you use this ability on a different creature or the marked creature dies. While a creature is marked, you can interact with their dreams and nightmares, and if the creature dies while marked, their soul is trapped in your dream realm. You gain +1 Influence per soul in the Dream Realm.

features.name: Influence Spellcaster
features.description: Your spells are a grand spectacle, cast through dramatic acts or musical renditions. You cast spells with your Influence Check, you have spell points equal to your Influence Check.

features.name: Nightmare Weapon
features.description: As an off-action spending 1 spell point, create a melee weapon forged of nightmares that lasts for 1 hour and deals [[1d6]] damage of your choice. You can use your Influence check to wield it. When you create the weapon, you can spend an additional spell point to increase the damage by an additional +1.

progressionSteps.name: Dream Inducement
progressionSteps.description: As an action touch a creature that can dream, spend an Inspiration, and make an Influence check. On a success the creature is stunned until the end of their next turn +1 per success.

progressionSteps.name: Nightmare Weapon II
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action spending 1 Inspiration create a tangible weapon made of condensed nightmares. This spectral weapon can take the form of any weapon that you can dream of and deals [[1d6]] elemental damage of your choice.

progressionSteps.name: Phantasmal Getaway
progressionSteps.description: As an action using 1 Inspiration, you can conjure a ghostly vehicle which you and your companions can use for a swift escape. The vehicle lasts for 3 hours before fading back into the Dreamsea.

progressionSteps.name: Dreamspace
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration and a snap of your fingers, you can open a portal or door to a pocket dimension that you dream of and is part of your dream realm. You can create anything here, but it is a small space like the size of a room, and it remains for 1 hour. At the end of the hour, any creatures in the dream space are thrown from the realm.

progressionSteps.name: Phantasmal Aide
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, you create a PL3 servant or minion of your choice. This servant can perform simple tasks and chores for you, and you choose what creatures can see your servant. The servant lasts for 1 hour or until dismissed.

progressionSteps.name: Dream Inducement II
progressionSteps.description: While a creature is stunned by your Dream Inducement, you can spend an additional Inspiration and cause [[2d6]] water damage or cause a Cognition condition.

progressionSteps.name: Nightmare Weapon III
progressionSteps.description: You can attack twice when you attack as an action when using your nightmare weapon. And your weapon deals an additional +3 damage

progressionSteps.name: Dreamspace II
progressionSteps.description: As a 10-minute action spending 1 Inspiration, you manifest a large dreamy tent or cabin, providing you and your party with a safe and comfortable place to rest. This magical refuge is warm and dry, regardless of the weather outside, and can comfortably accommodate up to six people. It contains basic furniture and can even provide simple meals. The refuge lasts for 8 hours or until dismissed, and cannot be used again until after a Long Rest.

progressionSteps.name: Phantasmal Aid II
progressionSteps.description: Your servant is a PL6, is capable of flight, and lasts for 4 hours before dissipating.

progressionSteps.name: Dreamspace Permanence
progressionSteps.description: Your Dreamspace becomes an infinite realm that is part of the Dreamsea. Anything you can think of exists here. You can close the space from the outside world, and creatures that remain here become part of your Dream Realm. You feed from their souls, and eventually, they drift into a permanent sleep, becoming part of your Dream Realm.

paths.name: Pactmaker
paths.description: As a Pactmaker aligned with the dark energies of Ordealis, you've embraced the power lurking within its nine layers, each ordeal shaping your abilities and defining your role as a master of demonic pacts. Your journey through Ordealis has not only granted you unique insights into the realm of demons but also imbued your pacts with the essence of each layer, from the Fields of Desolation to the Temple of Asmodeus.

features.name: Make a Deal
features.description: As a half-action, give allies within reach range advantage on checks until the end of their next turn, but you have disadvantage on checks until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Fields of Desolation Pact
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, you can invoke the weariness and desolation of the Fields to drain the will of your enemies, giving enemies within your Make a Deal range disadvantage on attack checks.

progressionSteps.name: Iron Dominion Bond
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, channel the relentless fortitude and cursed iron of the Iron Dominion to forge pacts that give you and your allies +10 armor that lasts for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Clockwork Abyss Accord
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, utilize the temporal anomalies of the Clockwork Abyss to manipulate the flow of time around your affected allies, granting them an additional off-action on their turn.

progressionSteps.name: Library of Demons Covenant
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, draw upon the vast knowledge and arcane mysteries within the Library. Your allies have advantage on checks for and against spells and magical effects.

progressionSteps.name: Discordant Symphony Harmony
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, harness the chaotic energies of the Discordant Symphony, dealing [[1d10]] Thunder damage to enemy creatures within your Make a Deal range.

progressionSteps.name: Silent Void Pact
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, your allies gain the Invisible condition, invoking the Silent Void's muffling silence to shield them.

progressionSteps.name: River of Souls Bond
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, you can read the surface thoughts of a creature in range of your Make a Deal ability.

progressionSteps.name: Fields of Torment Accord
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, bolster the spirits of your allies with the unyielding resolve of those who traverse the Fields of Torment, granting them immunity to Cognitive conditions.

progressionSteps.name: Asmodeus’ Judgment
progressionSteps.description: Your Make a Deal range becomes Short range, an off-action, and you no longer have disadvantage when you use Make a Deal.

progressionSteps.name: Silent Guardian
progressionSteps.description: When you Make a Deal, cloak your allies in the essence of the Infinite Abyss, giving them the Intangible condition. Attacks pass through them without causing harm, and they move with ghostly silence, unseen and unheard. However, the Pactmaker becomes Blind while they channel this ability; this is unable to be removed or prevented.

paths.name: Shepherd
paths.description: Shepherds of Souls are itinerant mystics who bridge the realms of the living and the dead. They guide lost spirits to their final rest, ward off malevolent entities, and provide solace to those who mourn. Through rituals and spectral tools, they manipulate the fragile boundary between life and death, balancing mercy and might.

features.name: Soul Lantern
features.description: A large lantern made with Mournesteel that gives power over souls. Check of your choice, Deals [[1d10]] Solar damage. Deals an additional [[1d4]] Eclipse damage per spell point used before the attack.

progressionSteps.name: Blinding Radiance
progressionSteps.description: Your lantern can emit a blinding flash. As an off-action, impose disadvantage on the next attack of a creature targeting you or an ally within short range.

progressionSteps.name: Spectral Ward
progressionSteps.description: As an action, create a protective aura. Allies within short range gain immunity to Psychic damage and advantage on Spirit checks until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Frozen Soul
progressionSteps.description: Add a binding effect to your Soul Lantern. Creatures damaged by your lantern must succeed on a Spirit check or take the Frozen condition until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Phantom Hunter
progressionSteps.description: Your Soul Lantern gains a ranged attack. As an action, throw a spectral flame from your lantern at a creature within medium range, dealing [[2d6]] Fire damage.

progressionSteps.name: Ethereal Chains
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, launch chains of light from your lantern. A creature within short range must succeed on a Spirit check or be pinned until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Spectral Chains
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, bind a spirit or undead creature within short range. They must succeed on a Spirit check (15) or be restrained until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Ethereal Step
progressionSteps.description: Spend 1 spell point, take the Intangible condition until the end of your turn. Ending your turn inside an object deals [[1d6]] Psychic damage to you.

progressionSteps.name: Guiding Light
progressionSteps.description: As an action, mark a spirit or undead creature. Allies gain advantage on attacks against the marked target until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Banishing Light
progressionSteps.description: Spend 1 spell point to unleash a burst of light from your lantern. All spirits, demons, and undead within short range must make a Spirit check or be banished to their original plane of existence until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Warden's Vigil
progressionSteps.description: Once per long rest, summon a spectral guardian for 1 minute. The guardian occupies a space within medium range and provides the following effects:

options.name: Damage Aura
options.effect: Deals [[2d8]] Psychic damage to enemies within reach at the start of its turn.

options.name: Healing Aura
options.effect: Allies in short range of the guardian heal for [[1d6]] at the start of their turn.

options.name: Spirit Damper
options.effect: Spirits, demons, and undead in medium range have disadvantage on all checks and saving throws.

paths.name: Siphon
paths.description: In the dim twilight of the Eclipse, a realm that whispers of the secrets held between life and death, the Siphons walk a precarious path. These adept practitioners of shadow and light do not merely manipulate the energies of life; they commune with the very essence of existence, drawing upon the Eclipse's enigmatic powers to control the fate of souls. With one hand reaching into the pulsating heart of life and the other ensnared in the cold grip of death, Siphons are the arbiters of a delicate equilibrium, capable of tipping the scales in favor of creation or oblivion.

features.name: Soul Harvest
features.description: Gain a Soul Harvest Resource, this resource starts at 0 with a maximum capacity of 20. As an action, you can touch a living creature and deal [[1d10]] Eclipse damage, and the amount of damage dealt is then added to your Soul Harvest, or touch an ally and heal them for up to the current amount stored in the Soul Harvest.

progressionSteps.name: Essence Transfer
progressionSteps.description: When you deal damage to an enemy, you can heal an ally within reach range for half the damage dealt.

progressionSteps.name: Shroud of Shadows
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Inspiration to cloak yourself and one ally in shadows, granting invisibility for 1 minute or until you attack or cast a spell.

progressionSteps.name: Veil of the Reaper
progressionSteps.description: (Gain 1 Inspiration) As an action spending 1 Inspiration, become intangible until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Necrotic Infusion
progressionSteps.description: Deal an additional [[1d4]] Eclipse damage on weapon attacks.

progressionSteps.name: Grim Harvest
progressionSteps.description: Your Soul Harvest ability becomes a half-action and deals an additional +5 damage.

progressionSteps.name: Spectral Leap
progressionSteps.description: Teleport in a line through the Eclipse a short range, dealing [[1d10]] Eclipse damage to all creatures in that line, filling your Soul Harvest with the damage dealt.

progressionSteps.name: Eternal Sacrifice
progressionSteps.description: You can spend your Soul Harvest to increase the check or damage on an attack or the attack of an ally within short range. Every 3 points spent is +1.

progressionSteps.name: Grim Harvest II
progressionSteps.description: Your Soul Harvest ability can be an off-action and deals an additional +5 damage (10 total).

progressionSteps.name: Death's Embrace
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can Soul Harvest any number of targets within short range.

progressionSteps.name: Zuinmuir’s Covenant
progressionSteps.description: As an action, become an avatar of death until the end of your next turn. You can choose any creature within medium range to take the Death condition. Make a Spirit check with -5 per creature you choose; on a failure, your body is taken by the god of death, Zuinmuir, and you die instead.

paths.name: Tactician
paths.description: The Tactician is a master of battlefield strategy, precision strikes, and adaptability. With sharp instincts and an intimate understanding of combat dynamics, they analyze their enemies' weaknesses, exploit vulnerabilities, and provide critical support to allies. Whether leading the charge or operating independently, the Tactician turns the tide of battle with calculated precision and tactical brilliance.

features.name: Exploit Weakness
features.description: As an off-action spending 1 Inspiration, when you hit with a weapon attack, deal +5 additional damage.

progressionSteps.name: Tactical Evasion
progressionSteps.description: Anticipate attacks and reposition to minimize impact; when an attacker you can see hits you, use your reaction to halve the damage.

progressionSteps.name: Adaptive Combatant
progressionSteps.description: Turn everyday objects into weapons; your unarmed strikes and improvised weapons deal [[1d6]] physical damage.

progressionSteps.name: Exploit Weakness II
progressionSteps.description: When you use Exploit Weakness, also impose the Bleeding and Confused condition on the target.

progressionSteps.name: Battlefield Medic
progressionSteps.description: When you take the Dodge action, heal an adjacent ally for +5.

progressionSteps.name: Coordinated Assault
progressionSteps.description: After successfully hitting an enemy, your next attack against them has advantage.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Opportunist
progressionSteps.description: Your unarmed strikes or improvised weapons can deal any elemental damage type of your choice.

progressionSteps.name: Precision Overload
progressionSteps.description: Your Exploit Weakness ignores armor and immunity.

progressionSteps.name: Cloaked Medic
progressionSteps.description: When you heal an ally, grant them the Invisible condition until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Strike and Heal
progressionSteps.description: When you heal an ally, make a free attack against an enemy within reach range.

progressionSteps.name: Calculated Execution
progressionSteps.description: When you make an attack and roll a success+, choose the outcome from the damage table instead of rolling.

talents.name: Alchemystic
talents.description: Whether brewing elixirs that heal wounds and fortify spirits, crafting scents that alter moods and perceptions, or rigging arcane devices that protect and devastate, the Alchemystic is a versatile force on the battlefield and beyond. Their knowledge is their weapon, and their ingenuity is their shield. Through their mastery of mystical concoctions, they navigate the complex interplay of light and shadow, substance and spirit, crafting a legacy that echoes through the ages.

features.name: Jury-Rigged Protection
features.description: Your knack for improvisation extends to creating makeshift barriers and protections. As an action, you can create a barrier that provides temporary armor to those behind it. The barrier can be a wall or half-dome that can encompass a short-range radius and has armor equal to your Intellect check. The barrier resembles the environment it was cast in, and creatures require an Observation check to discern that it is not part of the environment.

progressionSteps.name: Cat's Eye Brew
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, create a potion that grants the drinker night vision and the ability to see through illusions for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Alchemical Accelerant
progressionSteps.description: You've developed a potent accelerant that can enhance your speed. By spending 1 Inspiration as an action, you can drink this accelerant and double your movement speed for 1 minute. After the minute, you take the Exhaustion condition for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Bargain Brewer
progressionSteps.description: When you craft an elixir, you craft 2. The other is stored in your inventory or can be used with the other, doubling the effect.

progressionSteps.name: Black Blood Tonic
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, create a potion that turns the drinker's blood into a lethal poison for any creature that ingests it, dealing 5 toxic damage to melee attackers when they land a successful attack.

progressionSteps.name: Hooch of Haste
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, craft this hooch that gives an additional action on the drinker’s next turn. However, if they drink it again on the next turn, they take the Blind condition.

progressionSteps.name: Arcane Artillery
progressionSteps.description: (Gain 1 Inspiration) As an action, you can rig a mundane item to serve as an arcane cannon. This contraption can fire a blast of arcane energy, using your Intellect modifier as the attack roll and dealing damage equal to your Inspiration roll [[1d8]] physical damage to a single target. The cannon lasts for 1 minute and can be fired by anyone as an action.

progressionSteps.name: Alchemical Infusion
progressionSteps.description: You've learned to imbue your weapons with alchemical substances for a short time. By spending 1 Inspiration as an action, you can coat your weapon in a substance that adds +2 elemental damage (acid, fire, ice, etc.) to your weapon attacks for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Tawny Owl Draught
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, create a potion that enhances the drinker's stamina regeneration, making them Immune to the Exhaustion condition for 1 minute but causes Blindness after the minute.

progressionSteps.name: Arcane Detonator
progressionSteps.description: (Gain 1 Inspiration) As an action spending 1 Inspiration, you can rig a simple object to explode with magical energy. The detonator uses your Inspiration [[1d8]] for damage in a reach range from the device, and the object must be triggered manually or can be set to explode after a certain condition is met (like being moved or time-based).

progressionSteps.name: Jack’s Potion
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, create a potion that gives +3 to all checks for 1 minute.

talents.name: Barber
talents.description: The Barber, skilled in both the art of grooming and the rudimentary aspects of surgery, is a figure that bridges the gap between daily vanity and the grim realities of life and death. Once common in medieval and early modern societies, they performed a wide array of tasks from cutting hair to amputating limbs. In the Check20 system, the Barber-Surgeon combines these historic roles into a versatile character capable of both healing and harming, reflective of their unique position in society.

features.name: Keen Eye for Detail
features.description: Years of precise work have honed your observation skills. Gain advantage on Intellect (Medical) checks related to diagnosing ailments, diseases, and curses.

features.name: Restorative Trim
features.description: As an action, give a minor cosmetic or medical enhancement to grant a creature advantage on Influence checks for 1 minute, but you can only use it once per day on the same creature.

progressionSteps.name: Scalpel Precision
progressionSteps.description: Your attacks with small blades (daggers, scalpels) deal an additional [[1d4]] damage.

progressionSteps.name: Bloodletting
progressionSteps.description: A controversial method that can either harm or heal. As an action, make an Intellect check to either deal damage equal to your Intellect check to an enemy or heal an ally for the same amount. The choice must be made before the check.

progressionSteps.name: Anesthetic Brew
progressionSteps.description: You've mastered the creation of pain-relieving concoctions. As a half-action, you can administer an anesthetic to a creature, granting +10 armor for 1 minute or healing for an amount equal to your Intellect check.

progressionSteps.name: Master Barber
progressionSteps.description: Your grooming skills can boost morale or disguise. Once per day as an action, give a creature a makeover, granting them advantage on Influence and Stealth checks for 24 hours.

progressionSteps.name: Empathic Listener
progressionSteps.description: Your experience dealing with clients has made you an excellent listener. Gain advantage on an Influence or Intellect check related to understanding or persuading someone.

progressionSteps.name: Hygienic Aura
progressionSteps.description: (Passive) Your presence and practices promote health, granting allies within medium range +5 total wounds.

progressionSteps.name: Regenerist
progressionSteps.description: As a full-day action, you can regenerate or create a new limb if one is missing on a willing creature. After the day of work, you cannot use this feature again for 1 month or until you gather more supplies (should be a fair cost, around 300gp or a rare resource).

progressionSteps.name: Disguise Craft
progressionSteps.description: As a 10-minute action, with your tools, you can alter a person's appearance significantly. This allows you or an ally to blend into a crowd or impersonate someone else.

progressionSteps.name: Network of Whispers
progressionSteps.description: Your profession allows you to hear rumors and secrets. Once per session, you can declare that you've heard a rumor relevant to your current situation with a successful Luck check, subject to Narrator approval.

progressionSteps.name: Blade Dancer
progressionSteps.description: You wield your razors and scissors with such precision that they become extensions of your body. +3 Attack Bonus with slashing weapons.

talents.name: Flapper
talents.description: The Elemental Flapper is a vivacious force of nature, seamlessly blending charm and charisma with elemental powers that reflect their dazzling personality and volatile spirit. Whether in the urbane settings of high society or the raw wilderness, they manipulate fire, water, air, or earth to enhance their movements, deceive foes, and captivate allies with elemental flair.

features.name: Elemental Flourish
features.description: Your mastery of elemental charisma allows you to infuse actions with captivating elemental displays. When you succeed on an Influence check, you grant an ally within short range advantage on their next check.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Grace
progressionSteps.description: Once per day, reroll a failed check. If the reroll is successful, gain advantage on your next check of the same type.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Strike
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, channel elemental energy into your unarmed strike. Deal [[1d6]] elemental damage of a chosen type.

progressionSteps.name: Reflexive Element
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, make an Influence check to invoke your elemental energy to avoid harm. On a success, gain advantage on a check to dodge or escape and reduce incoming damage by [[1d6]] per success.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Serenade
progressionSteps.description: As an action, weave elemental energy into a performance. Make an Influence check and on success, all chosen creatures within short range become Charmed until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Minion
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Spell Point and summon a PL3 medium-sized Elemental creature of your design and type. It remains for 1 hour and can complete simple tasks. You can have up to 3 minions at one time.

progressionSteps.name: Blending Aura
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, channel elemental energy to adapt to your surroundings. Gain the Invisible condition until the end of your next turn or when you take an aggressive action.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Charisma
progressionSteps.description: As an action, attempt to charm a creature within short range with a dazzling elemental display. Make an Influence check; on success, the target is Charmed until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Surge
progressionSteps.description: As an action, leap up to medium range. Leave behind a short-range burning path that deals [[1d6]] Fire damage to creatures passing through it. Knock a target prone on a successful strike, dealing [[1d6]] Thunder damage.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Verse
progressionSteps.description: As an action, create an elemental ripple in your voice. Make an Influence check; on success, creatures within short range have disadvantage on their next check.

progressionSteps.name: Aetherial Glow
progressionSteps.description: As an action, emit a soft elemental light that creates a calming aura. Allies within short range gain advantage on Spirit checks until the end of your next turn.

talents.name: Harmonizer
talents.description: Harmonizers are gifted individuals who draw upon the ancient wisdom of the stars and the subtle energies of celestial bodies to support their allies. With a deep understanding of astrological alignments and cosmic forces, they navigate the battlefield with an otherworldly grace, channeling the universe's vast energies to heal, protect, and empower their companions. Through their connection to the cosmos, they bring about auspicious events, realign energies for optimal outcomes, and provide insights that transcend ordinary understanding.

features.name: Attunement
features.description: As an action, you can attune a creature within reach range. While attuned, you can react to their needs and give them the Help action as a reaction for 1 minute. You can only attune to one creature at a time.

progressionSteps.name: Stellar Shield
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction when your attuned ally is attacked, conjure a shield of starlight that grants them +5 armor until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Orbital Assistance
progressionSteps.description: When you give a creature the Help action, their movement does not provoke opportunity attacks until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Gravity Well
progressionSteps.description: When giving the Help action to an attuned ally, spend 1 Inspiration and create a gravitational field that pulls enemies within a short range towards a point of your choosing within short range of the target. The targeted creature must be Large or smaller and can make a Strength or Agility check to deny the movement by half per success.

progressionSteps.name: Nebulous Escape
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction when your attuned ally starts their turn, give them the Disengage action as a free action, enveloping them in a cloud of nebula-like mist to obscure their exit.

progressionSteps.name: Critical Attunement
progressionSteps.description: When your attuned ally makes a Critical hit, they deal triple the damage instead of double.

progressionSteps.name: Attunement II
progressionSteps.description: You can have 2 attuned creatures.

progressionSteps.name: Celestial Counsel
progressionSteps.description: As an action, draw upon the wisdom of the stars to offer sage advice. You can conduct a celestial reading to provide guidance on a decision or problem faced by the party, potentially revealing hidden information or suggesting auspicious actions.

progressionSteps.name: Astral Projection
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can project your consciousness into the Astral Plane to communicate with celestial beings or explore distant locations. While in this astral state, you are intangible and can only interact with other intangible beings. No creatures can hear you, but they might see you if they have high Spirit.

progressionSteps.name: Starlit Path
progressionSteps.description: Your connection to the cosmos guides your journey. When traveling under the night sky, you and your party move more swiftly and are less likely to encounter danger, as if the stars themselves watch over you.

progressionSteps.name: Solar Finding
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending Inspiration causes a celestial light from the sky to a location you desire. This can be used to find lost items, track a creature, blind a creature temporarily, or for any number of uses.

talents.name: Lifeweaver
talents.description: With hands that can both heal and harm, Lifeweavers are revered for their unique ability to manipulate the very essence of life. Drawing upon the interconnectedness of all beings, they redistribute health, siphon vigor from foes to fortify friends, and bind adversaries in shared fates of suffering. Their presence is a balm to allies and a bane to enemies, embodying the duality of creation and destruction.

features.name: Conduit
features.description: As an action, touch 2 creatures and transfer up to 10 wounds from one to the other. If a creature is unwilling, you must make a contested Spirit check against them.

progressionSteps.name: Condition Conduit
progressionSteps.description: When you use Conduit, you can choose to transfer conditions instead.

progressionSteps.name: Conduit II
progressionSteps.description: When you use Conduit, if a creature is unwilling, you can make a Spirit check instead of a contested check.

progressionSteps.name: Enhanced Conduit
progressionSteps.description: When you use the Conduit, you may do so at a short range.

progressionSteps.name: Mending Miasma
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, create a healing fog within a short range from you that heals allies for +1 at the start of their turn and deals -1 damage to enemies at the start of theirs.

progressionSteps.name: Life Link
progressionSteps.description: Choose a creature within reach; whenever you take damage, that creature also takes that damage.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Conduit
progressionSteps.description: When you use Conduit and each creature has spell points, you can choose to transfer up to 5 spell points from one creature to the other.

progressionSteps.name: Disease Conduit
progressionSteps.description: When you use Conduit and spend 1 Inspiration, you can choose to transfer a disease in its current state from one creature to another.

progressionSteps.name: Curse Conduit
progressionSteps.description: When you use Conduit and spend 1 Inspiration, you can choose to transfer a curse in its current state from one creature to another.

progressionSteps.name: Resurgence
progressionSteps.description: When an ally falls to 0 hit points, use your reaction to give a creature the opportunity to make a Spirit check, regaining [[1d10]] wounds on a success.

progressionSteps.name: Dual Edict of Inspiration
progressionSteps.description: By spending 2 Inspiration points, simultaneously apply two different effects from the Inspiration mechanic to a single target or one effect to two different targets.

talents.name: Medic
talents.description: The Medic is a versatile class that seamlessly blends the healing prowess of a traditional medic with the martial skills of a warrior. They excel at rapidly treating wounds and injuries during combat, ensuring their allies remain in fighting shape. In addition to their potent healing capabilities, Medics are well-trained in combat. They can skillfully wield weapons and armor, holding their own against formidable opponents.

features.name: Frontline Resilience
features.description: Your constant exposure to battlefield chaos has made you resilient. Gain advantage on checks against fear or intimidation effects.

features.name: Last Stand
features.description: As an action, spend 1 Inspiration and touch a creature, healing them for +5 and preventing conditions until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Fast Healer
progressionSteps.description: You can use Inspiration as an off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Distant Healing
progressionSteps.description: When you use an Inspiration as an action, you can do so at short range.

progressionSteps.name: Dual Healing
progressionSteps.description: When you use an Inspiration as an action, you can target 2 creatures.

progressionSteps.name: Iron Will
progressionSteps.description: If you are to take a non-major condition, expend 1 Inspiration and make an Intellect check. On a success, you prevent the condition.

progressionSteps.name: Called Strikes
