progressionSteps.description: You can make a called shot at -6 instead of -10.

progressionSteps.name: Pushing Attack
progressionSteps.description: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one Inspiration to attempt to drive the target back. If the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength check. Push the target up to 20 ft away from you, reducing the distance by 5 ft per success.

progressionSteps.name: Wide-Swing Healing
progressionSteps.description: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend 1 Inspiration and heal another creature within the same action within 5 ft.

progressionSteps.name: Rapid Response
progressionSteps.description: When an ally takes the Injured condition, you can use a free action to move your movement speed towards them and as an off-action spend 1 Inspiration to heal them.

progressionSteps.name: Battlefield Commander
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, spending 1 Inspiration, grant an ally within earshot an immediate off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Shielded Recovery
progressionSteps.description: While healing an ally, both you and the ally gain +3 armor until your next turn.

talents.name: Mossheart
talents.description: Mosshearts are living embodiments of nature's boundless power, blending the resilience of the earth with the regenerative properties of flora and fungi. These guardians of the wild harness the essence of the natural world to protect, heal, and fortify, creating a symbiotic bond between themselves and the life around them. A Mossheart's presence brings a sense of balance and harmony, offering allies not only support but also a connection to the untamed beauty of nature. The Mossheart’s abilities go beyond simple healing or protection; they shape the battlefield into an extension of the natural world. Thorny barriers, regenerative blooms, and animated guardians form an arsenal as versatile as it is effective. They create opportunities to halt enemy advances, protect allies, or even transform the tide of combat through their deep connection to nature.

features.name: Verdant Renewal
features.description: As an action, expend 1 Inspiration to expel pollen in a short range to either heal your allies for +5 healing or repair their armor for +5, chosen by you beforehand.

progressionSteps.name: Nature’s Rebuke
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction to an enemy’s attack, spend 3 spell points to create a thorny backlash. Make a Spellcasting check to reflect half of the damage back at the attacker. For an additional 2 spell points, reflect the entire damage.

progressionSteps.name: Nature’s Mana
progressionSteps.description: Gain +5 Spell points. When you cast spells while in nature, recover +1 spell point when you get a success+ on spells you cast.

progressionSteps.name: Twice Bloomed
progressionSteps.description: After using Verdant Renewal, any creatures that are healed or armored take half damage on the next attack that hits them.

progressionSteps.name: Nature’s Sentinel
progressionSteps.description: Expand 1 Inspiration to summon a PL4 guardian made of moss and branches. The guardian remains for 1 minute, and your guardian can use your Inspiration in the same manner you can.

progressionSteps.name: Hidden Grove
progressionSteps.description: Once per day, as an action spending an Inspiration, create a small door made of moss and stone that opens into a secret grove. You can remain in this place for 1 day, allowing you to get some downtime and recover. Only creatures you choose can enter this space, and it prevents creatures from spying on you.

progressionSteps.name: Verdant Renewal II
progressionSteps.description: Your Verdant Renewal range is increased to medium range.

progressionSteps.name: Lash of Thorns
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Inspiration to summon thorny vines that lash out and bind up to two enemies within short range, dealing 5 nature damage and restricting their movement for one turn.

progressionSteps.name: Nature Step
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Inspiration, choose yourself and another creature to step into the shadow of a tree, stone, or other natural structure, teleporting up to medium range to another shadow within sight.

progressionSteps.name: Thorned Renewal
progressionSteps.description: When you use Verdant Renewal, it gives each healed or armored creature thorns that deal 5 piercing damage to creatures that hit them with a melee attack.

progressionSteps.name: Shapeshift
progressionSteps.description: Spend 1 Inspiration to transform into creatures like a fox, hare, or owl, granting benefits such as enhanced senses, stealth, or flight for up to 1 hour or until dismissed. You cannot cast spells or use Inspiration while in this form.

talents.name: Puppeteer
talents.description: The Puppeteer is a master of creativity and strategy, wielding their crafted puppets to dominate the battlefield and shape the narrative of any encounter. These animated constructs are more than tools of war; they are extensions of the Puppeteer’s will, forged from imagination and brought to life through skill and determination. Whether commanding a horde of shadowy marionettes or a single, intricately designed masterpiece, the Puppeteer is a force to be reckoned with. Each puppet offers endless possibilities for customization and utility. From fearsome warriors with elemental-infused strikes to agile scouts capable of navigating terrain others cannot, the Puppeteer adapts their creations to suit the challenges at hand. Their puppets can defend allies, disrupt enemies, or even perform tasks that require precision or ingenuity, acting as both tools and companions in the journey.

features.name: Puppet
features.description: As an action, spend 1 Inspiration to summon a PL3 puppet of your design within a short range that lasts for 1 hour. Directing your puppet requires no action, but maintaining control requires focus; because of this, you can only have 2 puppets active at a time. It has a [[1d4]] weapon of your choice. Your puppets have limited range and can only move up to short range from you.

progressionSteps.name: Combat Refinement
progressionSteps.description: Your puppet gains combat proficiency, giving it a +2 attack bonus and damage. Your puppets can also remain once created until you take a long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Aegis Framework
progressionSteps.description: Increase the puppet's durability by reinforcing its structure. It has +1 PL and an additional +5 armor.

progressionSteps.name: Swift Ambulator
progressionSteps.description: As your action, enhance the puppet's mobility momentarily, granting it additional movement options such as flying, swimming, or burrowing at a speed equal to your speed until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Embodiment
progressionSteps.description: Infuse your puppets with an elemental damage type (fire, ice, lightning, etc.), allowing it to deal that damage with its weapon attacks for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Reactive Adaptation
progressionSteps.description: The puppet can now react to incoming attacks, gaining the ability to use your Off-Action (reaction) to impose disadvantage on attack rolls against it once per round.

progressionSteps.name: Sentience Spark
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, grant a puppet a limited form of sentience, allowing it to perform simple tasks, make basic decisions, move without limited range, and communicate simple concepts to you without direct control for 1 hour.

progressionSteps.name: Puppet Master
progressionSteps.description: You can have up to 3 puppets at one time. Your puppets are PL5 and can move up to a medium range from you.

progressionSteps.name: Puppeteer's Veil
progressionSteps.description: As an action, your puppets emit a veil of shadows that grants allies within reach range Stealth advantage until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Puppet Reinforcement
progressionSteps.description: Your puppet gains +10 armor and can be equipped with Standard Weapons.

progressionSteps.name: Ethereal Strings
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Inspiration, one of your puppets can gain the Intangible or Invisible condition until the end of your next turn.

classes.name: Merchant
classes.description: A savvy entrepreneur who uses wealth and cunning to gain an advantage.

features.name: Market Mastery
features.description: Gain advantage on trade-related checks.

features.name: Quick Calculation
features.description: Instantly estimate the value of goods.

paths.name: Bio-Brewer
paths.description: The Bio-Brewer delves into the mysteries of life and mutation, using alchemical concoctions to reshape the bodies of allies, enemies, and even themselves. They walk the line between genius and monstrosity, balancing utility, raw power, and the unpredictable nature of mutation.

features.name: Mutagen
features.description: Administer a Mutagen to an ally as an action within reach range. The drinker gains a temporary mutation for 1 minute of your choice. At the end of the minute, the target must make a Survival check.

options.name: Quills
options.effect: Spines spawn from the target, melee attackers take 3 piercing damage.

options.name: Gills
options.effect: Gain the ability to breathe underwater and swim at normal speed.

options.name: Enhanced Reflexes
options.effect: Gain Advantage on Agility and Strength Checks.

progressionSteps.name: Alchemical Adaptation
progressionSteps.description: You’ve mastered the basics of mutagen crafting. Mutagens can now be administered as a half-action.

options.name: Mutagen: Feral Tonic
options.effect: Gain claws that deal [[1d6]] Slashing damage for 1 minute

progressionSteps.name: Alchemical Consultant
progressionSteps.description: Your knowledge of mutations and alchemy makes you a sought-after expert. Gain Advantage on Influence Checks when offering advice, diagnosing ailments, or negotiating services related to alchemy or biology.

options.name: Cosmetic Alchemy
options.effect: Craft cosmetic mutations, such as glowing hair, shimmering skin, or translucent skin. These changes are purely aesthetic and last until undone.

progressionSteps.name: Toxic Infusion
progressionSteps.description: You can add a toxic element to your mutagens. Creatures mutated by your brews deal [[1d6]] Toxic damage on melee attacks for the duration.

progressionSteps.name: Chitinous Mutagen
progressionSteps.description: Creatures under your mutagen gain +10 Armor when they are afflicted with the mutagen.

progressionSteps.name: Adaptive Reflexes
progressionSteps.description: You refine mutagens to enhance reflexes. Creatures with your mutagen effects gain Advantage on Agility Checks.

progressionSteps.name: Regenerative Brew
progressionSteps.description: Mutagens can now provide minor healing. Once per combat, a creature drinking your mutagen regains [[1d8]] health.

options.name: Mutagen: Hive Mind
options.effect: A creature with your mutagen can use telepathic communication with all other mutagen-affected creatures within medium range.

progressionSteps.name: Predatory Mutation
progressionSteps.description: A creature with your mutagen has +[[1d6]] to attack checks.

progressionSteps.name: Deadly Mutation
progressionSteps.description: A creature with your mutagen has +[[1d6]] to melee damage.

progressionSteps.name: Spectral Transformation
progressionSteps.description: Your mutagens now affect incorporeal creatures. Creatures under mutagen effects can strike intangible enemies.

progressionSteps.name: Alchemical Emporium
progressionSteps.description: Once per month, as a 1-hour action, you can establish an Alchemical Emporium that lasts for 24 hours. The Emporium attracts NPCs to browse your wares, request commissions, or offer trades. You can sell your crafted items at 150% of their base value and accept one unique custom request during this time, earning gold, rare materials, or influence points with local factions.

options.name: The Emporium
options.effect: For the duration, the Emporium grants allies within 30 feet Advantage on social checks, and enemies must succeed on a Spirit Check to approach aggressively. When the Emporium closes, roll a Luck Check to determine if its reputation spreads favorably or attracts the attention of rivals.

paths.name: Gambler
paths.description: You’re a gambler at heart, driven by the thrill of high stakes and the promise of wealth. Money flows through your hands like water, and you’re often chasing the next big score. Ready to stake it all on a single throw if that’s what it takes. For you, gold isn’t just currency; it’s a source of power, a catalyst for your spells, and a wellspring of vitality that few can understand. Each time you win big, you feel reinvigorated, as though luck itself has blessed you with a burst of arcane energy.

features.name: GP Spellcaster
features.description: You use the powerful GP to create spells. As an action, spend GP to gain spell points with a maximum equal to your Luck check. The points remain for 1 minute or until cast. You spend 10 GP to make 1 SP.

features.name: High Roller
features.description: When making a Luck check in a gambling situation, you can reroll the check and must take the new result. Additionally, when winning a bet or gamble, you gain a temporary boost of confidence, granting you a spell point.

features.name: Spell Spender
features.description: As an action, you can create fake GP using a spell point. When you use a spell point to create GP, you create 1d100 gold that lasts for [[2d4]] days. It holds up to all inspection, magical or otherwise, until the end of the duration when it turns to rot. This GP cannot be used to create spell points.

progressionSteps.name: Gamble Your Life
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can make a high-stakes bet with a willing creature (could be determined with a free action social check). You both roll a d100, and the loser takes damage equal to the difference between the rolls. This damage can't be reduced or prevented in any way.

progressionSteps.name: Double-Down Gamble
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can challenge an enemy to a game of chance. You both make contested Luck checks. The loser takes [[4d6]] psychic damage.

progressionSteps.name: Deceptive Gamble
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction when targeted by an attack, you can make a Stealth check contested by the attacker's Observation check. If you win, you deceive the creature and the attack swings wildly. If the attack is with a weapon and it is a failure, the creature is disarmed.

progressionSteps.name: Extradimensional Gamble
progressionSteps.description: Once per day, as an action, you can propose a bet to a creature you can see. If it accepts, you both make a Spirit check; whoever fails is sent to a vacation home where they spend the next minute relaxing.

progressionSteps.name: Gambling Charm
progressionSteps.description: You can use your action to make an Influence Check against a creature's Observation. If you win, the creature is charmed by you for 1 minute or until you or your companions do something harmful to it.

progressionSteps.name: High-Stakes Gamble
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can propose a bet to a creature you can see within short range. If it accepts, you both make contested Survival checks. The loser becomes stunned until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Gamble Your Soul
progressionSteps.description: As an action, challenge a creature with the gods as overseers. Each of you roll a 1d6. The winner is the higher roll. The winner rolls on the Win Table, while the loser rolls on the Loss Table.

progressionSteps.name: Chronus' Favor
progressionSteps.description: Winning a gamble grants you a glimpse into the future, giving you advantage on all checks for the rest of the day. Losing, however, muddles your observation of time, and you suffer disadvantage on checks for the same duration.

progressionSteps.name: Celestial Luck
progressionSteps.description: You have Luck points equal to your Luck check. You can use a Luck point to reroll and roll as a reaction.

progressionSteps.name: Divine Gambit
progressionSteps.description: On a winning gamble, you gain a +2 to a check of your choice. Losing a gamble results in a -2 to a check of the Narrator’s choice.

progressionSteps.name: Win Table
progressionSteps.description: Roll 1d6 when you win a high-stakes gamble.

options.name: Brakkus' Might
options.effect: Your next melee attack gains a +10 bonus to attack and damage.

options.name: Chronus' Temporal Shift
options.effect: You have 3 actions on your next turn.

options.name: Dumda's Harmony
options.effect: Heal all allies within short range for 4d6.

options.name: Exembar's Order
options.effect: Instantly rearrange the battlefield, moving any creature within short range to a different spot.

options.name: Jesha's Revelation
options.effect: Know the location of one person or object of your choice, as long as it is on the same plane of existence; you're also immune to illusions for 1 minute.

options.name: Zuinmuir's Protection
options.effect: One creature of your choice is immune to all damage until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Loss Table
progressionSteps.description: Roll 1d6 when you lose a high-stakes gamble.

options.name: Brakkus' Weakness
options.effect: You are unable to take reactions until the end of your next turn.

options.name: Chronus' Halt
options.effect: You cannot move during your next turn.

options.name: Dumda's Silence
options.effect: You cannot speak until the end of your next turn, preventing any verbal spell casting.

options.name: Exembar's Imbalance
options.effect: You have disadvantage on all checks until the end of your next turn.

options.name: Jesha's Blindness
options.effect: You are blind until the end of your next turn.

options.name: Zuinmuir's Burden
options.effect: Instantly lose half of your current wounds; if you are below half, take 1 injury.

paths.name: Incantatore
paths.description: In the shadows of grandeur and the limelight of intrigue, you've navigated the treacherous waters of ambition and desire. Known to many as the Incantatore, your journey has been one of cunning and allure, a path carved by the sheer force of your presence and the magnetic charm you wield like a blade. Yet, beneath the surface of calculated smiles and strategic flirtations lies a soul weary of the facade, a spirit yearning for authenticity beyond the roles you've played. Your expertise in the art of seduction has always been your weapon and your shield, guiding you through the complexities of human desires, twisting intentions to your will with a mere glance, a whisper.

features.name: Influence Spellcaster
features.description: Your magic is as enticing as your charm, using allure to cast spells that beguile the senses. You cast spells with your Influence Check, you have spell points equal to your Influence Check.

features.name: Enthrall
features.description: As an action, spend 1 spell point to cast a silent charm on a creature within short range, requiring a successful Spellcasting check. While charmed, your Influence checks against the creature automatically succeed, and they are willing to assist you and your party, provided it does not harm them, others, or involve violence.

options.name: Extended Duration
options.effect: You may extend the charm's duration to 1 hour by spending 3 spell points, increasing the duration by an additional hour for each spell point spent after that.

progressionSteps.name: Bewitching Performance
progressionSteps.description: You have perfected the art of bewitching those around you with a single dance, song, or act. As an action, make an Influence Check on a target in short range. On a success, they take the Charmed condition with you as the source until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Kiss of Despair
progressionSteps.description: Your kisses are known to lead creatures to despair. As an action, make a kiss attack on a humanoid creature using Influence as the check. On a success, deal [[1d6]] psychic damage.

progressionSteps.name: Caress of Ruin
progressionSteps.description: Your touch can be both pleasurable and painful. As a half-action, touch a creature charmed by you. The creature takes [[1d6]] psychic damage.

progressionSteps.name: Heartbreaker
progressionSteps.description: You're adept at exploiting the emotional vulnerability of others. Gain advantage on Influence checks when dealing with individuals who are emotionally compromised.

progressionSteps.name: Echoing Tales
progressionSteps.description: Your stories are so captivating that they linger in listeners' minds. When you make a spell attack and the roll lands on a 5, the story reverberates, casting the spell again without cost.

progressionSteps.name: Unseen Weaver
progressionSteps.description: Your spellcasting is as elusive as the stories you tell. Your magic is unseen, its presence known only by its effects, allowing for subtle manipulations and strategic advantages.

progressionSteps.name: Flirtatious Flair
progressionSteps.description: You can inspire others through stirring words or music. As an action, choose a creature within short range. They gain [[1d6]] to their next check or half as much to their damage.

progressionSteps.name: Bewitching Command
progressionSteps.description: You can issue simple commands to a creature you have charmed. As a half-action, command a creature charmed by you within short range to immediately perform an action. After the action, the creature is no longer charmed and has advantage to resist your charms in the future.

progressionSteps.name: Irresistible Presence
progressionSteps.description: Your allure can be so potent it captivates all around you. As an action, humanoid creatures within short range must make an Observation check or become charmed by you for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Queen of Hearts
progressionSteps.description: In times of dire need, you can channel your full seductive powers to become the ultimate temptress. When you activate this feature as an action, for 1 hour, your Influence Checks become 20 without rolling, and when you seduce a creature using these checks, they become charmed by you for the hour. They have +20 loyalty and will throw their lives down for you.

options.name: Aging Consequence
options.effect: At the end of the hour, you age by [[1d6]] x 3 years, and your beauty begins to fade.

paths.name: Nightshade
paths.description: Masters of fear and toxic beauty, the Nightshade blends deadly flora and subconscious manipulation into a powerful toolkit. With their mastery of Spirit and alchemical craft, they weave fearsome illusions and deadly toxins, crafting items and artifacts that carry their lethal artistry. These merchants of terror understand both the psychology of dread and the tangible allure of the items they sell.

features.name: Spirit Spellcaster
features.description: Your magic is infused with the supernatural. You cast spells with your Spirit Check and have spell points equal to half your Spirit Check.

features.name: Deadly Bloom
features.description: As an action, summon a spectral flower that deals [[1d10]] Toxic damage and imposes the Fear condition on creatures within short range on a failed Survival Check. The flower lingers in the area for up to 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Fearmonger’s Market
progressionSteps.description: You specialize in crafting and selling items that inspire awe and dread and can be sold for 5gp each. Use 1 hour of downtime to create:

options.name: Phantom Petals
options.effect: Grants Disadvantage on checks when ingested. Can be applied to a weapon as a half-action.

options.name: Nightshade Bombs
options.effect: A throwable flower that imposes Blind within reach.

options.name: Fearful Fragrances
options.effect: As an action, spray the fragrance. A creature within reach range must make a Survival check or take the Fear condition. They gain immunity to this fragrance on a success.

progressionSteps.name: Aura of Dread
progressionSteps.description: Your mere presence inspires unease. As an action, enemies within short range must make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Harvest of Fear
progressionSteps.description: When a creature under the effect of your Fear condition dies, you can harvest its essence as a Nightmare Nectar during downtime. This nectar restores [[1d8]] health to an ally and provides crafting bonuses when sold or used.

progressionSteps.name: Lurking Shadows
progressionSteps.description: You and your allies gain Advantage on Stealth checks in areas affected by your Deadly Bloom.

progressionSteps.name: Toxic Mind
progressionSteps.description: When a creature fails a check against your fear-based abilities, you learn its greatest fear. You have Advantage on future checks against it for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Deadly Bloom Garden
progressionSteps.description: When you use Deadly Bloom, you can summon up to 3 flowers within medium range.

progressionSteps.name: Nightshade Grasp
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 1 spell point, make a spellcasting check targeting a creature within short range. On a success, they take the Pinned condition until the end of their next turn and [[1d6]] piercing damage. Increase the number of targets for every additional spell point spent.

progressionSteps.name: Deadly Bloom Spawn
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 1 spell point, create a Deadly Bloom Spawn, a flower monster of your design, that is a PL4. Its attacks are your Deadly Bloom and can follow simple commands. It remains for 1 minute. You can only have 1 Deadly Bloom Spawn at a time.

progressionSteps.name: Deadly Bloom Teleport
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can teleport to any of your active Deadly Blooms within long range.

progressionSteps.name: Fearmonger’s Market II
progressionSteps.description: You refine your craft into an art form, creating items that inspire awe and fear not only on the battlefield but also in negotiations, espionage, and social manipulation. Your creations become infamous, gaining recognition for their beauty and danger alike. You can imbue these items with a portion of your own Spirit to amplify their effects and influence. Spend 3 spell points to double the potency of the item (e.g., damage, radius, or duration).

options.name: Haunting Charcoal
options.effect: A black powder that, when ignited, creates a choking fog that deals [[4d4!]] Toxic damage in a reach range and imposes the Coughing condition.

options.name: Terror Seeds
options.effect: As an action, plant the seed on any soft surface. The seed activates when stepped on, releasing a fear-inducing spike. Creatures must succeed on a Spirit Check or take the Fear condition. While feared in this way, all creatures have Advantage on attack checks against this creature.

options.name: Wither Draught
options.effect: A consumable elixir that deals [[6d6!]] Psychic damage to the drinker.

paths.name: Power Player
paths.description: The Power Player is a master manipulator and strategist, operating from the shadows or stepping into the spotlight to shape the world around them. With an extensive network of government agents, criminal operatives, and influential figures, you pull strings that others can barely see, let alone touch. Your connections open doors to opportunities, resources, and information that can turn the tide of any situation. Your influence extends far beyond the battlefield. Whether negotiating a delicate truce between warring factions, orchestrating the downfall of a rival organization, or securing high-value resources, you leverage your network to weave intricate plots and achieve your goals. Every conversation, deal, and favor becomes a piece of your larger strategy, building a web of alliances and obligations that stretches across the world.

features.name: Insider Connections
features.description: Once per week or month during downtime, you can call on your network for assistance. Roll a d6 to determine the outcome. Higher rolls yield better results.

options.name: 1 - Betrayed
options.effect: Your connection has turned against you, selling you out to a rival organization. Expect retaliation or trouble in the near future.

options.name: 2 - Double-Crossed
options.effect: A rival within the organization takes advantage of your request to undermine your influence. You may face increased challenges or obstacles in your current endeavors.

options.name: 3 - Minor Favor
options.effect: Your connection provides you with a small favor or piece of information, such as a safehouse location or a tip on a potential business opportunity.

options.name: 4 - Valuable Information
options.effect: Your connection reveals important information about a rival organization, a hidden treasure, or a secret entrance to a heavily guarded location.

options.name: 5 - Major Favor
options.effect: Your connection pulls some strings to get you out of a tight spot, such as bribing an official to drop charges against you or arranging for a valuable resource to be delivered to you.

options.name: 6 - Powerful Boon
options.effect: Your connection goes above and beyond, providing you with a significant advantage, such as securing a powerful ally, obtaining a rare and valuable item, or granting you influence over a key figure in the organization.

progressionSteps.name: Influencer
progressionSteps.description: You start with a Loyalty tier of Neutral (Tier 1) with one chosen organization or influential individual. The organizations or individuals can be within government or criminal circles.

progressionSteps.name: Leverage Loyalty
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can spend 2 Loyalty points (representing leveraging your connections) with a group or individual to gain advantage on any Charisma check you make to interact with them for the next 10 minutes.

progressionSteps.name: Networker
progressionSteps.description: If you successfully aid someone in a significant way (such as saving them from danger or solving a major problem for them), you can add 2 Loyalty points with that individual or group.

progressionSteps.name: Favors Owed
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can request a favor from someone. The scale of the favor corresponds directly with your Loyalty tier with them: Tier 2 for a minor favor, Tier 3 for a moderate favor, and Tier 4 or 5 for a major favor.

progressionSteps.name: Friend in High Places
progressionSteps.description: Whenever you level up, you automatically gain 1 Loyalty point with a high-ranking individual or group in the city. This represents you maintaining and strengthening your connections.

progressionSteps.name: Charismatic Leader
progressionSteps.description: Once per long rest, you can give an inspiring speech. Roll a Charisma (Persuasion) check. For every increment of 10 you roll, you gain 1 Loyalty point with the audience.

progressionSteps.name: Power Broker
progressionSteps.description: Once per long rest, you can attempt to broker a significant deal, alliance, or negotiation between organizations. This requires you to make a Loyalty check with each involved party. The success of the deal will depend on the results of these checks.

progressionSteps.name: Puppet Master
progressionSteps.description: Once per long rest, you can try to convince an individual to perform a specific action. This requires a Loyalty check with the target. The target must be able to hear and understand you, and the action cannot be obviously harmful to them.

progressionSteps.name: Chessmaster
progressionSteps.description: Once per long rest, you can make a Loyalty check with an individual or organization to gain critical information about their plans, vulnerabilities, or strengths.

progressionSteps.name: Kingmaker
progressionSteps.description: Once per in-game year, you can spend a significant amount of Loyalty points (equal to moving from one tier to the next) to attempt to change the leadership of an organization, start a revolution, or exert significant control over a major event. This ability is intended for major plot developments and should be used with the Narrator's guidance.

paths.name: Sovereign
paths.description: Legends are whispered about you in hushed tones, and tales of your exploits circulate through every corner of the realm. Your reputation has grown into a powerful yet perilous asset, turning you into a figure of both awe and unease. While your renown opens doors to alliances and favors, it also draws the watchful eyes of foes, rivals, and those who envy or resent your fame. People of influence know your name, and even those who’ve only heard rumors feel compelled to treat you with deference or wariness. Yet, such reverence is a double-edged sword. Allies will offer you unprompted assistance and exclusive opportunities, but enemies and opportunists, too, are never far behind, hoping to gain from your downfall or catch a glimpse of vulnerability.

features.name: Demanding Presence
features.description: As an action once per day, command all creatures within medium range to focus on you and make an Influence check. On a success, the crowd takes the Charmed condition until the end of your next turn.

features.name: Shadowmeld
features.description: As an action, gain the Invisible condition while in a crowd or in darkness until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Ironmonger Associate
progressionSteps.description: You've developed ties with a respected blacksmith and armorer, providing you with access to quality weaponry and armor. You receive favorable prices and might get the opportunity to invest in or acquire rare items.

progressionSteps.name: Medic's Aid
progressionSteps.description: You've gained the trust of a respected medical practitioner, perhaps a doctor or nurse. They give you preferential treatment and may occasionally request your help with certain 'procurements.'

progressionSteps.name: Mystical Mentor
progressionSteps.description: You've caught the eye of an esoteric figure versed in the arcane. They provide you with knowledge and magical items at a more approachable rate and might have special tasks for you.

progressionSteps.name: Speak-easy Owner's Confidence
progressionSteps.description: You're in good with the owner of a local speak-easy. This gives you an advantage when needing information, rooms, or the best moonshine in town. They might also give you special opportunities.

progressionSteps.name: Loyal Following
progressionSteps.description: Your reputation draws loyal followers who aid your business. Gain a small group of followers who can help with business tasks, and can also act as bodyguards, messengers, or spies.

progressionSteps.name: Power Broker
progressionSteps.description: You are able to leverage your wealth and influence to make major changes in the local area, such as influencing laws, starting or stopping wars, or controlling the local economy. However, this draws a lot of attention and can make you a target.

progressionSteps.name: Faith's Shepherd
progressionSteps.description: A religious figure of significance, such as a high priest or prophet, is ready to intervene on your behalf. However, such divine intervention might bring scrutiny from religious or anti-religious groups, resulting in potential backlash.

progressionSteps.name: The Ancient One
progressionSteps.description: An ancient and powerful being, such as a vampire lord or elder dragon, owes you a favor. However, calling upon this favor might draw unwanted attention or put you in their debt.

progressionSteps.name: Reputation Manager
progressionSteps.description: Manipulate public opinion to improve your standing, harm a rival, or promote an ally. If your manipulation is discovered, it could backfire.

progressionSteps.name: Ghost Trader
progressionSteps.description: You can completely alter your identity and establish a new one, allowing you to escape from debts, enemies, and obligations. However, you lose all of your previous contacts and must start building your network and reputation from scratch.

paths.name: Steel Monger
paths.description: The Steel Monger is an innovative and resourceful master of metallurgy, machinery, and vehicular engineering. A living testament to the industrial prowess of the era, they utilize their unique skill set to create, repair, and modify anything from personal weapons to massive war machines. Whether in the heart of a bustling city or the wilds of an untamed wilderness, their expertise provides tactical advantages, defensive fortifications, and considerable firepower, ensuring their allies are always well-protected and formidable in the face of any challenge.

features.name: Battlefield Armorer
features.description: As a half-action, you can repair or reinforce an ally's armor, giving a creature [[2d6]] Armor. Armor points above the armor’s maximum last for 1 hour.

features.name: Battlefield Weaponeer
features.description: As a half-action, imbue a weapon with power, giving it +2 Attack bonus and +2 Damage for 1 minute. You cannot use this on the same weapon more than once.

progressionSteps.name: Steel Beginnings
progressionSteps.description: As an action using a crafting check, create a useful item for the current situation like a lockpicking wrench, grappling hook launcher, or alarm clock crab. These items don't need specific description and can do minor things, like deal 1d4 damage, unlock a mundane door, or cause a condition until the end of the target's next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Clockwork Companion
progressionSteps.description: You've crafted a loyal, clockwork pet. This automaton can perform basic tasks, assist in combat, and even explode on command. This clockwork creation has a PL3 and can act as independently as you create it to be.

progressionSteps.name: Weaponsmith
progressionSteps.description: You can spend one minute to improve a weapon at a workbench, giving it +2 damage. This can only be done to one weapon once without a check, twice with a check, then lastly with a disadvantage check. If any of these checks fail, you cannot attempt it again.

progressionSteps.name: Defensive Engineer
progressionSteps.description: You can spend one minute to improve armor at a workbench, either giving it +3 armor, or removing up to -3 from a penalty. This can only be done to one piece of armor once without a check, twice with a check, then lastly with a disadvantage check. If any of these checks fail, you cannot attempt it again.

progressionSteps.name: Automata Craftsmen
progressionSteps.description: You've mastered the art of creating automata. You can now create automated helpers that can perform simple tasks, fight, or provide assistance in various forms. It takes you 1 action to create a PL2 Automaton of your own design, you can have a number equal to your crafting check. These have no weapons innately but can be given spare weaponry. They have a [[1d4]] basic attack.

progressionSteps.name: Engineer Suit
progressionSteps.description: Spend 1 merchant token and 1 hour with a workbench to create your Engineer’s suit that has 30 Armor and no penalties.

progressionSteps.name: Vehicle Engineer
progressionSteps.description: Unlock the ability to design and construct vehicles, enhancing your mobility and tactical options. By investing time and Merchant Tokens, you can craft Light, Medium, or Heavy vehicles:

options.name: Light Vehicle
options.effect: (1 Merchant Token, 3 days) Examples—motorcycle, small boat. Transports 1-2 passengers; fast and agile; limited storage.

options.name: Medium Vehicle
options.effect: (2 Merchant Tokens, 7 days) Examples—truck, caravan wagon. Transports up to 6 passengers; moderate speed and durability; ample storage for goods and equipment.

options.name: Heavy Vehicle
options.effect: (3 Merchant Tokens, 14 days) Examples—APC (Armored Personnel Carrier), small airship. Transports 12 passengers; enhanced armor and defenses; equipped with weapons (e.g., mounted gun); includes living quarters or dimensional space for sleeping.

progressionSteps.name: Armor Piercing Rifle
progressionSteps.description: Spend a merchant token to create an armor-piercing rifle.

options.name: Stats
options.effect: Check (Agi, Lck, Str, Obs), long range, 2 hand, close range disadvantage. Deals [[3d12!]] Piercing damage.

progressionSteps.name: War Automata
progressionSteps.description: Master the creation of advanced constructs like the War Automaton—a large, self-operating construct armed with weapons and defenses. As an action spending 4 merchant tokens, create a War Automaton that has a PL9, Armor Piercing Rifle, a Great Weapon, and an additional 20 armor. The War Automaton is large enough to house 3 medium-sized creatures.

progressionSteps.name: Ultimate Investment
progressionSteps.description: You've managed to build a reputation and amassed a significant fortune from your trade. You can now establish a manufacturing empire, ensuring a steady flow of income and providing you with resources and labor to pursue even greater projects. This could be a vehicle manufacturing plant, a weapon smithing empire, or a golem assembly factory.

options.name: Investment Returns
options.effect: Every month the Investment provides 1d100x10 gp, and 1d10 merchant tokens.

paths.name: Warlord
paths.description: Profitable Warlords are merchants of violence, who understand that the clashing of steel is just another form of negotiation. They bring a keen business acumen to the battlefield, turning a profit on their victories and using their wealth to bolster their strength. They are shrewd tacticians and capable fighters, able to broker deals and break bones with equal skill. Their unique understanding of both warfare and commerce makes them formidable adversaries, capable of turning even the direst of situations into opportunities for profit.

features.name: Warrior's Investment
features.description: As an action, spend 1 Merchant Token to summon or recruit mercenaries to the battlefield. You can have up to 10 PL of mercenaries, for example, 10 PL1 mercenaries or 2 PL5 mercenaries, and so on. Each mercenary has a standard weapon, either melee or ranged.

features.name: Warlord’s Armor
features.description: The Warlord suffers no penalties from wearing armor and starts with a set of heavy armor.

progressionSteps.name: Battlefield Entrepreneur
progressionSteps.description: The Profitable Warlord knows how to capitalize on the chaos of battle. Whenever an enemy is defeated, you gain a small amount of gold or useful items they can sell later. As a reaction when a creature is defeated, make a Luck check, each success is +25 GP gained immediately.

progressionSteps.name: Investment Recovery
progressionSteps.description: When your mercenaries are defeated in battle, you manage to recover some of your investment. You regain a Merchant Token if none of your mercenaries survive the battle.

progressionSteps.name: War Profiteer
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, you can spend a Merchant Token and your armor becomes nearly indestructible. You gain +20 armor for 1 minute. If you have more than 10 additional armor after the minute, you regain the Merchant Token.

progressionSteps.name: Bankroll Blitz
progressionSteps.description: With a keen eye for opportunity, the Profitable Warlord can make a risky investment for a potential high reward. Before an attack, you magically expend 100 GP and deal an additional [[1d6]] Elemental Damage. If the attack misses, the gold is wasted.

progressionSteps.name: Marketplace Marauder
progressionSteps.description: The Profitable Warlord knows how to find value in the most unlikely places. Whenever you enter a new location, you can make an Observation check to find valuable items or opportunities for profit, each success is +25 GP gained immediately.

progressionSteps.name: Bargain Battler
progressionSteps.description: As an action, magically expend 100 GP and give an ally an additional action on their turn.

progressionSteps.name: Golden Opportunity
progressionSteps.description: The Profitable Warlord knows that every crisis is an opportunity in disguise. As a reaction whenever an ally fails a combat check, you can spend a Merchant Token to reroll the check with a +5 bonus. If they succeed, you regain the Merchant Token.

progressionSteps.name: Aggressive Negotiations
progressionSteps.description: Make a weapon attack as an action and expend 1 Merchant Token, dealing an additional +10 damage. If the creature survives the attack, regain the Merchant Token. Cannot be used on the same creature ever again.

progressionSteps.name: Windfall
progressionSteps.description: As an action, make a Survival check and spend 10 GP. On a success, regain 1 wound per success.

progressionSteps.name: Armored Tycoon
progressionSteps.description: Your experience in battle has taught you how to get the most out of your armor. At the start of combat, you gain additional Strength equal to half your current armor.

talents.name: Chef
talents.description: In a world where might often prevails, you've honed an art that captivates both heart and palate. Your culinary prowess transcends mere sustenance, turning every dish into an experience. With a knife as your wand and ingredients as your spells, you weave magic on plates, eliciting joy, nostalgia, or even healing with every bite. As a Culinary Maestro, you not only feed bodies but also souls, creating moments that linger long after the last morsel is savored.

features.name: Secret Spices
features.description: You have a pool of 6 spice points. Regain all spice points by spending $10 at a market or foraging for [[1d6]] hours.

features.name: Healing Soup
features.description: As an action, spending 1 spice point, you make a healing soup that can heal an ally for 5 wounds or remove 1 Corpus condition when consumed as an action. Each soup is a blend of hearty ingredients like robust potatoes, tender noodles, savory meats, or a signature dish of your region.

features.name: Spicy Surprise
features.description: As an action, spending 1 spice point, you can coat a weapon or ammunition in spice, changing the damage type and dealing an additional 5 fire damage on the next attack.

features.name: Gourmet Delight
features.description: You set up a shop as an action that remains for 1 hour, a charming booth, a roving cart, or a cozy nook. Your cooking attracts patrons from all walks of life. As you cook, you earn [[1d20]] gp per spice point, with the option to intensify flavors as the hour progresses. Your cooking might also attract more than just customers; from curious wanderers to perhaps even hostile creatures intrigued by the tantalizing aromas.

progressionSteps.name: Bountiful Banquet
progressionSteps.description: Spend an hour and 1 Secret Spice Point to prepare a grand feast for up to 6 people. Those who partake gain +3 armor, advantage on checks to save against poison and disease, as well as checks against spells for the next 24 hours. These effects cannot be stacked.

progressionSteps.name: Smokescreen Sauté
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you toss a mixture of aromatic ingredients into a hot pan, creating a cloud of flavorful smoke that spreads to a 20ft radius. Creatures in this cloud have the blind and coughing conditions, or you can spend 1 extra spice point per person to protect them from the conditions. The cloud lasts for 1 minute or until a strong breeze blows it away.

progressionSteps.name: Gourmet Guardian
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 1 Secret Spice Point, conjure a small creature made of food. This creature has 1 hit point and can make melee attacks that deal 1 point of physical damage. The creature cannot speak but follows your commands and remains for 1 minute or until it is destroyed.

progressionSteps.name: Iron Stomach
progressionSteps.description: You gain immunity to toxic damage. In addition, you can identify potions and poisons by tasting them, without risking any harmful effects.

progressionSteps.name: Spicy Surprise II
progressionSteps.description: Your talent for unpredictable cooking creates a lively result. Using 1 Secret Spice point, as an action, craft a dish with a random presentation and serve it to an enemy. On a success, roll on the random condition table to determine the results of the dish.

progressionSteps.name: Mutagenic Dish
progressionSteps.description: You can create a dish that temporarily alters the eater's physical form. Spend 1 Secret Spice point to create a dish that gives the eater a random physical mutation (like increased strength, size, speed, or a new physical feature) for 1 hour. These effects cannot be stacked.

progressionSteps.name: Economical Chef
progressionSteps.description: You've learned how to prepare dishes using fewer resources. Your dishes cost -1 Secret Spice points.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Meal
progressionSteps.description: You can create a dish that temporarily gives the consumer elemental abilities. Spend 3 Secret Spice points to create a dish that gives the eater an elemental ability from the elemental table that lasts for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Dish of the Planes
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 1 Merchant Token, you create a dish that transports the consumer to a different plane of existence after consuming it.

progressionSteps.name: Power Word Spice
progressionSteps.description: You create a single-use spice blend using 1 Merchant Token that, when consumed, allows the consumer to cast Power Word Spice, giving the creature the death condition for 1 minute as they explode into spices. After 1 minute, they reconstitute in a similar, unoccupied location with full wounds, injuries, and resources.

talents.name: Caravan Leader
talents.description: Caravan Leaders are the grand strategists of commerce, who understand that every journey is a venture fraught with both risk and opportunity. With a blend of keen business sense and logistical acumen, they orchestrate the movement of goods across treacherous landscapes, turning each successful delivery into profit. They are adept negotiators, capable organizers, and have a deep understanding of the intricate dance between supply and demand. Their leadership ensures the prosperity of their ventures through both peaceful trade and, when necessary, the strategic use of force to protect their interests.

features.name: Caravan Convoy
features.description: As a long-term action, spend 1 Merchant Token and assign 1 loyal creature to send with and manage a caravan that you have created with the Merchant Token. Next, choose a priority for the journey, then roll an Intellect check to determine the caravan's outcome over the calculated time.

options.name: Speed
options.effect: Reduce travel time by 25%.

options.name: Profit
options.effect: Gain an additional Merchant Token.

options.name: Safety
options.effect: The caravan will make it to the destination without worry.

progressionSteps.name: Trade Route Tycoon
progressionSteps.description: Your experience in negotiation makes you a master of persuasion. Gain advantage on Influence checks when bartering, settling disputes, or negotiating deals, regardless of the context. This applies to any attempt to sway others using logic, charm, or resources.

progressionSteps.name: Rallying Presence
progressionSteps.description: As an action, grant +2 to all checks for allies within short range until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Market Insight
progressionSteps.description: Your vast knowledge of supply and demand enables you to make the most of any economic opportunity. Gain a 10% discount when purchasing goods or services, and +5% profit when selling items or services.

progressionSteps.name: Calculated Defense
progressionSteps.description: When attacked in combat, you may roll an Intellect check as a reaction. On a success, reduce the damage by half as you identify and exploit the attacker’s weaknesses or evade the strike.

progressionSteps.name: Crisis Management
progressionSteps.description: Your time on the road has honed your survival skills. Gain advantage on Survival checks related to navigation, finding food and water, and assessing environmental threats. Additionally, you can identify the best place to camp to avoid danger.

progressionSteps.name: Resourceful Recovery
progressionSteps.description: In the aftermath of an encounter, Caravan Leaders can quickly replenish their supplies and repair any damages, ensuring the caravan is always ready for the next leg of the journey. As a 10-minute action, all creatures you choose repair their armor to at least half the maximum.

progressionSteps.name: Fortified Caravan
progressionSteps.description: If you spend a Merchant Token on your caravan, you can increase the PL of your guards and fortify your caravan.

progressionSteps.name: Strategic Strike
progressionSteps.description: Issue an order to an ally within medium range, allowing them to make a free attack as your off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Economic Espionage
progressionSteps.description: Train or hire spies to undermine competitors or negotiate better terms at destinations. Success in espionage can lead to additional Merchant Tokens upon completion of the journey as your convoy capitalizes on weakened competition or favorable market conditions.

progressionSteps.name: Rapid Deployment Caravan
progressionSteps.description: Enhance the speed and efficiency of caravan setup and deployment, allowing for quicker reaction to market changes. This reduces the journey's duration by 25%, enabling more frequent ventures and faster capitalization on economic opportunities.

talents.name: Showman
talents.description: Radiating charisma and charm, the Gregarious Showman is an unforgettable figure. They not only excel in the art of commerce but also stand as a shining beacon of entertainment, amassing a cavalcade of allies and friends. Their irresistible charm and engaging performances captivate hearts, forging bonds that transcend mere business. As masters of ceremonies, their events and galas are the talk of towns and cities. They are at the center of every circle, knowing just how to navigate the social and economic dynamics of each gathering. Equipped with a sharp business acumen and an enchanting personality, the Gregarious Showman turns each transaction into a spectacle, each negotiation into an event, and each market into a stage. With every town they enter, their network expands, their reputation soars, and their influence deepens. A Gregarious Showman is not just a merchant; they are a symbol of unity, celebration, and camaraderie.

features.name: Stage of Commerce
features.description: As an action, spend 1 Merchant Token to create an extravagant pop-up bazaar that lasts for 8 hours with one of the following effects:

options.name: Spectacle of Servants
options.effect: Summon 12 spectral servants with PL1. They perform simple tasks (e.g., cleaning, cooking, carrying, distractions) within a medium range of you. At the end of the 8 hours, regain the Merchant Token.

options.name: Fortified Market
options.effect: Transform the bazaar into a defensible outpost with a tower, hidden rooms, traps, and vantage points for surveillance.

progressionSteps.name: Stage of Commerce, Speakeasy
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Merchant Token to create a temporary speakeasy that lasts for 8 hours in a demiplane that appears as a simple door with a sign. This venue has a bartender, waitress, and bouncer each of PL4. This place attracts both locals and influential figures.

progressionSteps.name: Stage of Commerce, Velvet Parlor
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Merchant Token to establish a lavish, sultry lounge in a demiplane for 8 hours. Draped in velvet and illuminated by soft, golden light, the venue exudes luxury and intrigue. With private alcoves, plush seating, and 6 attentive hosts (PL2), the Velvet Parlor is a sanctuary for secrets and seduction.

progressionSteps.name: Stage of Commerce, Gambling Hall
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Merchant Token to create a gambling hall of your design that lasts for 8 hours, has several tables and games, and draws in a crowd. Make an Influence Check and gain [[1d100]] gp per success at the end of the 8 hours.

progressionSteps.name: Charismatic Influence
progressionSteps.description: Spend 1 Merchant Token to create a permanent bond with a non-hostile NPC. The NPC gains +30 Loyalty, the Charmed condition (with you as the source), and a compulsion to assist you. The token returns to you if the bond ends (e.g., the NPC dies or acts against you).

progressionSteps.name: Festive Diplomacy
progressionSteps.description: Your events are not just for entertainment – they are also a platform for diplomacy. By spending a Merchant Token, you can turn a simple gathering into a diplomatic summit, inviting representatives from different factions or groups. This can serve as a way to broker peace, negotiate deals, or forge alliances.

progressionSteps.name: Encore Performance
progressionSteps.description: After you fail a check, spend a Merchant Token to immediately reroll it with a +10 bonus. You can only use this feature once per long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Summon Spectacle
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 1 Merchant Token, you can create a grand spectacle that summons a spectral performer to aid you. The performer can perform tasks, distract enemies, or even attack on your behalf. The performer remains for 1 minute, has a basic attack of [[1d4]] physical damage, and has a check of +[[1d4]].

progressionSteps.name: Speak to the Manager
progressionSteps.description: Spend 1 Merchant Token to gain an audience with a powerful figure (mayor, leader, etc.). You secure 1 minute of conversation, creating an opportunity to sway their opinion, negotiate, or extract critical information.

progressionSteps.name: Showman's Gambit
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can make a daring move that captures the attention of everyone around you. Make an Influence Check. For every success, you can impose a Non-Major Condition.

progressionSteps.name: Dramatic Entrance
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can make a grand entrance that captures everyone's attention. Make an Influence Check. For every success, you can impose a Cognition condition of your choice on one enemy within short range. This could be distracting them, disorienting them, or even causing them to underestimate you.

talents.name: Witch
talents.description: The Witch is a mysterious figure bound to the ancient, untamed forces of nature. Known for brewing potent concoctions and wielding thorned charms, they embody the wild wisdom of the woods, drawing power from plants, animals, and spirits. Whether concocting remedies, commanding vines, or summoning protective spirits, the Witch thrives on their connection to nature and its secrets. Often misunderstood, their magic is one of harmony and preservation, harnessing both beauty and danger to protect and empower.

features.name: Briar Charm
features.description: With a touch as a half-action, you grant an ally natural armor made of vines and thorns until the end of your next turn, providing them with protection and a wild, intimidating appearance. Attackers face disadvantage on the first attack made against the ally each round, and any creature that makes a melee attack on the ally takes [[1d4]] piercing damage from the thorns.

progressionSteps.name: Herbal Tonic
progressionSteps.description: You can create a herbal tonic that grants minor healing. As a 1-minute action, make a Crafting check. Per success, create a potion that gives [[1d10]] healing. You can have a number of potions equal to your Crafting Check.

progressionSteps.name: Vine Grasp
progressionSteps.description: As an action, summon thorny vines to entangle a target within short range. The target must make a Strength check or be pinned. Allies attacking the restrained target gain advantage.

progressionSteps.name: Thorny Crown
progressionSteps.description: Create a crown of thorns for an ally, granting them a fierce appearance and causing attackers to hesitate. While wearing the crown, the ally has advantage on Intimidation checks, and any creature that hits them with a melee attack takes [[1d4]] piercing damage. The crown lasts for one hour.

progressionSteps.name: Fog Breath
progressionSteps.description: As an action, create a poisonous fog within short range that deals [[1d6]] toxic damage to all creatures that breathe. They must make a Survival check or take the Coughing condition.

progressionSteps.name: Forest Cloak
progressionSteps.description: Create a cloak of enchanted leaves and bark for you and your allies, giving advantage to Stealth checks. Alternatively, create one Forest Cloak of Shadows that gives a creature invisibility until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Spirit Guide
progressionSteps.description: As an action, summon a PL3 nature spirit as a companion. They remain as long as you choose, but you can only have one spirit at a time. This spirit can scout ahead, providing you with basic information about the environment.

progressionSteps.name: Wildwood Empathy
progressionSteps.description: You have an innate connection to animals and plants, allowing you to speak Naech (general) language. Non-hostile plants and animals may help in minor ways, such as fetching items, warning of danger, or providing knowledge about the area.

progressionSteps.name: Nettle Burst
progressionSteps.description: Cast a burst of nettles and thorny plants from your hands, dealing [[1d6]] piercing damage to all creatures in a short range around you.

progressionSteps.name: Blessed Briars
progressionSteps.description: Enhances Briar Charm. The charm now grants immunity to the Pinned condition while active.

progressionSteps.name: Nightshade Tonic
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-minute Crafting check, make 1 tonic per success to a maximum number equal to your Crafting Check. The Nightshade tonic gives +1 to all checks for 1 minute. If a creature drinks more than one tonic in a day, they suffer a Major Condition.

talents.name: Undertaker
talents.description: The Undertaker is a master of tragic relics and supernatural connections, trading not only in goods but also in memories, spirits, and stories that linger beyond the grave. Their abilities allow them to profit from their unique connection to the afterlife, assisting others in achieving closure or using spectral influence to gather secrets and sway the living.

features.name: Whispered Relics
features.description: You can invoke the voices of the dead through a Spirit Relic. As an action, channel a spirit into an item, causing it to speak and reveal knowledge or insight. This ability can unearth a secret, reveal hidden memories, or serve as a medium for messages from beyond the veil. When thrown as a weapon, it deals [[1d4]] Impact damage and an additional [[1d4]] Eclipse damage. You can have a number of Spirit Items equal to your Spirit check.

progressionSteps.name: Guardian Séance
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, summon a spirit that reduces damage dealt from enemies by -2 for creatures you choose within short range until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Spirit-Bound Bargain
progressionSteps.description: You can bind spirits into contracts, leveraging their otherworldly influence to instill dread. As an action, you can attempt to bind a spirit and send it to haunt a target within short range. Make a Spirit check, and on a success, the target is afflicted with the Fear condition. On a failure, you experience a brief backlash, causing you to take the Fear condition.

progressionSteps.name: Gravekeeper’s Dirt
progressionSteps.description: As an action, perform a funeral rite on the ground at your feet. Creatures within short range that you choose must make a Spirit check or take [[1d6]] Eclipse damage.

progressionSteps.name: Profane Mark
progressionSteps.description: You place a Profane Mark on a creature as a half-action. They can either use it to gain advantage on a check or deal an additional [[1d4]] Eclipse damage. Once used, the mark dissipates in a subtle puff of ghostly smoke.

progressionSteps.name: Whispered Relics II
progressionSteps.description: Your Spirit Relics can be sold at a value of [[1d100+50]] and deal double damage when thrown.

progressionSteps.name: Revenant Contract
progressionSteps.description: As an action, summon a revenant (PL 3) for 1 minute to complete a specific task, such as guarding, scouting, or attacking. You can only have 1 revenant at a time. The revenant serves you loyally within this time frame and disappears upon completing its mission.

progressionSteps.name: Curse Trader
progressionSteps.description: As an action, transfer a condition from yourself or an ally to an enemy within short range. They must be willing or make a Spirit check to prevent the transfer.

progressionSteps.name: Spirit Lantern
progressionSteps.description: Create and carry a spectral lantern that gathers souls through unique means, such as performing funeral rites over slain creatures, finding and capturing lost souls, or offering aid to lingering spirits. The lantern can hold up to three souls, granting +1 to attacks and damage for you and your allies per soul in the lantern.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Broker
progressionSteps.description: Once per month, as an action spending 1 Merchant Token, you can summon the spirit of a notable deceased figure for a single interaction. The spirit may offer powerful knowledge, perform a service, or permanently enchant an item.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Bazaar
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 1 Merchant Token sets up a Soul Bazaar that lasts for 1 minute. The bazaar appears around you up to a medium range and fills with 10 PL1 spirits that run shops and are at your command. When you summon the bazaar, enemies of your choice must make a Spirit check or take the Fear condition, while allies gain advantage on Spirit checks while in the bazaar.

talents.name: Smith
talents.description: The Smith is a class that specializes in the art of crafting weapons and armor. You are highly skilled in the use of tools and materials, able to fix armor quickly and efficiently—even in combat. As a traveling smith, you can craft weapons and armor on the go, repair damage swiftly, and forge unique armors and weapons from the remains of defeated monsters, incorporating their unique abilities into your craft.

features.name: Crafting Spellcaster
features.description: You channel magic through the art of creation, making every crafted item a conduit for spells. You cast spells with your Crafting Check and have spell points equal to your Crafting Check.

features.name: Rapid Repair
features.description: When you long rest, you and your party’s armor is repaired to full as you labor through the night. When you Press On, everyone can repair their armor for +5 more as you patch them up for the next fight.

features.name: Instant Workbench
features.description: You carry a pack of some kind that can unfold into a workbench. While using this workbench, you can repair armor for +10 at a time per hour. Additionally, you can enhance a mundane weapon, giving it +3 to damage. You can only enchant the same weapon once. This also increases the value of a weapon.

progressionSteps.name: Quick Repair
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-minute action, you can repair a piece of armor or a weapon, restoring it to its maximum armor.

progressionSteps.name: Monster's Resilience
progressionSteps.description: Armor you craft has +10 armor.

progressionSteps.name: Glyph Dominance
progressionSteps.description: Reduce the difficulty of applying Glyphs by -2.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Smithing
progressionSteps.description: You can infuse weapons with elemental energy. Create an Enhancement that deals [[1d4]] additional weak or Elemental Damage of your choice.

progressionSteps.name: Living Armory
progressionSteps.description: Your bond with your crafted weapons is so strong, they animate and fight for you in combat. When unarmed, you can summon a crafted weapon as an action to fight alongside you.

progressionSteps.name: Smith's Aegis
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can hammer the ground with your smith's hammer, creating a protective dome of shimmering energy that provides cover for you and your allies.

progressionSteps.name: Smith's Avatar
progressionSteps.description: You can infuse a portion of your spirit into a statue or armor stand, causing it to animate as a larger, armored version of yourself to protect your forge or fight for you.

progressionSteps.name: Monstrous Glyphster
progressionSteps.description: When crafting and applying glyphs, you are resilient to the potential backlash of a catastrophic failure, giving you a higher chance to pass Luck checks to prevent equipment destruction.

progressionSteps.name: Glyph of Resurrection
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-hour action, you can create and apply a glyph to a piece of armor. When the creature that has the glyph attached takes the Death condition, prevent it for 1 hour. You can only have 1 of these glyphs at a time.

progressionSteps.name: Glyph of Combative Alacrity
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-hour action, you can create glyphs that quicken a weapon's speed or the wearer's reaction time. Grants the user an additional reaction. You can only have 1 of these glyphs at a time.

classes.name: Mage
classes.description: A spellcaster who manipulates arcane forces to unleash powerful effects.

features.name: Arcane Mastery
features.description: Spend 1 Mana Point to empower a spell.

features.name: Spellcraft
features.description: Learn and cast spells from any school of magic.

equipment.name: Arcane Focus
equipment.description: Allows spellcasting with 1d4 arcane damage if used as a weapon.

paths.name: Arcane
paths.description: Embrace the Arcane Path, where the fabric of reality bends to the will of those daring enough to unlock its secrets. As an adept of arcane mysteries, your spellbook is not merely a collection of incantations; it is the key to unfathomable power, making you a master of the elements, a manipulator of time and space, and a conduit for forces that mere mortals can only dream of wielding. Each page is a testament to your quests for knowledge, filled with spells that can unravel the essence of your foes, shield your allies in impenetrable auras, or even alter the laws of nature to your whim.

features.name: Arcane Fizzle
features.description: When you cast a spell that fails, you regain half the spent spell points.

progressionSteps.name: Whispered Secrets
progressionSteps.description: You can whisper a message that only one designated person can hear, no matter the distance, as long as you know them and they are on the same plane of existence.

progressionSteps.name: Sonorous Echo
progressionSteps.description: When casting a spell, you can choose to delay its effect, activating it later as an off-action up to 3 rounds later.

progressionSteps.name: Repeat Spell
progressionSteps.description: Once per long rest, immediately after casting a spell, you can choose to cast the same spell again on your next turn without spending additional spell points.

progressionSteps.name: Storyteller’s Gift
progressionSteps.description: You can weave intricate, lifelike illusions through your storytelling. These illusions can play out entire scenes, allowing you to perfectly recreate moments from history or spin convincing tales from your imagination. Your illusions can encompass an area of short range, but they are easily identified as illusions.

progressionSteps.name: Spell Synergy
progressionSteps.description: Once per long rest, when you cast a spell, you can immediately take an off-action to cast another spell, provided the total spell point cost does not exceed your level.

progressionSteps.name: Whispered Secrets II
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, make a Spellcasting check on an enemy within medium range to cause [[1d6]] Psychic damage, increasing the damage by [[1d6]] per spell point used. Additionally, you can increase the number of targets per spell point used.

progressionSteps.name: Sonorous Echo II
progressionSteps.description: When casting a spell, you can choose to overexert yourself, doubling the spell and casting it on 2 targets. When you do, you take the Exhausted condition until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Planar Voice
progressionSteps.description: By expending an additional spell point while casting a spell, you can throw your voice, casting spells from any point within medium range.

progressionSteps.name: Silencing Speech
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can use your voice to silence another, robbing them of their voice temporarily and preventing them from raising alarms, casting spells, or communicating effectively for 1 minute unless they succeed on a Survival check.

progressionSteps.name: Arcane Wizard
progressionSteps.description: Your command of magic is absolute. Your words can shape reality, allowing you to cast spells as a half-action.

paths.name: Basic
paths.description: You may have been born with magical ability or had an accident at a young age that gave you the ability to shift power as you will. Your magic has a color and effects that are simple but get the job done.

features.name: Innate Spellcaster
features.description: Gain an additional +5 Spell Points.

progressionSteps.name: Visual Signature
progressionSteps.description: Your spells manifest with a unique color, visible to all. This color provides a +1 bonus to spellcasting checks.

progressionSteps.name: Efficient Casting
progressionSteps.description: When casting with a 'Whisper' intent spell, you can cast using 1 less Spell Point.

progressionSteps.name: Vicious Spellcasting
progressionSteps.description: Your spell damage base is [[1d6]]. When you increase the damage, it is always at least a [[1d8]].

progressionSteps.name: Spell Shielding
progressionSteps.description: When you cast a spell, gain 3 armor that remains until the end of your next turn or until broken.

progressionSteps.name: Spell Storing
progressionSteps.description: You can store any number of Spell Points in a rune, vessel, or container of your choosing, allowing you to access them the next day. These stored Spell Points will only remain until the next day.

progressionSteps.name: Visual Signature II
progressionSteps.description: Increase the bonus to +5 to spellcasting checks.

progressionSteps.name: Efficient Casting II
progressionSteps.description: You can cast magic at a -3 Spell Point cost.

progressionSteps.name: Vicious Spellcasting II
progressionSteps.description: Your spell damage base is [[3d6]], and damage increase is always at least [[3d8]].

progressionSteps.name: Mana Shield
progressionSteps.description: You are immune to Physical Damage.

progressionSteps.name: Cataclysmic Power
progressionSteps.description: You can cast a Cataclysmic spell intent once per day for no Spell Points, but immediately take the Confused and Exhausted conditions for 1 minute.

paths.name: Celestial
paths.description: You were blessed by angels or gods, and your power radiates from you even when you're not casting spells. There is a glow about you, and good-aligned creatures say you smell like fresh food and a hug from a lost love. Often, creatures begin to cry around you without explanation.

features.name: Radiance Burst
features.description: As an off-action, deal 2 Solar damage to creatures you choose in reach range, increasing the range per spell point used.

progressionSteps.name: Lightbringer
progressionSteps.description: You can choose to always emit light that glows in a reach range. Additionally, your spells deal an additional +2 Solar damage.

progressionSteps.name: Shielding Light
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, grant a creature within short range 5 armor made of shimmering light.

progressionSteps.name: Lumière Dure Épée
progressionSteps.description: As an action, create a standard weapon of light that deals Solar damage and lasts for 1 minute. The light can be shaped as any standard melee weapon and can be given to allies. This holy weapon can use Strength, Agility, or your spellcasting check as the attack check.

progressionSteps.name: Eclipse Immunity
progressionSteps.description: You are the defense against the dark; you are immune to Eclipse damage.

progressionSteps.name: Beacon of Hope
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 3 spell points, explode with light dealing [[1d6]] Solar damage to all creatures within short range that you choose. If any allies have a Cognitive condition, they can make a Survival check to end the effect.

progressionSteps.name: Lightbringer II
progressionSteps.description: Your light expands to a Short Range, and your spells deal an additional +6 Solar damage.

progressionSteps.name: Shielding Light II
progressionSteps.description: Your light becomes stronger. You can grant 10 armor to an ally within medium range.

progressionSteps.name: Light of Revelation
progressionSteps.description: As an action, burst with light and expose invisible creatures and objects within short range. You can hold this light for 1 minute but cannot use it again for 1 hour.

progressionSteps.name: Aegis of Soul
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, you can create a barrier of light that completely negates one attack or spell targeting you or an ally within short range. Additionally, you can choose to banish a target to their home plane of existence if it is of extraplanar origin; they must make a Survival check or become banished. The banishment lasts for at least 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Lightforged Avatar
progressionSteps.description: Channeling the core of your radiant powers, you transform into an embodiment of pure energy, becoming an awe-inspiring figure on the battlefield. For 1 minute, your attacks and spells deal an additional [[6d6]] Solar damage, and you radiate an aura of protection within short range offering your allies +10 armor and forcing enemies to have disadvantage on their attack rolls. You can negate one spell or attack aimed at you or an ally within the aura, absorbing its power entirely and gaining [[1d6]] spell points. At any moment during this transformation, you can release a wave of radiant energy that either heals your allies or damages your enemies for [[3d6]], expending 3 spell points. Finally, this ultimate ability enhances your mobility, doubling your movement speed and granting you an equal fly speed.

paths.name: Chaos
paths.description: Embarking on the Chaos Path is akin to striding into a tempest of arcane unpredictability, where the very essence of magic ebbs and flows with the caprice of the unknown. Those who wield Chaos magic do not do so by the conventional study or lineage but through an innate, often bewildering connection to the arcane. This connection is as volatile as it is powerful, manifesting in bursts of uncontrolled magic that can as easily aid as imperil.

features.name: Chaos Control
features.description: Every use of a spell that expends spell points is a gamble, tapping into the heart of chaos itself.
