To channel this force, a Chaos caster must embrace the uncertainty and learn to harness the unpredictable outcomes. When casting a spell that uses spell points, roll a 1d6 on the Chaos Table to determine the spell's augmented effect.

options.name: Wild Surge
options.effect: The spell expands beyond your target, affecting all creatures within reach. Allies and enemies alike are swept up in the spell's effect, creating a maelstrom of magic around the point of casting.

options.name: Power Flux
options.effect: The arcane energies fluctuate wildly, either consuming double the spell points for normal effectiveness or sapping the spell's strength, halving its impact while expending the usual amount.

options.name: Elemental Twist
options.effect: The spell's nature warps, transforming into a different Elemental Damage type. Fire might become ice, lightning could turn to acid, reflecting the chaotic heart of the spell's origin.

options.name: Mana Redux
options.effect: In a rare moment of clarity, the chaotic magic refunds half the spell points used, as if the spell weaves through the threads of chaos to replenish your arcane reserves.

options.name: Mana Shield
options.effect: The chaotic energy coalesces into a protective aura, granting 5 armor that shields you from harm until the end of your next turn.

options.name: Wild Empowerment
options.effect: Magic, unbridled and unrestrained, flows through you without cost. The spell casts at its highest potential without expending spell points, a testament to the raw power of chaos.

progressionSteps.name: Introduction to Chaos
progressionSteps.description: Learn to slightly influence the roll on the Chaos Table, allowing a reroll once per long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Control Surge
progressionSteps.description: Increase the area affected by Wild Surge to short range. Now, your spells also push affected targets away from the spell's epicenter by +10ft.

progressionSteps.name: Defensive Chaos
progressionSteps.description: Whenever you activate Mana Shield from the Chaos Table, it also reflects up to 5 damage back to melee attackers for its duration.

progressionSteps.name: Enhanced Empowerment
progressionSteps.description: Spells affected by Wild Empowerment gain an additional minor effect based on their element (e.g., fire spells briefly ignite the area, ice spells can slow).

progressionSteps.name: Improved Mana Redux
progressionSteps.description: Increase the effectiveness of Mana Redux. Now regain full spell points spent on the casting.

progressionSteps.name: Control Surge II
progressionSteps.description: Wild Surge only affects creatures of your choice.

progressionSteps.name: Flux Control
progressionSteps.description: When you get Power Flux on the Chaos table, nothing happens instead of the negative effects.

progressionSteps.name: Spell Duplication
progressionSteps.description: Spells that do not require spell points due to Wild Empowerment leave an arcane echo that can be triggered on your next turn for a reduced effect without additional cost.

progressionSteps.name: Enhanced Empowerment II
progressionSteps.description: Your spells deal dual damage types, and you choose which table to roll when dealing with success+ results.

progressionSteps.name: Chaos Unleashed
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to cast directly from the Chaos Table, choosing the desired outcome instead of leaving it to chance. However, doing so angers the gods of Chaos, who may send chaos creatures to stop you.

paths.name: Chronomancy
paths.description: You've seen what happens next, and you are trying your best to change the events of the future from the past. Your magic often appears as clocks, sundials, or something similar. The power of Chronus flows through you.

features.name: Premonition
features.description: You briefly glimpse into the future and gain insight into the actions of your enemies. As an Off-Action on your turn, make an Observation check. On a success, you gain advantage on any checks against them until the end of your turn.

progressionSteps.name: Visionary Strike
progressionSteps.description: When you make a successful Observation Check using Premonition, your next attack against a target deals additional [[1d6]] psychic damage.

progressionSteps.name: Psychic Shield
progressionSteps.description: When you succeed on an Observation Check using Premonition, you learn a target’s motivation, wounds, armor, or some other truth about the target.

progressionSteps.name: Temporal Step
progressionSteps.description: When you use Premonition, you can teleport to the creature if they are within medium range.

progressionSteps.name: Unraveling Gaze
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, spend a spell point to see through illusions, detect sources of magic, and pierce through magical darkness.

progressionSteps.name: Unseen Path
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you speak to your past and future self to determine the best course of action, making an Observation Check. On a success, you gain advantage for 1 minute on non-combat checks. On a failure, you gain the attention of the Time Wardens.

progressionSteps.name: Timeless Rewind
progressionSteps.description: You gain advantage on Observation Checks related to history and the future. Once per long rest, you can turn back time 1 round, undoing one event or preventing a mistake. This action gathers the attention of the Time Wardens.

progressionSteps.name: Glimpse of Eternity
progressionSteps.description: As an Off-Action, you can gain advantage on any one check, attack roll, or saving throw. You no longer age and cannot be magically aged.

progressionSteps.name: Shared Visions and Future Sight
progressionSteps.description: You can grant the benefits of your Premonition ability to your allies. You see invisible and intangible creatures up to reach range.

progressionSteps.name: Chrono Shift
progressionSteps.description: Once per long rest, take [[1d4]] turns consecutively. This will anger the Time Wardens.

progressionSteps.name: Master Oracle
progressionSteps.description: You can use your Premonition ability as a Free Action and can affect a number of targets equal to your Observation Check. The bonus damage from Visionary Strike increases to [[3d6]] psychic damage.

paths.name: Crystal
paths.description: You use, break, and wear crystals of all kinds and colors. They give you the power to cast powerful spells and abilities. You have power over crystals that grant you unique abilities over resonance and structure.

features.name: Resonant Piezoelectric
features.description: As an action, fire a blast of sonic energy in a short-range line that deals [[2d4]] thunder damage to all creatures in the line. Increase the damage by +1d6 per spell point used.

progressionSteps.name: Crystalline Focus
progressionSteps.description: This refined crystal enhances your sonic manipulations, providing advantage on Observation checks.

progressionSteps.name: Crystallographic Memory
progressionSteps.description: Store visual and auditory information within crystals, creating detailed recordings that can be played back at any time. This can include capturing scenes, conversations, or secretive meetings.

progressionSteps.name: Crystal Echoes
progressionSteps.description: Whenever you use Resonant Piezoelectric, the energy echoes, allowing you a second blast as an off-action dealing half damage.

progressionSteps.name: Vibrational Therapy
progressionSteps.description: Develop therapeutic techniques using crystal vibrations to treat psychological or emotional distress. You can remove any Cognitive Conditions on allies as a half-action.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Resonance
progressionSteps.description: Whenever you use Resonant Piezoelectric, you can cast a spell that costs no spell points as an off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Vibrational Shield
progressionSteps.description: Whenever you use Resonant Piezoelectric, gain armor equal to the damage dealt.

progressionSteps.name: Frequency Modulation
progressionSteps.description: Your Resonant Piezoelectric pushes large or smaller creatures in the line 10ft in a direction of your choice.

progressionSteps.name: Piercing Resonance
progressionSteps.description: Your mastery over sonic energy allows you to pierce through magical defenses. Your Resonant Piezoelectric can now also damage intangible creatures and penetrate barriers such as magical shields.

progressionSteps.name: Resonant Synergy
progressionSteps.description: Combine the effects of Crystal Echoes and Mana Resonance. When using Resonant Piezoelectric, you can now cast a spell as an off-action at full effectiveness while also unleashing a secondary blast.

progressionSteps.name: Resonant Cataclysm
progressionSteps.description: Your Resonant Piezoelectric becomes an area effect within a short range that affects only creatures you choose.

paths.name: Dragon
paths.description: You were blessed by a dragon or have a draconic bloodline. The power of Khalas, the god-dragon, compels you. You feel the need to travel to the dragon island at least once in your life.

features.name: Scaleskin
features.description: You were born with dragon magic within you. Scales spot your skin. You start with +1 to all your checks.

progressionSteps.name: Scaled Resilience
progressionSteps.description: Your skin toughens, providing a natural defense that grants +5 armor that can be healed or repaired.

progressionSteps.name: Ancient Insight
progressionSteps.description: Tap into the collective wisdom of dragonkind to gain advantage on Intellect and Survival checks related to magic, history, or the natural world.

progressionSteps.name: Fiery Exhalation
progressionSteps.description: As an action, unleash a cone of dragonfire that deals [[1d10]] fire damage to all creatures in front of you up to reach range.

progressionSteps.name: Aerial Surge
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to make a powerful leap up to your movement speed as an off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Terrifying Presence
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, emit a fearsome roar that can intimidate foes if they fail an Influence check, giving them disadvantage on their next check against you. Usable once per long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Scaled Resilience II
progressionSteps.description: Your natural armor increases to +10 and regenerates on a long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Fiery Exhalation II
progressionSteps.description: Your dragonfire deals [[3d10]] fire damage.

progressionSteps.name: Wings Unfurled
progressionSteps.description: Summon ethereal dragon wings that grant you the ability to fly with speed equal to your movement.

progressionSteps.name: Scaleskin II
progressionSteps.description: Your innate dragon power strengthens further, giving you +3 to all checks.

progressionSteps.name: Draconic Ascendance
progressionSteps.description: Embrace the full might of your draconic heritage, allowing you to transform into a full dragon form once per long rest. While transformed, gain +30 armor and increase your size to Large. You have a fly speed equal to double your movement and can carry up to 5 Medium creatures easily.

paths.name: Elemental
paths.description: You are a conduit of elemental power. Through you, the elements unite and empower your spells. The solidity of stone, the fervor of fire, the fluidity of water, and the whisper of air all combine to form a tapestry of elemental mastery.

features.name: Elemental Absorption
features.description: Once per day, if you are hit with elemental damage, gain armor equal to the damage instead of taking damage.

progressionSteps.name: Fire Affinity
progressionSteps.description: Your command over flames grants you power. All your spells now deal an additional +2 fire damage.

progressionSteps.name: Lightning Affinity
progressionSteps.description: Your restless energy manifests—you are never in one place for long. As an action, dash in a short-range line as a lightning bolt that does not provoke opportunity attacks, dealing [[1d4]] damage to all creatures in that line.

progressionSteps.name: Ice Affinity
progressionSteps.description: The cold empowers you. As an off-action, coat your skin in ice, gaining 3 armor. If hit with a melee attack, deal 1 ice damage to the attacker.

progressionSteps.name: Air Affinity
progressionSteps.description: The winds lift you. You rarely touch the ground, hovering slightly above it. You do not trigger traps that require a weight trigger. Additionally, increase movement speed by 10ft.

progressionSteps.name: Stone Affinity
progressionSteps.description: The strength of the stone is at your call. Create 6 stone armor as a half-action that remains until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Water Affinity
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you become one with liquid that is at least half water and can contain your entire body. When you do so, you are indiscernible from the liquid, taking on the same color and becoming invisible. You cannot be targeted or touched by any physical means. If the water takes damage, you take half the damage.

progressionSteps.name: Smoke Affinity
progressionSteps.description: Embrace the shadows, smoke, and darkness. As an action, exhale smoke to blind and cause coughing on a target within reach range if they fail a Survival check. The effect lasts until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Fire Affinity II
progressionSteps.description: Your spells deal an additional +5 fire damage.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Absorption II
progressionSteps.description: Gain double the damage as armor when using Elemental Absorption.

progressionSteps.name: Elemental Avatar
progressionSteps.description: Take the form of all the elements, becoming a storm of elemental fury that lasts for 1 minute. You double your movement speed, gain flight equal to your movement, +50 armor, and your attacks deal elemental damage.

paths.name: Nature
paths.description: You were probably born under an old willow tree that planted a seed in your belly when you took your first breath. The tree died, and now you have the magic within you. When you pass, you will become the tree and pass your power on to another.

features.name: Tree Speech
features.description: You can speak Naech (general), which allows you to speak to plants and animals. They respond to you in one-word answers.

features.name: Nature Spirit
features.description: You have a +3 Loyalty with trees and +4 Spirit.

progressionSteps.name: Thorny Defense
progressionSteps.description: You move silently and leave no tracks on natural ground. Additionally, as an action, summon a circle of brambles around your reach range that deals [[1d4]] piercing damage and causes difficult terrain.

progressionSteps.name: Animal Empathy
progressionSteps.description: Form a deeper bond with animals you encounter, making them more inclined to assist or accompany you on your journey, fostering unique interactions and alliances. You can speak to them, and you and your party can understand them while you interact with the creature.

progressionSteps.name: Veil of Leaves
progressionSteps.description: As an action, blend into natural surroundings with ease, becoming invisible when motionless in foliage or shaded areas.

progressionSteps.name: Flourishing Terrain
progressionSteps.description: Transform a short-range area into lush, difficult terrain that hampers foes but accelerates healing and grants [[1d4+2]] spell points per hour for you and allies standing within it. Within, you can also create hammocks, beds, and furniture of your choice. There is drinking water, fruit, and small animals that wander in the area.

progressionSteps.name: Animal Companion
progressionSteps.description: Form a bond with a creature of the wild, summoning it as an action at PL4 +1 per spell point used. It assists in combat or performs simple tasks and can be summoned once per long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Wild Shape
progressionSteps.description: As an action, gain the ability to transform into a small or medium animal, adopting its physical form and abilities from the beast table. It requires an action to return to your true form.

progressionSteps.name: Unerring Path
progressionSteps.description: Never lose your way in the Feywild or enchanted forests, always able to find paths, even those hidden by magic.

progressionSteps.name: Charm of the Fey
progressionSteps.description: As an action, make an Influence check to charm an individual on a success for 1 minute, making them more amicable and open to suggestions, willing to tell you secrets, or follow you. After the minute, they may realize they have been charmed and might become hostile.

progressionSteps.name: Nature’s Wrath
progressionSteps.description: Your spells deal nature damage by default.

progressionSteps.name: Eternal Guardian
progressionSteps.description: As an action, embody the full power of nature, gaining the ability to transform into a mighty tree form. In this form, you gain +30 armor, can heal allies for +10 within medium range each turn as an off-action, and have an aura that gives enemies -3 to their checks for 1 minute. Once the minute is complete, you enter a coma-like sleep for 1 hour and cannot be awoken from this sleep.

paths.name: Life
paths.description: Whether it be your life or another’s, you wield it as a power of your own. This can be your blood or the plants and animals around you. After you cast spells, you and things around you have a little less brightness to them.

features.name: Not Yet
features.description: If you take the Death Condition, make a Luck check. On a success, you remove the Death Condition. This cannot be used again for 1 month.

progressionSteps.name: Shared Vitality
progressionSteps.description: As an action touching a creature, temporarily link your life force with an ally's, allowing you to transfer your health to them or vice versa up to your maximum wounds. This connection leaves both parties feeling momentarily drained and pale.

progressionSteps.name: Revitalization
progressionSteps.description: Once per day as an action, draw deeply from the life force of the land to invigorate yourself, granting +3 Strength and Agility for 1 minute at the cost of the area's vitality, leaving it grey and lifeless.

progressionSteps.name: Life Cycle
progressionSteps.description: Upon using 'Not Yet' to avoid the Death Condition, your revival leaves a mark of desolation on the surroundings, and your form becomes slightly more spectral, but you gain +2 Spell Points permanently.

progressionSteps.name: Speak with Dead
progressionSteps.description: Communicate with the spirits of the deceased, extracting information or promises of service in exchange for temporary peace. You always have a PL1 minion of your choice (skeleton, ghoul, or raven) that returns to life after 1 minute if it is killed or instantly if you spend 1 Spell Point.

progressionSteps.name: Borrowed Time
progressionSteps.description: Store a portion of your life force (like permanent wounds or Spell Points) in a soul-container object, giving it an eerie glow or darkness. You can tap into this reserve in moments of need, though doing so emits an eerie, decaying energy.

progressionSteps.name: Life’s Ascension
progressionSteps.description: You can use 'Not Yet' once per day with an automatic success. When you do, you retain the wounds of the loss. Your bones become brittle, taking the Broken and Dislocation conditions upon resurrection. You need to spend 3 Spell Points to remove them or have an ally heal them.

progressionSteps.name: Aura of Decay
progressionSteps.description: As an action, release a fog that saps vitality from enemies to heal your wounds. This deals [[1d10]] elemental damage to creatures within reach range, healing you for half the total damage dealt. The land it touches withers, and the life force it drains manifests as brief flickers of light rushing towards you.

progressionSteps.name: Minions
progressionSteps.description: You have weak minions that follow you and can perform tasks at your bidding. These tasks can be simple things, and they will do their best. You have a number of minions equal to your Luck Check or a single minion with a PL equal to your Luck Check.

progressionSteps.name: Borrowed Time II
progressionSteps.description: You can store all but 1 wound in your Soul-Container. When you activate 'Not Yet,' your body dissipates and returns to life wherever the Soul-Container resides in [[1d6]] days. Your minions will protect your Soul-Container, but powerful creatures will be drawn to it.

progressionSteps.name: Life Path Transformation
progressionSteps.description: Complete your descent into darkness by becoming a master of life. You no longer age, and your physical form becomes a vessel for magic. You command legions of the un-living and wield Eclipse magic with unparalleled mastery. Your very presence blights the land, and you can draw upon the life force of your minions to sustain your spells and existence.

paths.name: Tech
paths.description: An architect of the arcane and the mechanical, you've merged cutting-edge technology with mystic energies. As a Tech Mage, your body not only hosts cybernetic enhancements but also serves as a conduit for potent magical forces. You craft and wield gadgets that are not only marvels of engineering but also enchanted instruments capable of channeling powerful spells.

features.name: Robot Limb
features.description: Either on accident or through experimentation, you've replaced a limb with a robotic one. Your limb provides 10 armor, and as an Action you can regain [[1d10]] armor, giving temporary armor if above maximum, and gain +2 to checks and damage until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Customizable Limb
progressionSteps.description: Your robot limb can be outfitted with various tools and gadgets that assist in mundane tasks and can be swapped or upgraded over time. Your robot limb gives +1 Strength and Agility bonus.

progressionSteps.name: Portable Storage
progressionSteps.description:
A lightweight, extra-dimensional pouch that expands internally to hold small items. It can carry multiple tools, trinkets, or materials without adding encumbrance. Each item is sorted by type, making retrieval swift and organized.

- **Capacity:** Up to 10 bulk (items cannot exceed 2 bulk individually).
- **Access Time:** Off-Action to store or retrieve.
- **Living Creatures:** Tiny creatures (up to 1 bulk) can be stored temporarily for up to 1 hour with breathable air. Discomfort begins after 5 minutes.

progressionSteps.name: Illusory Displays
progressionSteps.description: Your limb projects passable holograms. As an action, create a short-range illusion or map for up to 1 minute. This can confuse enemies or aid in tactical planning. Enemies must make an Observation check or take the Confused condition until the end of their next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Rapid Recharge
progressionSteps.description: As an action, you can choose to Overclock your tech to rapidly regain [[1d6]] spell points that last until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Analytical Vision
progressionSteps.description: A sophisticated monocle enhances your sight, granting the ability to closely inspect and analyze magical residues and mechanical workings, giving a +1 to Observation.

progressionSteps.name: Rapid Recharge II
progressionSteps.description: Instead of Overclock, you can use Overburn, which as a half-action gains [[2d4]] spell points until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Drone Companion
progressionSteps.description: As an action, construct a small drone using spare parts and magic that is a PL3. This drone can perform reconnaissance, deliver spells stored in your tech, or assist in crafting and repair tasks.

progressionSteps.name: Shield Matrix
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, activate a shield matrix that grants armor equal to your Crafting check. This shield lasts for 1 minute or until depleted, protecting you from physical and magical attacks by absorbing damage.

progressionSteps.name: Field Control
progressionSteps.description: Employ technology to manipulate gravity around you, enabling high jumps, slow falls, or the pulling and pushing of objects without physical contact.

progressionSteps.name: Quantum Calibration
progressionSteps.description: Calibrate your tech to tap into quantum energies, allowing you to, as an Off-Action (Reaction), reroll any failed spellcasting check or have a creature reroll a successful check against your spells once.

paths.name: Vozian
paths.description: You choose to draw on the most evil energy you can. Ash falls from you wherever you step, your skin is dry and cracked, the skin underneath is dark and tar-like. Demons speak to you as casual friends would, and bright lights feel like whips to your skin.

features.name: One of You
features.description: Demons, Devils, and other creatures born of evil have a +2 Loyalty with you. If you acquire the true name of a demon, they become your servant.

features.name: Failure Gains
features.description: If you fail a spell and Stress Push to succeed, gain armor instead of losing health.

progressionSteps.name: Infernal Knowledge
progressionSteps.description: Unlock knowledge of demonic lore and the ability to communicate with all demons telepathically, gaining insights and potentially persuading them to share truths or aid.

progressionSteps.name: Infernal Sight
progressionSteps.description: Double your low-light vision. Your eyes adapt to see clearly in both absolute darkness and blinding light, though bright natural light still discomforts you.

progressionSteps.name: Duskwalker
progressionSteps.description: As an action, embrace the shadows to become invisible until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Dominion's Resilience
progressionSteps.description: The Iron Dominion toughens you. You have +10 natural armor that recovers double on Press On and all on a long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Cauterizing Flames
progressionSteps.description: As an action, your touch can summon hellfire that heals or harms for [[1d6]] Vozian, without a check. Use it to cauterize wounds, sealing them with dark energy leaving terrible scars, or to ignite enemies with a corrupt flame.

progressionSteps.name: Ethereal Familiar
progressionSteps.description: As an action, summon a PL4 demonic familiar bound to serve you. This familiar can perform tasks, spy for you, and assist in casting spells, especially those with Vozian energy. They remain until dismissed, but they do not want to be there.

progressionSteps.name: Dimensional Shift
progressionSteps.description: As an action, roll a [[1d10-1]], stepping into that layer of the Ordealis, greeted by a familiar lesser demon of that layer.

progressionSteps.name: Frostwalker
progressionSteps.description: Immune to Ice damage and you have the ability to traverse icy terrains effortlessly. Your presence may quell blizzards or summon frost to hinder foes.

progressionSteps.name: Judgment’s Insight
progressionSteps.description: Gain a deep understanding of moral and ethical dilemmas, giving you advantage on Influence checks, allowing you to navigate complex social interactions and detect lies or hidden motives with uncanny accuracy.

progressionSteps.name: Ordealis Ascendant
progressionSteps.description: Achieve a profound connection with Ordealis itself, enabling you to draw upon its entropic energies to cast powerful spells that deal Vozian damage without the need to spend additional spell points. As an action, summon greater demons at PL10 without spell points, although they will not be under your command.

talents.name: Galeforce
talents.description: You harness the essence of motion and speed, casting spells that enhance swiftness or slow down foes.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your Agility Check determines your spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Agility Check. Regain 1 Spell Point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Additionally, gain 1 Spell Point by successfully avoiding an attack or trap using your agility.

features.name: Gale Step
features.description: As an action, teleport short range with a burst of wind. Where you choose to arrive, all creatures within 5ft must make a Strength check or be knocked prone.

progressionSteps.name: Gale Step Enhancement
progressionSteps.description: Gale Step becomes medium range. Upon arrival, generate a gust granting temporary armor points equal to your Agility check until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Whirling Defense
progressionSteps.description: As a Half-Action, summon ethereal blades that orbit you for 1 minute, automatically dealing [[1d4]] thunder damage to nearby enemies at the end of your turn.

progressionSteps.name: Zephyr's Grace
progressionSteps.description: You float slightly above the ground, leaving no footprints and avoiding pressure traps entirely.

progressionSteps.name: Wind's Embrace
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to hover or fly up to your movement speed at low altitudes, landing at the end of your turn.

progressionSteps.name: Stormcaller's Command
progressionSteps.description: Control local weather to create gusts or downdrafts, affecting enemy movements or assisting allies within a medium range.

progressionSteps.name: Gale Step Mirage
progressionSteps.description: Upon using Gale Step, you create a visual illusion of yourself at the departure point that lasts for a few seconds. This mirage can draw attacks or attention away from your true location, offering strategic distractions or confusions in combat or tense situations.

progressionSteps.name: Gale Step Breeze
progressionSteps.description: After using Gale Step, a soothing breeze remains, calming emotions within a small radius. This can be used to de-escalate conflicts, soothe frightened individuals, or provide relief in stressful situations, making it a versatile tool for non-combat encounters.

progressionSteps.name: Gale Step Zephyr
progressionSteps.description: Upon using Gale Step, the air around your arrival point becomes charged with energy. For a short duration, allies within this area receive a minor boost to their agility and reaction time, making it an excellent tactic for initiating surprise attacks or swiftly evading danger.

progressionSteps.name: Gale Step Echoes
progressionSteps.description: Your mastery over Gale Step allows you to create auditory illusions at both your departure and arrival points. These sounds can range from footsteps to your voice, offering complex strategies for deception, misdirection, and communication over distances.

progressionSteps.name: Air Cushion
progressionSteps.description: As your reaction, create a cushion of air to catch falling objects or to soften impacts, potentially preventing damage to fragile items or cushioning a fall.

talents.name: Artifex
talents.description: Your magic is in creation and transformation, casting spells that fabricate objects or alter materials.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your Crafting Check is your spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Crafting Check. Regain 1 spell point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Additionally, gain 1 spell point by crafting an item or successfully repairing something significant.

features.name: Mage Artisan
features.description: Once per long rest, you can craft a temporary magical item without the need for materials. This magical item is imbued with a spell you craft with your words of power that has a feature you design. This item lasts for 24 hours and is a standard weapon unless otherwise specified.

progressionSteps.name: Imbue Essence
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action spending 1 spell point, you can imbue weapons or objects with magical essences, switching its damage to an elemental type of your choice for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Wondrous Tinker
progressionSteps.description: You gain the ability to repair magical items, restoring a portion of their power or functionality. This process can also temporarily boost the item's effectiveness, granting bonus effects or enhanced power.

progressionSteps.name: Phantom Smithy
progressionSteps.description: You have a spectral forge and tools that follow you and can be summoned and set as an action. You can perform crafting actions on the go, without the need for a physical workshop. This mobile smithy allows for the repair and creation of items anywhere.

progressionSteps.name: Architect of the Arcane
progressionSteps.description: As an action, design and construct a small, temporary magical structure, such as a bridge, shelter, or tower. These structures last for 24 hours and can be tailored to suit immediate needs, such as defense, rest, or strategic advantage. Cannot be summoned on top of living creatures.

progressionSteps.name: Whispers of the Blade
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-hour crafting check, bestow sentience upon your crafted weapons. These weapons gain the ability to communicate telepathically with their wielder and provide advantage on one attack roll per long rest due to their tactical guidance.

progressionSteps.name: Temporal Edge
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-hour crafting check, infuse a weapon with the essence of time. Once per long rest, the wielder can rewind a moment, essentially granting them a redo of a missed attack or failed save.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Disruptor
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-hour crafting check, create a device capable of emitting a pulse that temporarily disables magical traps, constructs, or barriers within a reach range. Usable once per long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Fortified Bastion
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-hour crafting check, enchant a structure to act as a formidable bastion, significantly enhancing its durability and creating defensive mechanisms such as magical barriers, automated defenses, and traps to protect against attackers.

progressionSteps.name: Transportation Nodes
progressionSteps.description: As a 1-hour crafting check, craft teleportation nodes that are within 1 mile of one another. You can have a number of nodes equal to half your Crafting check, and they last for 1 year before they need to be maintained. These nodes cannot teleport creatures of an opposite magic from your magic path and can drive these creatures insane.

progressionSteps.name: Ethereal Library
progressionSteps.description: Construct a magical library that can store and catalog vast amounts of information magically. Access to the library grants advantage on Intellect checks and can reveal insights on specific topics, creatures, or spells when spending 1 hour in the library.

talents.name: Heartflow
talents.description: Your spells sway minds and hearts, casting enchantments that manipulate emotions and convictions.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your Influence Check serves as your spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Influence Check. Regain 1 Spell Point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Gain an additional Spell Point by convincing someone to change their mind or by successfully navigating a difficult social encounter in your favor.

features.name: Heartstring Tug
features.description: When making an Influence Check, you can spend Spell Points to increase the check by +1 per point spent. Additionally, when you get a success+ on an Influence check, a single target takes the Charmed condition.

progressionSteps.name: Empathic Resonance
progressionSteps.description: As an off-action, you can read the emotional state of any individual you're conversing with, gaining advantage on your next Influence Check against them. This allows you to tailor your approach for maximum effect.

progressionSteps.name: Whispered Inception
progressionSteps.description: In a conversation, you can implant a subtle suggestion in the listener's mind. If you succeed on an Influence Check with a success+, the target feels compelled to act on your suggestion as if it was their own idea, provided it doesn't bring direct harm to them or others.

progressionSteps.name: Aura of Allure
progressionSteps.description: Your presence becomes irresistibly captivating to those around you. Allies within a 15-foot radius gain a bonus to their own Charisma-based checks, drawn from your magnetic energy.

progressionSteps.name: Diplomatic Immunity
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Spell Point to make yourself and your allies within reach range immune to being Charmed or Frightened until the end of your next turn, reflecting your deep understanding of emotional manipulation.

progressionSteps.name: Harmonic Persuasion
progressionSteps.description: When working together with an ally on an Influence attempt, you can combine your efforts seamlessly, granting you both a bonus to the check. This represents your skill in orchestrating social situations to your advantage.

progressionSteps.name: Mirror Heart
progressionSteps.description: You can reflect the emotions of one person onto another within your vicinity. This can be used to spread calm, joy, or even dissent, manipulating group dynamics subtly.

progressionSteps.name: Binding Promise
progressionSteps.description: When you charm someone with Heartstring Tug, you can bind the charm with a promise. If the target agrees to a task or action and breaks this promise, they suffer a minor magical penalty, such as a headache or a sense of unease, encouraging them to keep their word.

progressionSteps.name: Veil of Composure
progressionSteps.description: You can mask your true emotions and intentions, making it nearly impossible for others to discern your lies or truths. This grants you a defensive mechanism against those who would use your own tactics against you.

progressionSteps.name: Symphony of Minds
progressionSteps.description: As a pinnacle of your influence abilities, you can extend your charm effect to a small group, weaving their emotions and thoughts together in a harmonious symphony that aligns with your goals. This grand manipulation, however, requires careful planning and expenditure of multiple Spell Points to maintain control without backlash.

talents.name: Mindrift
talents.description: Your magic is the pursuit of knowledge and arcane secrets, casting spells that unlock mysteries or enhance understanding.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your Intellect Check is your spellcasting check. You have Spell Points equal to your Intellect Check. Regain 1 Spell Point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Gain an additional Spell Point by acquiring new knowledge or solving a complex puzzle or problem.

features.name: Mana Insight
features.description: As an action, spend 1 Spell Point to reveal magical traps, enchantments, or the presence of magical creatures within a short range for the next minute. This insight allows you to understand the basic properties of the revealed magic, such as its effect, strength, and potential origin.

progressionSteps.name: Arcane Efficiency
progressionSteps.description: With countless hours spent in libraries and arcane laboratories, you've learned some tricks about casting spells with less energy. Your spells cost 2 less to cast, allowing you to weave magic with effortless grace.

progressionSteps.name: Tracking Spell
progressionSteps.description: By spending an additional 2 Spell Points when you hit a creature with a spell, you can leave a 'trace' on any magical effect or creature you detect. For the next 24 hours, you can sense the direction and general distance of this effect or creature if it is within 5 miles. This trace cannot be detected and allows you to track elusive magical entities or artifacts.

progressionSteps.name: Soul Exchange
progressionSteps.description: After navigating the ethereal conduits of life and magic, you've discovered a dangerous ritual to exchange your life force for magical energy. You can sacrifice 2 wounds to regain 1 Spell Point, a testament to your dedication or desperation.

progressionSteps.name: Knowledge Recovery
progressionSteps.description: Once per day as an action, read an entire book and regain [[2d6]] Spell Points. It must be a new book each time.

progressionSteps.name: Memory Smith
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spending 3 Spell Points, you and up to 3 other creatures dive into the memory of a creature that you can touch if they fail an Intellect Check. It feels like 1 hour while in the memory but only takes until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Word Wrangler
progressionSteps.description: You can cast two spells at once. It must be the same target.

progressionSteps.name: Reactive Spellweaver
progressionSteps.description: You can cast single Spell Point spells or less as an off-action.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Bulwark
progressionSteps.description: Your mastery of magical protection creates additional armor of +10 Armor for yourself. If your shield is depleted, you may recharge it as an action for 2 Spell Points. Alternatively, as an action spending 1 Spell Point, you can extend a portion of this protective magic to nearby allies, granting Armor of +3 per Spell Point to allies within short range until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Stealth Caster
progressionSteps.description: When you cast spells, there is no sign that you are casting them. Your magic becomes an unseen tool, its presence known only by its effects.

progressionSteps.name: Arcane Sanctum
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 Spell Point to create a Sanctuary of Reflection, a mental library filled with mirrors that reflect moments of knowledge from your life. Creatures resting in the Mystic Archive gain advantage on their next Intellect-based check and can ask one question, which the Archive answers based on your accumulated knowledge.

talents.name: Prophecy
talents.description: You bend fortune to your will, casting spells that manipulate probabilities and chance.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your magic is unpredictable, your Luck Check is your check for spellcasting. You have Spell Points equal to your Luck Check. Regain 1 Spell Point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Gain an additional Spell Point each time you experience a stroke of good luck or a favorable turn of events deemed significant by the narrator.

features.name: Prophecy Pool
features.description: You have 3 additional Spell Points that recover 1 on a Press On and 1 on a long rest. Expend 3 Spell Points to gain a Prophecy Point.

features.name: Prophecy Dice
features.description: For each Prophecy Point acquired, roll a d20. Record the result and add it to your prophecy pool. When making any check, you can use a reaction to replace your roll with a number from your prophecy pool, consuming that recorded number. You can have up to 3 dice stored in your pool.

progressionSteps.name: Unseen Servant
progressionSteps.description: As an action using a Spell Point, summon a version of you from the past, an ancestor, or spirit of your choosing that lasts for 1 minute. It takes actions on your turn.

progressionSteps.name: Echo
progressionSteps.description: When you make a spell attack and the roll lands on a 5, cast the spell again at no cost.

progressionSteps.name: Hand of Fate
progressionSteps.description: Expend a Prophecy Dice and gain a [[1d6]], this [[1d6]] can be added to anyone’s check within short range of you as an Off-Action.

progressionSteps.name: Speak with the Dead
progressionSteps.description: Over 1 minute, you can question a corpse. The corpse must have been dead for no longer than 10 days, and the corpse must be able to answer the questions. The corpse answers with one sentence per question and will answer 3 questions or more if it desires. After 1 minute, the corpse turns to dust.

progressionSteps.name: Speak with Fate
progressionSteps.description: Over 10 minutes, make a Spirit Check while you focus on a course of action. On a success, Fate gives a single word or image based on what you focused on. This may provide insight, give you a clue, or warn you about a path or potential outcome.

progressionSteps.name: Reverse Pain
progressionSteps.description: Spend a Prophecy Die to heal a creature for [[1d4]] wounds, 1 injury, or remove 1 condition.

progressionSteps.name: Temporal Shift
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, use 3 Spell Points to briefly shift yourself into the past, allowing an incoming attack to pass harmlessly through you.

progressionSteps.name: Echoes of the Past
progressionSteps.description: As an action, use 3 Spell Points to recall a past event in vivid detail that happened in this area. This can provide useful information or clues about the current situation.

progressionSteps.name: Temporal Insight
progressionSteps.description: As an action, use 3 Spell Points to glimpse into your own past and future or at least one version of them, giving you insight into the possible outcomes of your current situation if certain choices you may have made caused a particular outcome.

talents.name: Visionary
talents.description: Your magic is intuitive, born from a deep understanding of your surroundings.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: You cast spells by observing and reacting to the environment, using your Observation Check. Spell points equal your Observation Check. Regain 1 spell point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Gain an additional spell point each time you spot something hidden or invisible, notice a secret, or spot a danger before others that keeps everyone safe.

features.name: Insight
features.description: Your acute observations allow you to channel magical energy with precision, infusing your spells with the essence of your surroundings. You have a resource of 3 Insight Points. You can expend a point to gain advantage on a spell, uncover truths, find hidden objects, remove the invisible or intangible condition. Regain 1 point on a Press On, all on a long rest.

progressionSteps.name: Echoes of Intent
progressionSteps.description: Your keen observation allows you to sense the intentions of others, granting you the ability to predict enemy movements. As a free action spending an Insight Point, take a stance if you are not already in a stance.

progressionSteps.name: Beyond Sight
progressionSteps.description: Your observational skills pierce through deception. You can detect illusions and magically hidden objects or creatures within short range.

progressionSteps.name: Whispers
progressionSteps.description: By observing the flows of magic around you, you can listen to the whispers of arcane energy. This grants you insight into the magical abilities of observed creatures, identifying one spell or magical effect they can produce, which you can then prepare defenses against.

progressionSteps.name: Temporal Awareness
progressionSteps.description: Your acute observations extend to the flow of time itself. Once per long rest, freeze a moment in time to analyze the battlefield, granting you an extra action on your turn, which must be used for analysis, spell preparation, or observation.

progressionSteps.name: Mindscape Navigation
progressionSteps.description: Delve into the mental landscapes of those you observe. Once per long rest, you and your party can enter the mind of a willing or incapacitated creature, exploring their thoughts for clues, secrets, or information, as if navigating a physical space.

progressionSteps.name: Reality's Weave
progressionSteps.description: Your observation of reality's fabric allows you to tug on its threads. As an action spending 1 Insight Point, alter one minor detail of your environment once per long rest (e.g., unlocking a door, turning a pathway, etc.), as long as it doesn't directly harm another being.

progressionSteps.name: Echo
progressionSteps.description: When you uncover a hidden truth or attempt to reveal something invisible with an Insight Point and nothing is presented, regain the expended point.

progressionSteps.name: Perspective Switch
progressionSteps.description: As an Off-Action spending 1 Insight Point, all creatures within short range view the world from your perception until the end of your next turn. They understand your thoughts and ideas and you can convey any truth or memory about yourself. When they return, they must make an Observation Check or gain +1 Loyalty to you.

progressionSteps.name: Whimsical Warp
progressionSteps.description: As an action spending 1 Insight Point, you can bend space to swap positions with a random object within sight. This can be anything from a book to a chair, as long as you fit in the space, it's not anchored or too large.

progressionSteps.name: Gravity's Suggestion
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action spending 1 Insight Point, you can perceive gravity differently. For the next minute, walk on walls or ceilings. The effect ends if you take damage.

talents.name: Soulstream
talents.description: Your spells connect to the ethereal and the divine, manipulating the fabric of reality itself.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your Spirit Check is your spellcasting check. You have Spell points equal to your Spirit Check. Regain 1 spell point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Additionally, gain 1 spell point by performing a spiritual or religious act that aligns with your beliefs or magic source.

features.name: Possession
features.description: As an action, touch a creature and attempt to possess it with a contested Spirit check. If you succeed, you become intangible and merge with the targeted creature until the end of your next turn. While possessing a creature, you have full physical control, sensory access, communication, and limited memory observation (only surface-level thoughts). You cannot cast your spells, damage the host, or cause damage to host loyalties. If damage comes to the host, they can make the Spirit check again, gaining a bonus equal to the damage taken. If the host regains control, you are pushed from the body, knocked prone within 5ft in a direction of your choice, and take the Confused condition until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Spiritual Echo
progressionSteps.description: When casting a spell, spend an additional 1 spell point to leave a faint spiritual echo in the area. For the next hour, you can sense the presence of living creatures moving through this echo, as the spirits alert you to intruders or dangers, enhancing your guardianship over a domain.

progressionSteps.name: Ethereal Passage
progressionSteps.description: Spend 2 spell points to become intangible, stepping into the world of spirits.

progressionSteps.name: Ancestral Guidance
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to summon a spirit guide as an off-action. The guide provides you with a +5 bonus on one check of your choice, but you take the Confused condition until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Blessing of the Ancestors
progressionSteps.description: As a Half-Action, call upon your ancestors to bless one ally within short range. The ally gains advantage on their next chosen check.

progressionSteps.name: Ward Against Evil
progressionSteps.description: You can create a protective ward around a campsite or room as an action, spending 1 spell point. The ward prevents the entry of spirits and curses for 24 hours; additionally, you cannot be spied upon by other creatures while in the ward.

progressionSteps.name: Commune with Spirits
progressionSteps.description: As an action, spend 1 spell point to open your senses to the spirit world, allowing you to communicate with spirits and ancestors. This communication can provide guidance, reveal secrets, or grant blessings from the spirits. You may ask up to three questions, to which the spirits respond according to their knowledge and disposition.

progressionSteps.name: Extended Possession
progressionSteps.description: You can now Possess a target from short range.

progressionSteps.name: Residual Influence
progressionSteps.description: After leaving a possessed body, the target remains under a minor influence. As your next half-action after possession, you can give one simple command (no more than five words) that the target feels compelled to obey as long as it brings them no harm.

progressionSteps.name: Enhanced Memory Access
progressionSteps.description: Gain the ability to dive deeper into the host’s memories, accessing more than just surface thoughts. This can include significant past events or secrets the host is aware of, or you can create memories as an action on your next turn by spending 1 spell point. If the memories are not feasible, the host will not accept the memory.

progressionSteps.name: Defensive Possession
progressionSteps.description: You can now possess an ally as a reaction to them taking damage, reducing the damage by half, but you remain until the end of their next turn.

talents.name: Nightwhisper
talents.description: Your magic is subtle and elusive, casting spells that cloak and reveal, hiding allies or exposing enemies.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your Stealth Check is your spellcasting check. You have Spell points equal to your Stealth Check. Regain 1 spell point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Gain an additional spell point each time you successfully move undetected past enemies or eavesdrop on a conversation without being noticed.

features.name: Mirage Cloak
features.description: Wrap yourself in an illusion as an action, altering your appearance or becoming invisible until the end of your next turn. You can also change small aspects of your appearance at will, such as eye color, hairstyle, or even the pattern of your clothing, perfect for blending in or standing out.

progressionSteps.name: Hallucinatory Terrain
progressionSteps.description: Change the appearance of your surroundings, creating strategic advantages or hiding escape routes. Alternatively, create a large-scale illusion that mimics a battle or a natural phenomenon, causing chaos among enemies.

progressionSteps.name: Mimicry Mastery
progressionSteps.description: Perfectly imitate sounds and voices you have heard, from the chirping of birds to the voice of a local guard, adding a layer of deception to your illusions.

progressionSteps.name: Phantasmal Performer
progressionSteps.description: Summon illusory figures to perform simple tasks, like playing instruments, juggling, or even acting out small scenes. There can be up to 6, and they can perform simple tasks, but they cannot attack and have no physical form.

progressionSteps.name: Phantom Banquet
progressionSteps.description: As an action, create the illusion of a lavish feast, complete with the appearance and aroma of delicious food. The food is edible and delicious, and people feel satiated during the meal but are hungry 1 hour later.

progressionSteps.name: Disorienting Mirage
progressionSteps.description: As an Off-Action (Reaction), create a rapidly shifting illusion around a target enemy, causing their attack to have disadvantage.

progressionSteps.name: Spectral Chains
progressionSteps.description: As an action, summon illusory chains to bind an enemy, potentially causing them to believe they are restrained and reducing their movement or actions for a turn. They must make an Intellect check or remain pinned by the chains.

progressionSteps.name: Psychic Backlash
progressionSteps.description: Imbue your illusions with a psychic sting, causing enemies who touch them to suffer [[1d4]] psychic damage.

progressionSteps.name: Illusive Step
progressionSteps.description: As an action, teleport a short-range distance, leaving an illusion where you stood until the end of your next turn.

progressionSteps.name: Invisible Maze
progressionSteps.description: As an action, trap a creature in an invisible labyrinth, challenging them to escape. They must make an Intellect or Observation Check to escape, realizing it is an illusion on a success.

progressionSteps.name: Phantom Voices
progressionSteps.description: As a reaction, cast whispers around a target with a spellcasting check, distracting or misdirecting them on a success, causing disadvantage on a check.

talents.name: Mightforge
talents.description: Your magic embodies raw power and force, casting spells that enhance physical might or crush obstacles.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your Strength Check is your spellcasting check. You have Spell points equal to your Strength Check. Regain 1 spell point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Gain an additional spell point each time you triumph in a feat of strength or win a physical contest.

features.name: Armored Mage
features.description: You suffer no penalties from wearing armor.

progressionSteps.name: Forceful Barrier
progressionSteps.description: As a half-action, conjure a barrier of pure kinetic energy that grants [[1d6]] armor to yourself and an ally within short range that lasts for 1 minute.

progressionSteps.name: Stone Skin
progressionSteps.description: Gain +5 Armor and +5 Wounds.

progressionSteps.name: Titan's Might
progressionSteps.description: Increase your physical might, allowing you to lift, push, or break objects deemed impossible for ordinary beings.

progressionSteps.name: Thunderous Leap
progressionSteps.description: Utilize your strength to perform a powered leap that causes a shockwave upon landing. As an action, jump to a location within medium range, dealing [[1d6]] thunder damage to all enemies within reach range of the landing spot.

progressionSteps.name: Berserker's Mage
progressionSteps.description: Channel your strength into a furious battle rage. As an action, enter a rage for 1 minute, granting you +5 to attack checks with melee weapons and +10 armor until the end of the minute.

progressionSteps.name: Earthquake Stomp
progressionSteps.description: As an action, slam the ground with your foot, creating a localized earthquake around you. Enemies within short range must succeed on a Strength check or be knocked prone and take 8 bludgeoning damage, halving the damage per success.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Wrest
progressionSteps.description: When engaging in a feat of strength or a contest of physical prowess, you can channel your mana to gain advantage on the check. This ability requires the expenditure of 1 spell point and can be activated as a free-action.

progressionSteps.name: Mending
progressionSteps.description: As an action, touch a piece of armor and repair it for +5 per spell point used.

progressionSteps.name: Iron Will
progressionSteps.description: You have advantage on checks, spells, and circumstances where your mental resilience is challenged by feats of endurance or psychological strain that would impose control over you or inflict a Cognitive condition.

progressionSteps.name: Intuitive Dodge
progressionSteps.description: Your keen instincts allow you to evade danger. Once per day, if an attack is to hit you, it does not.

talents.name: Ravager
talents.description: Your spells are born of the earth and the instinct to endure, casting spells that protect, nourish, or summon nature's fury.

features.name: Spellcasting Check
features.description: Your Survival Check is your spellcasting check. You have Spell points equal to your Survival Check. Regain 1 spell point on a Press On, all on a long rest. Gain an additional spell point each time you successfully survive from poison or disease, or find food or water in the wilderness.

features.name: Mana Hunger
features.description: Gain a resource of Mana Hunger that starts at 0. When this reaches 10, you enter Mana Overdrive that lasts for 1 minute, setting your Mana Hunger back to 0. While in Mana Overdrive, your spells cost -3 less, but the strain of the spells causes 1 psychic damage per cast. On a long rest, you can reduce your Mana Hunger by [[1d4]].

features.name: Mana Drain
features.description: As an off-action, you can tap deeper into your inner reservoir, gaining 3 temporary spell points that last until the end of your next turn but gain 2 Mana Hunger.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Ravager
progressionSteps.description: Harnessing the primal energies, your spell base damage is [[1d6]], and while in Mana Overdrive, it becomes [[2d6]].

progressionSteps.name: Mana Shield
progressionSteps.description: A surge of protective energy courses through your veins, granting +10 armor when entering Mana Overdrive.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Demon
progressionSteps.description: When you enter Mana Overdrive, get a +2 to checks and damage of your spells.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Siphon
progressionSteps.description: Hitting with a spell restores 1 spell point, and while in Mana Overdrive, you regain +1 wound.

progressionSteps.name: Overdrive Pulse
progressionSteps.description: When entering Mana Overdrive, enemies within reach range take [[1d4]] elemental damage.

progressionSteps.name: Ravaging Echo
progressionSteps.description: Gain +1 to check and damage when you cast a spell on the same target, and while in Mana Overdrive, gain +3 to the check and damage.

progressionSteps.name: Overdrive Push
progressionSteps.description: When entering Mana Overdrive, enemies within reach range must make a Strength check or be pushed 10ft.

progressionSteps.name: Mana Cascade
progressionSteps.description: When you make a critical hit, your spells deal triple damage.

progressionSteps.name: Overdrive Capacity
progressionSteps.description: You can choose to enter Mana Overdrive when your Mana Hunger reaches 5.

progressionSteps.name: Hunger Spender
progressionSteps.description: If you take the Injured Condition, you can spend your Mana Hunger and heal for your total of that resource, but you take the Coughing Condition.
